That anatomy book I read says men are usually bigger and stronger than us, so that's not much of a boast. Pick a fight with a man if you're going to brag.
Men really are creatures of combat, I see. Not even one round in and Mister Sunglasses is trying to start swinging at me.
H-hey, I'm a pilot, not a---a wrestler or something! Don't touch my face! Do men just brag about fighting all day?
...Hahaha. Hahahahah! Oh, Neptune! I think we know who the real goddess is at this table, don't we? If you can guess what's in my hand, that is!
...Mhahahahah! Hahahah! Neptune, I hope you're ready to see the hand I've got! That should settle this goddess matter between us!
Ohh, Natsuki, you're even cuter when you're embarrassed! You must get that a lot, huh?
Did I touch a nerve earlier, Natsuki? Is "cute" the first thing women call you when you walk in a room?
I can't help it, Natsuki---you are adorable! You must hear that all the time, right? Well, it's true!
Awfully defensive, Natsuki. Let me guess---I'm not the first gorgeous, tall, buxom woman to call you cute?
Oh, my! Am I intruding on your little field trip, kids? Well, you brought a man, so I'm interested.
Check out the classroom I got stuck with. Two cute girls and their little boyfriend---I can work with that.
Here I was hoping for Earthlings from all walks of life, and instead I get the galaxy's most awkward field trip. At least the schoolgirls brought a boy toy.
Three little Earth students? Some slender cutie, a four-eyed shorty, and a man! Let's play, kiddies.
How'd I get stuck on a table full of schoolkids? At least one's a man, but still---a daring fighter pilot really steals the show.
Hi there! I'm Jura, and...I really thought there'd be Earth women here. Oh well, more male nudity for us, right, Meia?
No Earth women at all? Yeesh. Well, we can handle these boys, can't we, Meia? Mejarians don't fear some silly men.
Jeez, all men besides us two. I'm kind of glad you're here with me, Meia.
Hm. I was really hoping for maybe one man, with some Earth women around to learn about fashion. What do you think, Meia? I know you're not big on fashion...or fun.
Ugh! No men anywhere? What a waste. Sorry for dragging you here, Meia.
...I mean, I'd love to learn about Earth fashion, but really? All women? Meia and I are well aware of what nude women look like, thanks.
Oh, come on, they don't sex-segregate these games, do they? I dragged Meia here specifically so we could see men naked!
...Yeah, Meia and I are Mejarians, OK? We're familiar with women. Bring out some men!
All women? Well, tonight's a bust. We might as well have just showered together, Meia.
Oh, look, Meia, a group of women. How bizarre and outlandish and worth coming to Earth for.
Oh, is it time for Jura's close-up? Then look deep into my heart, ~player~...
...Jura has nothing to hide, ~player~.
Sunny as can be, right, ~player~? Barnette, come here! Isn't hers just as cute?
Wasn't Jura's aura pretty? Hey, do us both! Barnette's coming by...!
...Wait, that little robo-thing was your friend? Well, why didn't you say so? I would've asked.
...Oh, my mistake! That little flying robot was your partner, wasn't he? I just saw a cute metal nugget and snatched it!
Oh, I let my heart get away from me! Ren-sou-hou-chan was so cute, I just snapped him up without seeing if he had a chaperone!
Oh, you must be that huggable little robot's bodyguard, huh? Sorry if I was holding him out of reach.
...W-what? Hey, what's with the attitude? R-remember who's armed here!
...What's your name again? Oh, Juri. But it's cute how we have similar names!
W-what's wrong with that? I thought it was cute! Don't get all snippy with me!
Jeez, I just got here! What's your problem, short stuff? You're getting all mad over a vowel?
Oh, I've seen men before. Don't get a big head. You're cute, but I happen to know a doctor who's just as handsome.
How characteristic of men to think they're the hottest stuff around. I've seen men before---in fact, I've killed my fair share.
My, aren't we presumptuous? Mister Jacket-and-Pants here thinks I've never seen a man before because Mejare is all women. I've fought men.
I have seen men before, Mister Jin, and you're a cute one. The real question is whether you can handle a Mejarian.
Ky...kyoo-bee? No...Mejare doesn't have many animals. Why do you look so scared?
Oh, Sayaka, there aren't many animals running around on Mejare. No white cat things for me...why?
Strange question---but I love how interested you are in my planet! There aren't many cats there in the first place---or any animals.
...Cat-things? Sorry, I haven't---Mejare barely has any animals wandering around. You ask some odd questions, you know that?
I'd like to think I look like the love of most people's lives, Chazz. But I must admit I'm not used to getting men's attention.
She must be quite the jewel, then, Chazz---and that fits what I've heard about Earth girls' conservative dress. It's good to know men appreciate my looks just as much.
Alexis Rhodes must be the talk of every runway on Earth, then, Chazz. How lucky you are to have her---and how lucky am I to be beautiful to both sexes.
Can you believe ~player~ is so bold? And carrying something so---of my time. Well, come on, then...I could always use another mugshot.

...Is that an aura camera, ~player~? Where did you even get that?
...And what are you waiting for?
...Tack-o? What's that? I just carry my rapier around for intimidation---and fashion.
...I didn't really get any of that, Aella, sorry. I'm a pilot first and a swordswoman second, so the dueling terms are lost on me.
Oh, this thing, Miss Meterstick? You've caught me in a bit of a lie---I have it to scare people! I'm not familiar with the technical terms.
I'm glad you noticed my lovely rapier, Armor Girl! I admit I'm not sure what you're talking about, though---it's mostly a fashion statement on my part.
Almost jealous? Looks like I need to doll myself up a little better. Oh, the tortured life of a pirate!
Why, thank you, Elizabeth! You're a cutie yourself, even if you're too shy to make use of it.
Ohhh, thank you, Elizabeth! I get a lot of admirers, but few just come out and call me beautiful. You're so sweet!
Don't be jealous! You're quite the looker yourself---better than I expected from Earth women. I guess you haven't let men mangle you.
Well, well, well! Look at that, Meia, a gender ratio we're used to. Let's see what this lone man has in store for us, shall we?
Just one little man playing? Watch out, handsome---we're Mejarians. We know how to handle you.
A lone man representing his sex? Well, Meia...this makes me wonder how our prisoners would do in that situation.
Ooh, a single man playing. What do you think, Meia? Does this one look like his seed is any good?
Just one man? Watch out---Meia and I aren't your average women. Hell, we're not your average Mejarians, either.
Just one man? Hey, Meia, what do you think his tube looks like? Should be easy enough to find out.
Now this is why we came here---to see a man naked. Mejare is all women, you know.
Hi there, handsome! I'm Jura, and this is Meia---and we've never seen a man nude. So you'll give us a good show, right?
Let's hope this one Earth man is more accommodating than the Tarakkians we know, eh, Meia?
Ohhh, just perfect! Girls to talk to, and one little man to focus on! Meia and I are from a planet full of women, you know...
Well, hi there. Jura Basil Elden, home planet Mejare. Sourpuss over there is my boss, Meia Gisborn. Try not to let her ruin the fun.
Hello there! I'm Jura, and the cutie in the bodysuit is Meia. We're just your average Mejarian citizens---that is to say, pirates.
Hi there! Jura Basil Elden. Blue hair is Meia Gisborn---she's a little miserable, but she's really a sweetheart once you get to know her.
Earthlings, I figure? I'm Jura, and over there is Meia. We're from Mejare, the planet of women---so don't think we can't handle ourselves!
Earthlings, are you? Watch out---Meia and I are fighter pilots, and we've dealt with you hostile Earth types.
Hi there! I'm Jura, and bundle-of-sunshine over there is Meia. Watch yourself---she's my boss, and she's no pushover!
Hi there! Jura Basil Elden. That blue-haired bombshell is Meia, my squadron leader---I kind of dragged her here, so be nice.
Hi there! I'm Jura, and blue-hair-bodysuit-scowl is Meia. We're from Mejare...and she's a little shyer than I am.
Hello, Planet Earth! I'm Jura Basil Elden, and Sourface over here is Meia Gisborn. We're friends, but she won't admit it.
Mejarian beauties, taking center stage! Sorry to make you all feel inadequate, but it's our claim to fame.
Oh my God, Natsuki! Look at how teeny-tiny you are! I just want to give you a big hug and a lollipop!
Ohhhh, Natsuki, you're so adorable! You barely come up to my shoulder, you little thing!
What are you doing here? You're as teeny-weeny as Paiway, our little child nurse!
Oh my God! Natsuki, you're like a pint-sized mini-woman! It's the cutest thing!
Ahhhn, my grand reveal...hmm? Cherylll,what're you so anxious about? The more you're seen as beautiful, the better.
Haaaahn...heeey, Cheryl, do you know what my motto is? "You don't lose anything by being seen."
Aren't you ever going to get me out of this thing? It's starting to ride up...hey now, Elf-girl, why are you pitting me against my crewmate?
Do you think a look at my backside might distract you? ...Oh, I admit I don't do as many squats as Meia does.
I'm still not even naked. This is a bit sad...oh, don't put my butt up against Meia's, French-fry. Her breasts are modest, but she works out!
Every angle of my beauty should be displayed, don't you think? ...Oh, I'll admit my butt doesn't have Meia's tone, Potato-girl.
So, how do I look from this angle? And this one? ...Are you trying to make crewmates fight, Pointy-ears? Shame on you.
I don't know why it bothers girls so much when they're seen. I have nothing to hide! ...Oh, thank you, Lucina. I'm glad I could inspire a girl who wouldn't show her face before...
And how does this angle look? Hahahaha! ...Well, why wouldn't I be confident, Lucina? Do you see a flaw or a blemish?
I'm feeling so adventurous, standing here in the nude! My beauty admired from every angle...oh, she definitely would mind, Sayaka, but just don't touch.
Hahaha! I always say I don't mind being seen, but now I have to put it to the test, as a bunch of foreigners gaze at my supple behind. ...That means you, Sayaka. Barnette's pretty jealous!
...We aren't fighting, Megumin. Besides, I'd just feel dirty drawing my sword against a girl who barely reaches my chest.
...I don't know if you noticed, Megumin, but this is a poker game. I guess everything feels like a fight to survive when you're such a little pipsqueak.
Oh, boy. You short girls always have something to prove, don't you? We're not fighting here. And if we were, I'd just hold my arm out and let you flail against it.
Perhaps you should train your pilot's eye, Megumin. You could see from the very beginning that they weren't attached.
A fighting witch girl should be able to notice things like detachable pieces from the enemy. I suppose we're not all blessed with an eye for such details the way pilots are.
Do you think I look just as good from this angle? Quite a bit is hidden...oh, thank you, Lyralei. They're hard to see, but picture my hips as another bow to string...

From the back, I think my hair obscures most of my frame's more subtle qualities.
...Mhmhm. Why not spin around, Lyralei? Show us what else quivers.
Is this too much of a tease? My hair actually preserves some of my modesty...oh, thank you, Lyralei. This side doesn't get as many compliments!
You should all feel lucky I keep my hair short enough that you can even see my butt. Mhmhm...why don't you get more adventurous yourself, Lyralei?

Do I...maybe look better from behind? No, there's too much hidden away, right?
...Self-pity isn't healthy, you know, Sola. Mhmhm.
I wonder if some prefer the obscured look. Just a pillowy little behind and some long flowing locks...oh, thank you, Sola. Don't beat yourself up too much.

state.text:
Hm...I won't get to show off much of my other side at this rate, will I? Well, what do you think?
...Thanks for the rambling, Wheatley.

So...do you like what little you can see in the back?
...Don't fry your circuits thinking about it too hard, Wheatley. Just let your partner enjoy the show.

That little thong starts to sting after a while...do you think my backside really needs it to look good?
...Well, as usual, we've got Wheatley's opinion.

Sometimes I get a little anxious that my looks are all in the clothes---you've barely seen me from behind! Well, here...
...Still nothing, Chell?

case.state: Heehee! I feel so daring tonight! ...Oh, pipe down, Daria. This is a human woman's butt.
How's my rear? I feel so adventurous! ...Listen, this sort of butt is only alien to you.
...Is this what you do? See a butt you don't have the measurements for, and declare it alien? Take a good look?
Are you sure about that, Four-eyes? How's the texture? The bounciness? Seems human to me.
...You're not going to sneak off, right, Meia?
I hope you're committed to this thing, by the way. Don't make some excuse like scouting up in orbit.
So you're definitely sticking around? No leaving me behind, and no excusing yourself halfway through.

It's a good thing we stuck together, Meia.
...That means I don't want you leaving, OK?
...Miss Jessie, are men really such simple animals? It's not like my outfit is modest, you know---what should I be doing, bending over and spreading?
...Hey, Miss Jessie. Are you serious that men just need some nudity, and they'll fly into a lust? I'm not exactly covered up---do I just throw my dress off and dance?
...Hey, what were you implying with that little comment, Mr. Dunban? You're not interested in me?
..."Not all men are interested"? Is that your way of letting me down easy, Mr. Dunban? How's that for up-front?
...I guess I really did sit at the wrong table. "Not all men"...you're sparing my feelings after telling me to share them.
...Hey, Mr. Dunban. Don't you think I make my intentions clear? I'm not any shyer in private.
...Ugh. Who do you take me for, Mr. Dunban, some kind of shrinking violet? I'm a---a brilliant sunflower! I thought that was obvious.
I think seduction is the one thing I've missed since meeting Barnette...it was fun watching girls stammer! Now I have to go steady...
It was a lot of fun flirting around, wasn't it? Seeing how quickly I could get a kiss...Barnette was tough, but she always melts to the same old thing.
What? ...Y-you didn't seriously get a royal flush? This has got to be some kind of trick---!
What now, Neptune? ...What, you actually got a royal flush? Dealer, did you just screw me over to make a joke?

Gimme!
Mmm, I can smell it through the package...what can Jura do in return?

Yaaaaayy!
Mmm, so delicious...I can already tell. Jura has to repay you somehow...

Give it here!
Oh, it's so big...and the smell! Sweet and rich and intoxicating. Jura should give you a gift, too...

Yaaay!
Hmhm, I could think of so many ways to pose with this...but I just want to eat it! And I bet you want a reward...
You're not here to answer personal questions? Oh, but you're willing to show very personal areas? Earthlings.
I don't think any appeals to your privacy work in a game where we spread ourselves out for a crowd, Korra.
Oh, please. I might respect your privacy in a game of hopscotch, Korra, but this is Get Your Boobs Out: The Game.
Did everyone hear Miss Korra? She's fine with spreading her legs for us, but god forbid you try to make it social.
...Hey, Jojo-girl, why are men so scared of impregnating me? That's all I want one for!
...Hey, Jolyne, what do you mean, I can't tell men I want their seed? That's why I'm trying to seduce one in the first place! What's the big deal?
...Why are men so scared of making me pregnant, Jolyne? Is it painful for them? You sound like you've tried and failed at this yourself.
I see you're still mulling things over, Laevatein. Surely you've heard that sort of thing before---or has you entire life been lived on a code of honor?
...Oh, I'm---sorry. Your sister... you mean, she died, or...?
You can't get a man to like you, either, Cynthia? Ugh. Do they just not like blondes or something? Or do they consider black outfits a sign of evil?
...If you can't seduce a man, either, Cynthia, then maybe there's a pattern here. Could black and yellow colors trigger some kind of fear response in men's brains?
...You too, Cynthia? Even an Earth woman who looks just like me can't get men's attention...maybe men just hate our look. The same way orange traffic cones mean "danger."
"Hugging them tightly" and "hand-holding," huh, Cynthia? I guess you're not that different from Mejarian girls. Barnette just melts when I hold her, too.
...Apparently women are the same no matter what planet we're from, Cynthia. I do plenty of "hand-holding" and "hugging" with Barnette.
...Hey, Miss Copycat. Don't think I didn't hear that little jab you made before. Where do you get the nerve, calling me old? I happen to be 20.
...Just so you know, Cynthia, I heard you try to drag me into your midlife crisis earlier, and I don't appreciate it. I am not pushing 30---I'm 20!
...By the way, I heard that little comment you threw in for the Birthday Girl, Miss Champion. The next time you call a girl who's just turned 20 an old hag, look in the mirror first.
Um...did I bring up a sensitive topic for you earlier, Arash? You seem like you've got potent seed. I've heard Earthlings have had trouble reproducing.
...Oh. I'm sorry, Arash, are children a touchy issue? I remember hearing that reproduction got more difficult on this planet over time, to the point that even cloning failed.
...Why can't you have kids, Arash? You look handsome and healthy to me. Wait---is this about the reproduction problems I heard Earth had, where DNA started to fall apart?
...I appreciate your enthusiasm, Megumin, but I don't think blowing things up gets men's attention. I do that every battle, sometimes with a man in the cockpit.
...Megumin, do you think I'm some kind of civilian? I'm on the front lines causing explosions in my Dread whenever we scramble, and the men haven't fallen for me.
...I should remind you that I am a fighter pilot, Megumin. My Dread has plenty of explosive power, and the men aren't budging. Are you saying I focus too much on defense?
...You really think that's why I can't coax seed out of a man, Megumin? I've destroyed plenty of enemy forces in my Dread---I just tend to pick a defensive loadout, that's all.
So, I'm about as old as your daughter, Miss Jessie? What a coincidence---you look old enough to be my Fama! Now, you had this baby with a man, didn't you?
All joking aside, you don't look so bad if you're old enough to be my Fama, Miss Jessie. And as I understand, you had your daughter with a man's seed, right?
How do you think my home planet works, Miss Jessie? All you have to do is fuse eggs together for two women to have a daughter.
I am standing here before you, aren't I, Miss Jessie? My parents were both women, just like all my crewmates. It just takes a little science.
Women can have daughters together, Miss Jessie---you can thank Mejare's technology for that. The Oma donates an egg for the Fama to carry.
You're so naive, Miss Jessie. Do you really think you can only have children with a man? Mejarians splice eggs together all the time---oh, I'd love for Barnette to get me pregnant!

So, I'm supposed to cook for a man, Miss Elfie? I suppose you've been trying the dishes yourself. But it can't just be the food---Barnette's cooking hasn't won one over for me, but they love what our trainee makes.
Hah...of course it comes down to food with you, Erufuda, even in seduction. I noticed men love food, but Barnette cooking for them hasn't been enough to bend them to my will.
...So, Elf-food, keep men eating until they eat out of my hand? If only it were that simple. Why do they ignore my girlfriend's cooking but eat whatever our trainee serves?
...Miko, did you seriously tell me to arrange my marriage? We hardly have any parents left to do that for us. Is that a common practice on Earth?
"Arranged marriages," Miko? I see men are such bad lovers that Earth women are forced to wed them. No, thank you.
...I'm not sure you understood what I asked, Miko. "Chastity" and "seduction" don't really go in the same sentence.
...Miko, I think "seduce" might mean something different on my world. You know, flirting and caressing, not chastity and poetry.
I'm not sure your little body could handle a pregnancy, Miko. Those tufts on your head are wider than your hips.
I suppose the political class has evolved beyond the need to dirty themselves with pregnancy, Miko. You're not much bigger than a baby yourself.
Perhaps you've just wasted away on your throne, Miko, but you're right, motherhood seems like a poor fit. You'd need breasts and hips for that.
I appreciate the advice, Biker-Girl, but we've been intimidating men into submission for a long time. It's made them quite afraid that we'll eat their livers.
Oh, you don't have a fraction of the man-scaring experience I do, Saki. Men only seem to respond to intimidation by, well, being intimidated.
As far as I can tell, Saki, men's little rod-organs shrivel up when they're frightened. Otherwise we'd have seen one poking out in a raid by now.
I've been "showing men who's boss" for as long as I've been a pirate, Biker-Girl. All that's taught them is to flee from me in terror.
I think you and I may have similar experiences, Saki. Men see a big, tall, imposing woman, and they go knock-kneed. In your case, you just yell a lot.
Well, I don't consider myself the streetfighting type, Saki, but I hold my own in a world of rough-and-tumble pirates. Barnette didn't like me until I showed some grit in a crash.
"Kicking ass" is a good way to impress girls in a pirate gang, too, Saki. My girlfriend's more of the hard-boiled gunslinging type.
So Earth girls aren't that different from Mejarians, then, Saki. I showed Barnette I "got guts" after a decoy explosion trap, and now look at us---madly in love.
I'm actually more delicate than you'd expect a pirate to be, Biker-Girl. I never got picked on much since a had a dozen centimeters on the others, but Barnette... she wasn't impressed at first.
...What's wrong with me having a baby, Erufuda? I'm "responsible" enough to keep my waistline in check!
You're one to make implications about responsibility, Elf-girl. You don't even take responsibility for your own beauty, let alone a baby!
Our communications officer looks as thin as she always has now that her daughter's born, Erufuda. Maybe you'll gain weight if you use your pregnancy as an excuse to wolf down French fries.
I'm fairly confident I can keep the baby fat at bay, Elf-girl. If you got pregnant, I'm not sure you'd even notice.
"Loud noises," hm, Galatea? That's an interesting idea---I might believe it, except the men I've met have fallen for girls who yell a lot more than I do.
...Are you calling me a loudmouth, Galatea? Anyway, your theory has some holes---we have a trainee who's always yelling about UFOs, and she's got a man in love with her.
Whispering is a nice thought, Galatea, but I think you're just supposed to be quiet in art galleries. Besides, I'm far from our ship's biggest chatterbox, and I still get passed over.
Oh, I've tried the seductive whisper in their ears, Galatea. It works so well on girls, but meanwhile, our childish trainee cries out just from seeing her man, and he's hooked.
Thank you, Chazz. Sometimes I'm overwhelmed myself just by looking in a mirror.
You aren't the first to say so, Chazz. There are full-body mirrors in our shower room, and stepping in front of one even makes my heart flutter.
Oh, I feel the same way, Chazz! I have to reason with myself that I'm not really so gorgeous, but then I see my reflection.
I've met some men before, Chazz---muscular ones, at that. We took some prisoner on our ship, which tends to happen when you fight the male soldiers of Tarak long enough.
Met? I fight men for a living, Chazz. A few have wound up in our brig because of that, so don't get so full of yourself.
"Chasing"? I thought she was the love of your life, Chazz. Well, I don't plan on making Earth my permanent home, so I suggest you settle for her.
The mere thought of my "tits" is going to have to sate you, Chazz. Otherwise, keep chasing Alexis. This is just a little Earth vacation.
What...? I'm sorry, Chazz, but you're just a little too obvious. I know men like that, but they're at least daring when it counts.
...Oh, Chazz, you can happily enjoy my body from afar. You've just got no elegance to the way you talk, and I haven't seen any gumption to make up for it.
...You didn't seem ready for parenthood anyway, Chazz. Or do all men hate babies for not being tough enough?
...You seem pretty childish for someone who hates babies, Chazz. Can't men appreciate them for being cute, or are you obsessed with usefulness?
...Have you considered feeding your nephew something healthy for a change, Chazz? It's true that babies can make disgusting messes of themselves, though.
...Ew, Chazz, your nephew is always vomiting? What are you feeding the poor thing? Of course, they can certainly be gross sometimes without puking...
You like feeling superior to an infant, Chazz? Men really do have fragile egos. You should be making the baby laugh!
...Jeez, what kind of bullies can men be, making fun of babies? Why don't you play peekaboo with them next time, Chazz, and make them laugh?
...Who's Atticus Rhodes? That didn't sound like seduction, Chazz, that sounded like drugging a girl.
...I'd "zone out" around him, Chazz? It sounds like your friend just takes advantage of girls. You shouldn't be bragging about it for him.
...Card games, Chazz? I see you men don't like to part with your seed for just anyone. But still, I'm not just anyone.
Oh, you're putting me through a test, Chazz? A card game, no less. I'll never understand how men think---I would've thought I'm the ideal female specimen.
...Don't patronize me, Chazz. If "blonde and big tits" were enough to get men's attention, our prisoners would be eating out of my hand. But they're just annoyed with me!
...Very funny, Chazz, but you've only described my looks. I know I'm beautiful, but the men on our crew still pass me by! What am I doing wrong?
If you want to see me as a seduction expert, Chazz, just look at the way girls turn their heads when I walk by. It's men I can't figure out.
Oh, I can seduce just fine, Chazz, if the seductee is a woman. Men just don't seem to pick up on the same signals.
...So, Deimos, men like women's legs? My dress is actually quite conservative there compared to some crew members---but their legs aren't quite as long as mine.
Women's legs...they're definitely an important part of our figures, Deimos. Most girls I know actually show a lot more leg---but I have a lot more leg to show.
If most men are like you, Deimos, then my height should actually prove quite advantageous. I have a lot of leg, after all...and yet I hide it beneath my dress.
...Deimos, you've never---seen a baby? My God. Those stories about men reproducing in factories must be true---and Nevada must be another Tarak.
...Apparently the men of planet Nevada make their babies in factories, just like Tarak does. How have you never seen a baby, Deimos?
Did you say you'd rather have a cat, Bernie? There's not too many of those on Mejare. Honestly, you remind me of a little baby yourself.
You'd be hard-pressed to find that pet cat of yours on my homeworld, Bernie. Prospective mothers usually care for something like a bird---maybe they could try caring for you.
I guess I can't speak to your passion much myself, Yusuke. I leave quite the elegant impression on an artist, though, don't you think?
"Speak to their passions," Yusuke? Well, I can speak to beauty better than this impression business. Don't you think I'm more of an art subject than critic?
...Hey. Ayano. If you want some general dating advice, try not to say creepy things like "removing obstacles."
...I may not be an expert on men, Ayano, but I don't think they like being creeped out any more than we do. So quit it with the weird phrasing.
Thank you for the compliment, Nami, but I'm serious. Our prisoners couldn't care less about peeking on me in the shower.
...Clearly you're attracting men somehow, Nami, and I'm not. I haven't gotten any shower-peeking from the men we captured---and I wouldn't even mind!
...You're thinking a little too pragmatically, Nami. I really did just mean seducing them---you know, like sliding into the jeans of a lovely Earth redhead.
...Nami, you know I wasn't really talking about getting girls "on my side." I meant more, how do I get an Earth girl on her side?
...Aren't you as old as I am, Nami? Life is short, especially for girls in the piracy business. You don't even need a man to make a baby where I'm from.
No wonder you don't have a baby if you're waiting for some male "father," Nami. And I knew lots of girls growing up who were pregnant by our age.
...If anything, Nami, piracy has kept me from getting pregnant sooner. Lots of girls on Mejare have kids by twenty---with other girls, of course.
...Very funny, Aster, but I know seducing a man isn't that easy. Our prisoners barely spare me a passing glance.
...Hey, don't make fun of me, Aster. Whatever your dozen wives did to seduce you, I know it took effort---I should have won over our prisoners with my looks by now.
...Well, I wish you happy and healthy kids whenever you decide to have some, Aster, but it sounds like your "seed" already has plenty of takers.
...No offense, Aster, but I'd rather my pregnancy-by-man to at least be a little unique. Tell your harem I wish them safe pregnancies.
...Come on, Leonie. A cutie like you, and not the least bit interested in romance? You even remind me of my little Barnette, adamant she'd ride solo forever.
...You know, Leonie, my girlfriend Barnette said she had no interest in dating when she joined the crew. So fiery and headstrong..so independent.
...You really do sound clueless, Lux. A stunning blonde like yourself, hopeless with other girls? "Kind and supportive" is what you do after you've seduced her.
"Kind and supportive" sounds like how you might keep a relationship, Lux. You're not so great at starting one, are you? Even with luscious blonde hair...
...I didn't learn about romance in school, either, Lux. Well, not in the classroom, anyway. I just told girls how I felt.
...Oh, Lux, you really are hopeless, aren't you? Dating isn't something you learn from a stuffy old instructor! Though I did spend school seducing a girl or two...
...Hey, Supernova, my life is hardly stable, either. That's why I dream about my beautiful baby daughter, before it's too late.
...I may not be jumping between universes, Supernova, but my life's pretty unpredictable these days, too. Doesn't danger make you want a daughter?
...You're not much younger than me, right, May? Where I'm from, girls have kids right out of school---but I guess there's no violent creatures running around.
I guess I might not want to raise kids right alongside the violent animals I'm taming. Well, if that clears up, May, you're pretty much the age Mejarians start getting married.
...Hey, Wii Fit. Don't you think being "in shape" goes without saying? Unless you're actually implying I need to slim down.
...Hey, you're not saying I'm out of shape, are you, Trainer? I mean, obviously you need a slim figure to get attention. That's Step Zero!
...Don't you think I have "fit body" taken care of already, Trainer? I mean, look at me. It's a bit insulting to even suggest that.

What is it now, Shouko?
...Well, maybe. But you know, I don't hate everything about Mejare. I want to fix it, not run off to some time warp.

...Yes, Shouko?
Oh, I don't know...Mejare's still my home. I mean, would you abandon "Japan" if it meant you got over your speech troubles?
Poems, Hu Tao? That's kind of old-fashioned compared to a photoshoot, but sure---extol my beauty.
Why not a poem about me, Hu Tao? Even my girlfriend hasn't done something so old-timey romantic like that.
Twenty. Can you believe what our refugee girl called me once? Old lady! I guess I felt that way when I was fourteen, but still.
Twenty, and that makes me one of our senior recruits. Then you add my size and my measurements...we have a girl who's fourteen, and she called me old!
Who said they're in public? Unless a girl starts wheezing halfway through conditioning.
Meia never says more than she has to. It's more like she spots a girl catching her breath all the time and reminds her that she can't compromise the team.
My figure doesn't slip. It's the envy of our whole crew for a reason.
Meia wishes she had my figure. Everyone does.
Aren't you, like, thirty or something, Miss Robin? What are you waiting for? Is your ship that busy all the time?
Running your crew must take a lot of effort, Miss Robin. You're pretty old to not have any kids. Don't tell me there's no takers!
...Hey, Noire. You're a goddess, and you can't find someone to babysit? Maybe you're just shy about getting there.
...It kinda sounded like you're making excuses, Noire. Too busy to have babies---too busy to fall in love? You should really make time for that.
...Noire, you read a book on how to be popular? I guess there's no magic spell for that, either, huh?
...Hey, Noire, you don't need to be a goddess to know you can't learn charisma from a book. What's going on with you over on your planet?
Ugh, what kind of question is that? Sheesh...ask Barnette. She lives for our close-quarters combat.
Do you really have to ask a pirate that question? If it comes down to that, it's Barnette who doesn't mind the mess...

Shut your mouth!
...Sometimes prisoners think I'm the weak link. One raid, a man tried to grab my sword, and---ugh, it took forever to wash the blood out!
Hmph! You'd think that, wouldn't you? One time, a prisoner thought he'd take the sword-girl hostage, and I had to slice him open! He bled on top of me!
Music should be to make a grand entrance! So anything big and booming, or fun and bouncy...um, am I rambling?
Music serves a purpose. Making my presence known! So elegant classical tracks, or funky techno, or dazzling disco---w-was that too much?
Ugh, you're so mean! Why shouldn't I talk about myself? You asked, and this is a game about showing ourselves.
Why are you like this? You ask a perfectly nice question, and it's still scary to try and answer it. I have nothing to be ashamed of!
I have a lot of friends on our ship, Kumatora. But the weird thing is, I get along with my squad leader, and she hates people. I even got her to come here.
It's not hard to make friends among crewmates, Kumatora! Oh, but there's one---my stoic squad leader, Meia. For some reason, we really gel...
Kumatoraaaa,mmm, I like anything Barnette cooks for me. But especially sweets...last year, she baked an enormous red velvet cake for my birthday!
Ohhhn, don't make me pick, Kumatora. There's lots of savory stews on our trapeza...but Barnette bakes with love. Like big red velvet birthday cakes...
Nickname? You don't want a nickname, Kumatora, you want a title! Princess Kumatora, making her debut---alongside Jura Basil Elden, the Red Claw!
You don't want people thinking less of you, Kumatora. That's what a nickname does. I'm Jura Basil Elden...and you're Princess Kumatora of Osohe!
Is singing an instrument, Kumatora? Sultry, sexy vocals with some girlish charm? I'd love to be an idol...
Heeey, Kumatora, there's no better instrument than your vocal cords. I sing solos in our choir, and everyone says I could do it full-time...
Ugh, that's a weird thought, Kumatora...living on a planet's surface with animals running around. I had a pet canary...I mean, a lot of girls did.
Hmmnn...you know, we say "on Mejare," Kumatora, but we really mean "in Mejare"---it's a fleet nation. Animals...I guess canaries?
Ohhhn, Kumatora, I haven't seen my parents in forever...but honestly, I got out ahead of them. I was pretty popular in school once I filled out...

Ahaha, Kumatora...puberty hit me pretty hard. My parents were scrambling to keep up with me flirting with other girls at school.
...While things lasted.
...Wait, couldn't you just PK Fire a bathtub or something? Hmmmph...I would love to fly. Without a ship, I mean. Oh, and shine a brilliant light...
With your---PSI, I bet you could just boil any basin you came across. I can only dream...dream of flying with my own body. And my own glorious spotlight...

Sheesh---you have superpowers, Kumatora! All I get for psychic power is headaches.
...And a planet-shielding mech.

Very funny, Miss Psychic-Powers. Actually, I have psychic powers, too---and they give me nightmares!
...And Vandreads.
...Hey, Kumatora, is that your big secret? Giggling? I wanna make them laugh! And swoon...and pledge to protect me!
...Kumatoraaaa, are you saying men all expect me to be some giggly little girl around them? Like I have to worship what they say...I want the attention!
Hey, Reimu, it was just a hypothetical. I know I wouldn't be able to pilot for a while...so I'd have to be pampered and protected!
Reimuuu, I didn't necessarily mean right now. If it happened now, we'd be down a pilot...oh, but Barnette would totally dote on me.
...I wouldn't think you'd have that much trouble charming other girls, Reimu. Not if they're dipping into your sake with you.
...You're kind of rude, Reimu, but you are pretty funny. Just them share your precious sake, and you'll figure out the rest.
...Reimu, don't you have, like, no men in Gensokyo to begin with? I was kind of getting nostalgic.
...Bunches of men, Reimu? I thought there were barely any running around in Gensokyo in the first place. It sounded a bit like home.
Extremely poor, but with good health...it's a weird choice when I'm living one of the options as we speak, Kumatora.
...So, you're asking if I'd trade things now to be rich and sick, Kumatora. I guess not, but that's not funny.
Ew, Kumatora, what kind of a choice is that? You shouldn't spend your time thinking up ways your life could be worse.
Kumatoraaaa, are you depressed or something? "What if you had to suffer every day?" I don't know, I don't want to think about that!
Ooogh...I like to play defensively, Kumatora, but that's a little much even for me. I mean, the point of being safe is so you can enjoy life.
There's not much point to life if you can't have fun with it, Kumatora. And that's coming from Miss Diffusion-Shield over here.
Is that your way of saying ~player.ifMale(you're dating|girlfriend)~?
Stalker? I must be missing something...
...Thanks for the advice, Bobobo, but my nosehairs are already perfect.
...Hmph. As if girls wouldn't kill to have nosehair as good as mine, Bobobo...

...Uhm, Bobobo, did you mean their butts?
...Barnette really likes that for some reason.
Oh, so...men poke around back there, too, Bobobo? That'd take some cleaning...but I'm actually used to it.
...Ew, no, Bobobo. I hate getting dirty. I'd be better off just tying one up...and giving him a sponge bath.
...If it takes rolling in mud to get a man, Bobobo, I think I'll just capture one. And hose him down for good measure...

...Hey, Bobobo, I am pretty strong. Pilots have to train, you know!
...But most men are still bigger than me.
...I don't think hitting a man is a good idea, Bobobo. I'm no weakling, but---I-I mean, look at you! You're all so big!

Just birds, like a lot of girls.
...Wait, what's "Carby"? That doesn't sound like a bird's name.
What kind of animal is "Carby," anyway? I was picturing a bird, but Earth has all sorts of things, right?
You can't make me pick just one way, Senko...oh, I guess it's my hair. I love when it's washed and warmed and set just right.
How good are you with hair, Senko? Making every loop silky-smooth and shimmering? Running soap along my head? Mmm...
That'd have to be our laser trimmers, Senko. I had to use blades for a while, when my unit got shut down---so stubbly!
Oh, laser shaving, Senko. My hair's not just impressive on my head! Trying to use old-fashioned stuff was an itchy nightmare.

O-oh, you mean---?
A-hem.
...Sometimes Barnette thinks I get too whiny. Jura has to prove she's a good girl...

P-punishment?
Like---O-OK.
Well...Jura doesn't always behave. S-so Barnette has to set Jura right...
Don't you visit any other planets, Senko? Mejare could really use some comfort.
Just Earth? People are tired on lots of planets, Senko.
We'd be happy to have you on Mejare, too, you know. You wouldn't happen to take the form of a crystal elsewhere, right?
One of the best things in life is to get pampered, Senko. That's not to say I can't give out a few hugs and kisses...
I'd rather be on the receiving end, Senko. So we're a good match! Besides, I can give some touching back.
E-eight hundred? A-ah...sometimes I have to hope I'll see tomorrow.
O-oh, wow, Senko. Umm...I worry about how I'll look when I'm thirty, if I make it that far.
How helpful, Senko What's the thing that attracts you---meat on a bone?
If I want to attract men, Senko, I just need to set out some food. Maybe I'll try that with you. You're both a little bestial.
Barnette had to take care of all her sisters growing up, Senko. I think she gets some satisfaction from it, too...just don't push too hard.
You really do like it for its own sake, huh, Senko? Barnette says cooking lets off steam... but other times, she's all steamed about it.
S-Senko, I'm not flirting with you here. I do like brushing my hair, so if you really want...
Intimate? Don't get the wrong idea, Senko---I-I hope I don't have the wrong idea. I can brush hair like nobody's business, though.
If you ask me, it's reasonable to expect a girl to be smooth and spotless. No one's asked you to shave your tail, right?
What, to shave? I guess that would be harder when you've got fur...but to not do it is a betrayal of female beauty!
...Ohhh. I don't like how you said that, Senko...
...Senko? T-that was---ominous.
I'm not sure I've seen a bunny in person, Arle...if you've got it under control, maybe you could show us.
Uhm, Arle...I don't have the best picture in my head of a bunny. Can you bring it here, maybe in a cage?
Or you could just have a sharp blade. What's the magic actually do? Oh, can you make a little bubble shield around yourself?
So cool! If there's more to the magic than it disappearing, I mean. Maybe it shoots lightning bolts?
Well, I'd tell you to put it in its sheath, but you're above that sort of thing.
It does look like you're about to attack us. This is why people invented sheaths.
So it's called "Rainfell"? Hmm, Jura should give her own sword a name...
"Rainfell" the Keyblade...it sounds cool, but soothing! My Dread has a name, but not my sword...
Galateaaaa, that sounds like heaven! Looked over from every angle, worshipped, adored, discussed! I'd wow them all...
And you complained about that, Galatea? All eyes on me...those critics wouldn't know what hit them! They'd be head over heels...
That's so aggressive, Leonie. What about...the Fiery Beauty? You can work on it, play up your legs somehow...
Is that all you want to do, Leonie? Chop off heads? Let the men do that, and go with something more elegant... "The Graceful Goddess!"

Mohn, that's like asking me to choose a child, Arueshalae.
...I mean, I don't have any. But a work of art needs the whole ensemble!
Ahhn, Arushaelae...I have dreams all the time. Strolling along a studded walkway in some fabulous dress...a legion of adoring fans taking pictures!
Ooh, don't remind me. I've been having all sorts of bad dreams lately---or more like visions. Always getting shot down---and the others see it, too.
...You wouldn't make yourself a little taller, Cagliostro? You know, more like a grown-up?
...Really? You're the best the female form can hope to achieve, Cagliostro? You couldn't use a few more centimeters---anywhere?
...With strangers, Fina? No, that's just slutty...but if you just mean in general, sheesh, you're sheltered. Showers, hot springs, locker rooms...
Me, Fluttershy? This kind of thing isn't glamorous enough. But our Reg chief is a real card shark. She loves dealing in between shifts.
Well, there's the Earth reason, Fluttershy, and the men reason. Both have been our enemy, and we've only seen both from afar...
Yeah, Gwen, and it's called Earth. And before that, men, from Tarak...it sure would be nice fighting only one enemy, singular.
Ohhhn, Gwen, our crew has a whole choir put together. It's one of my favorite get-togethers---I can sing a big solo, bathe in the spotlight!
Ohhn, that'd be cool, Gwen. A masked persona, the Red Claw, bringer of justice---and a model by day. Oh, but I'd want people to know who I am...
We're probably too time-removed to recognize anything the other says, Gwen. Maybe some sultry, classical stuff? And a long, deep kiss by candlelight...
My passion, Heris? Beauty, of course! All things powerful and elegant. When I see them, I have to make them mine...
I've never actually played for money, Mr. Raynor. I did fall in love thanks to danger and the whims of fate, as things would have it...
I like to sleep nude after---having some fun, Joey. Barnette always wakes up earlier than me. I'd like to think it's a wonderful image in the morning.
Hmm...I feel like I'm pretty easy to understand, Joey. Now, Barnette, I could list all sorts of things...guns, butts, and the butts of guns.
I've dreamed about that sort of thing, Joey. Imagine flying, soaring through space without a Dread! Or maybe just shining my own brilliant spotlight...
When you look as good as me, Joey, people think you're all looks. That's where I love proving them wrong. First sports, and now fighting!
I bet you looked at me, Joey, and thought I'm just around as our crew's poster girl. But I want to be a strong beauty---a heroine! That's why I'm a pilot.
Eating's not that sexy, Joey. I didn't bring anything. Now, being fed---that's romantic!
So, personality, huh, Joey? It shouldn't be hard to tell---someone who'll protect me. They're tough, and serious, and so passionate---hohhhnn!
Do you only mean this world, Lucina? Mejare is a beautiful purple jewel with twin asteroid belts---and our fleet orbiting it.
We'd never left Mejare, Nami, because there's a big magnetic storm around it. So who helped navigate it? Me, with my Vandread's powerful shields!
...You want me to say one thing, Nami? Well, it'd have to be my hair---it has to be set just right. Oh, but it could grow back...I don't know, I'm perfect all over!
Ahahaha...for all my measurements, Nami, I think the one I love most is the length of my hair. That's replaceable, though...it's so hard to say!

Tell you about Mejare, huh, Miss Robin?
...It's a lot like me. Strong, beautiful, and proud of itself...but not a whole lot to show for it.
Hmm. Well, anyone could've guessed that, Nanoko, from how awkward you are. Can't you find someone who likes computer games?
Ooh, I think I'd have to go with emeralds myself, Rouge. They match my eyes! Oh, but peridot matches my hair, and my birth month...
I don't suppose your friend likes to groom himself, Rouge? That doesn't match the men I know. But I'll do it all day, bathing, brushing my hair...
Are you kidding? That looks fun, and ten times sexier! I should learn to dance---I've got the footwork for a sword!
Mohhn, don't tease me with a wish, Shantae. I have all sorts of them...a famous career, and a peaceful home to have it in. Not being stuck as a pirate...
Hmm? I feel like I can read people pretty well, Takatoshi...I never chased girls that I thought were the types to go behind your back.
You seem like the type to have plenty of stories, Mr. Tobias. Shall I share the tale of my crashlanding with Barnette? It was a twist of fate...
I should be the one asking for money, Wikipe-tan. Well, supplies...food and fuel and pretty clothes. It's always stressful when we start running low.
Is there really anything at stake, Y'shtola? I don't think anyone will be opposed to seeing all of me...and I'm not opposed to showing it.
Yusukeee, you mean it? Would you take Jura shopping and pay for everything? I'd love to see what pretty clothes Earth has for sale...
I don't know, Estelle---when I want something, I just do it. And failing that, I ask Barnette. She never lets things go once she's decided...
Their neck, Elphaba? Uhn...I sort of like just flopping on top of someone. You know? Exploring all over. Not anywhere in particular...
Hmm...you know, I think I like short hair, Elphaba. Maybe I just have it long enough for both of us. Oh, and they've got to have nice, long legs---!
How do you think I got here, Arle? Some wormhole tossed us out of Mejare's system and into deep space. We've seen all sorts of worlds since.
I don't have to think, Arle. That's exactly what happened to us, and with some funky fused ship on top of that. We spent days just getting it to work.
I landed on a planet that was 99% water, Arle, and no mermaids. I could be a gorgeous one...oh, but then I wouldn't have my lovely legs.
Well, it's not exactly another universe, Mr. Colress, but we've had our run-in with wormholes. Our crystal core dumped us across the galaxy.
Being a doctor does sound pretty stressful, Miss Mercy. I'd say just find a girl you can flop onto and nuzzle...or a man, I guess.
Oh, sure, Miss Mercy. All the time, back in school. Well, we kind of thought we were serious, but our idea of "serious" was just making out...
Uhh...how big is a "group," Miss Mercy? I think inviting one extra girl to play with could be fun. Past that, it kind of seems like a mess...
Hmm, I do go back and forth, Miss Mercy. But that's half the fun! Sometimes you're giving, and sometimes you just want to cum for her so bad...
Hmph. Good question, Tsukasa. The men on our ship don't pay any attention to me! I'm hoping it's just their weird Tarak brains.
Good question, Panty...I've never seen a beach in person! I have to go out and feel the sand between my toes...and do some swimming!
Sorry, Ibuki, but our crew's already got musical talent. Us! Every so often we get together to harmonize and sing solos.
Isn't your voice the best instrument, Ibuki? I have a great one! The whole crew says I could make a living off it...you know, if not for the pirate thing.
On my pizza? Basil, of course! Basil is my middle name. And like me, it's got a lovely texture.
I can't help but twirl my hair around, Dwight. It gets ruined! Otherwise, I start pacing, or tapping my feet, or just curling up...

...Butts are dirty, Lyralei. Most girls agree with me---but you can find the exceptions.
...Like Barnette.
It's hard not to love nature when when you barely see any, Lyralei. The best we can usually do is the ship's terrace. It's a shame getting dirty, though.
Ew, no, Lyralei. I get it's your culture, or whatever, but where I'm from, it's like not showering...
...I guess if you live in a forest, Lyralei, shaving isn't as simple as lasering it at the root...
Oh, our spa staff holds yoga classes sometimes, Lyralei! I love holding a pose like that. It's like I can work out without having to work hard!
...You mean, redheads, Lyralei? Hmph. I think Earth expanded that definition to include everyone not born there...
...Plants can be dangerous, Lyralei? I've only seen pretty flowers and trees and things. Earth must be so strange...
Oh, I like birds, too, Lyralei! Especially canaries. As golden and beautiful as me---and we both take to the skies.
...Have you been listening, May? I live months away---and that's at warp speed.
Isn't there a gorgeous sea serpent Pokémon, May? The most beautiful in the world? It has to be mine.
...So, in other words, you passed up a chance to show off your Pokémon to show yourself off instead? I'd take it, May.
Are you kidding, May? Go for it! I should really learn to dance and put all my swordfighting footwork to use.
Oh, no, Kaz, I'm the humblest girl on our crew. And I'll brag about it all day whether you like it or not.
Ask the girl who's not welcome on her own homeworld, Kaz. Who knows if that'll ever change...
Have you ever gotten the full spa treatment, Kaz? I don't know what they'd do with a man, but the cleansing, and massage...I feel so refreshed!
Not really, Kaz, but more like someone who starts bad and then gets even worse. We ran into a bandit who scammed us and beat a pilot to a pulp.
I don't know, Syrenne---it depends how much you like fighting. I don't really train with my sword more than I have to.
Hey, Syrenne, I mean everything I say. Just because I might not do it doesn't mean I'm making fun...
Are you kidding, Syrenne? It'd be nice to see some different bodies in the bath for once. I've been with the crew for years now!
Word travels fast across the galaxy, Neptune. And so do wormholes, across space and time. As usual, we have the Paksis to thank...
If by someone else you mean a whole crew of girls, Neptune. And Barnette, when she isn't busy. I didn't even care when the men walked in.
A sounds about right, Suzuya. Barnette's likes heavy weapons, too. Jura is the rare, mysterious AB...
I'd love to see what Earth has for sale, Eichi! I haven't been able to shop in years...you can pay for me, right?
...Do you have something to tell me, Mitama? Don't worry, you're not the first---just make sure to put it poetically.
...You don't have to dance around it, Mitama. If you're already smitten, the only thing better than a poet crushing on me is a painter.
...You should definitely become a mom, Mitama. That'd inspire some poetry for sure. You'd just have less time to write it!
...What's more beautiful than a pregnant mother, Mitama? Or maybe a nursing one. It might be in your best interest.
...You're not sure about kids, Mitama? I don't think a poet should pass up the chance for that kind of life experience.
...Never consciously, Mitama? It sounds like you have some unwanted admirers back at camp.
...You'd think so, Mitama, but I haven't had any luck with our prisoners. Maybe Earth men are easier if you're apparently doing it by accident.
I don't really understand all the details, Mitama, but something about wormholes and time travel. I heard about it and gathered a scouting party!
A once-in-a-lifetime opportunity, Mitama--- flying through a wormhole. I led all our most daring pilots down to the surface...
Ahhh---ahnnnn...you're full of good ideas, Mitama. Jura is...feeling...sleepy, too...
Jura is cold and needs a nap...ohhn, Mitama, y-you---too? Mmmnn...muhuhu.

T-this kind of thing---puts Jura right to bed. A-all her energy just...flows...out.
Mohhuun...can Jura---use you as a pillow, Mitama...?
...W-were you serious, Revy? That doesn't make sense! Girls love it when I tell them how pretty they are...
...Revy, were you just making fun of me? Girls love being chased! Aren't we all supposed to be human?
...I-I'm not gonna hit girls, Revy! Maybe that's why you're single, huh? Who wants to be with someone mean and abusive?
...R-Revy, you've been complaining about being single half the time! If you want something that lasts, try not beating your girlfriends!
...Maybe having a baby would calm you down a little, Revy. Teach you to be sweeter? You'd have to quit smoking, though.
...Where I'm from, Revy, anyone can be a mother if they really want to. That means quit smoking, and drinking, and---being so mean.
...You're definitely more of an Oma type, Revy. You'd have a harder time finding a partner than having a baby---besides your smoke habit.
That's another perk of this dress. All the neckline space means a baby bump will fit nice and snug...if I unclasp the leg.
Haaahnn...I wouldn't even have to change my outfit! If I just loosen it around the leg a little, it'd stretch...and you could feel my pregnant belly!
Maybe we should just drop all pretenses---and the dress. If they stared at our beautiful naked body, they'd be powerless to resist...I think.
We might be overthinking this whole thing. We'll march right up to one, completely nude, and they'll surrender their seed in seconds...right?
...What can I say, Meia? I've matured. I'm looking for partners now, not flings...before I die too soon.
I guess you could say flirting was my teenage hobby, Meia. Then I met the love of my life---and a little brush with death for some perspective.
...It sounds like you're the curious one, Meia. Do men excite you in a way girls never have?
...You said it, Meia, not me. Maybe you're more compatible with men, and you never realized it.

condition.said: Blades take up the roles of mothers

case.state: ...Hey, Kora. Did you mean adopting a baby, or can a Blade get pregnant? I really can't tell how human you are...
...What'd you mean by a "mother's role," Kora? I mean, whether you're human on the inside or not...
...Hey, Mia, I never thought about what you said before. I mean, having a male baby? A-a boy, I mean. That's weird...
Uhn, Mia, you said that so casually! The idea of having a---a boy. Like it's the same as a girl!
...Can't you just alchemize a body that is fertile, Cagliostro? W-wait...does this have something to do with Earth people's DNA? We heard about some issues...
...Ohh, Cagliostro. That's what eventually happens to everyone on Earth, right? Your DNA gets messed up and can't reproduce---that's why we were settled.

state.text:
Ahhhn, I'd love to, Shouko! I've been practicing my autographs! Barnette, you too!
{barnette}I-I barely know her...

Huh? Ohhhh! Shouko, this is my first autograph! Bar-neeette, I've got a fan already!
{barnette}I don't feel like I've been around enough to sign...

Ahaha! Barnette, you've made a friend! Jura can't believe it...
{barnette}But you believe getting yourself a fan, I bet.{!reset}
Naturally!

case.state:
Hmm, men's passions...that's what you meant, right, Yumeko?
...It's mostly just food with them. Or combat...
...So it's all about what they want, is that it, Yumeko? Men and their "passions"...food and fighting.
Rouuuge, how can you be so coldhearted? Having a baby is one of the most wonderful things you can do! Think of how well you'd feed her!
