Shouko...? I think you should have learned some communication techniques, personally. But sure, go ahead.
I am not desperate, Cynthia---I'm curious. If you must know, I'm excited about the fame making a baby with a man would bring me on Mejare.
It's not an obsession, Cynthia---it's an opportunity. Don't you realize how famous I'd be on Mejare if I had a baby with a man? Just think about it!
You don't look that bad, Cheryl...ahaha! Don't compare yourself to me! Just dress how you like!
Ohhhh, thank you, Cheryl...it's not like you aren't pretty. No one could ever dress up if they had to look like me...
You say that like your own dress isn't perfectly elegant, Galatea. I think you may be more jealous of the shape I give mine.
Oh, Galatea, you flatter me. It's not like you're wearing rags, you know---what's got you so dissatisfied?
Oh? You're wearing such an elegant dress already, Galatea. Do you just want to show a little less skin? Or are you jealous of something in my dress?
Ensign Dread pilot on the Nirvana, PA-15, thank you very much. This sword is for the occasional ground mission.
Why, yes, "Florence," I am. Sub-team leader of the Nirvana's Dread fighters, in fact. But outside of my cockpit, I need a sidearm, of course.
Well, this rapier is my personal sidearm, "Florence." Beauty needs to be defended. But of course, I normally do that from my position as a high-ranking Dread pilot.
And what's given you that impression, exactly? I pilot an advanced fighter craft---you pilot a cardboard box.
Excuse me? At least I've graduated from cardboard-box spaceships to real ones. If I'm a bimbo, I'd hate to know what an imp like you must be.
How am I threatening you with my..."jugs"? You must have quite the modest chest yourself if you feel threatened by my beauty.
"Alien jugs"? Something about that box tells me you feel threatened by almost everything. Are you jealous of my pretty face, too?
Oh, do I, Myriam? Well, I shouldn't be surprised---it's not every day a gorgeous exotic beauty descends upon this humble planet with tales of adventure!
Well, I should be quite newsworthy, Myriam. I'm a generational beauty even on my homeworld, and yet my life is full of daring exploits in space!
Uh...I'm neither of those, Neptune. I think you need to expand your definition of pirate a bit to include daring fighter pilots.
I'm the kind of pirate who pilots a magnificent Dread fighter in a struggle against the powers that be, all while remaining beautiful. I don't know what you're on about, Neptune.
Are you still on about that? My sword skills are quite respected in the Magno Family, and I've made sure the Mejarian army respects them, too. I'm not dueling a child.
Why are you still bothering me about swordfighting? I'm not going to duel a little kid playing goddess in the schoolyard. My blade has drawn blood from actual soldiers.
Eugh. I didn't take up swordfighting so some twerp with plus-signs in her hair could pester me. Our crew trusts me enough to wield that thing in raids against armed imperial soldiers.
I see you, Shouko. What is it? ...Oh, you have a handsome male friend? I'm glad he understands how important it is to look good...can you describe him for me?
I see you, Shouko..."Naruse"? Well, I can't say I'm not curious how beauty manifests in an Earth man. I'm all too familiar with the ideal female form.
Shouko...? How does such a shy girl have so many men in her little circle, anyway? Well, what does a beautiful Earth man look like? Is he tall? Blond? Sharp-eyed?
...No, Shouko, you can't have her. But seriously, am I already starting to convert Earth girls to our lifestyle?
Yes, Shouko? Oh, I see you're already getting curious about the woman's touch. Ask away.
...Sorry, Shouko--- Barnette has eyes only for me. But if you'd like to find a girl to call your own, I can help.

Yaaay, it's time! Time for my beauty to break its bonds...
...Yes, Shouko?
...Hey, what do you mean? I know I like to flirt, but---!

Ohhn, my big moment is here!
...Shouko? I---uh, Shouko, where's this coming from, exactly...?

Finally, the spotlight shines on Jura!
...I see you, Shouko...s-sleep with others? When did I say that?
...Well, I don't brave the vacuum of space in this dress, Cynthia. We have suits for that. There's such a thing as casual clothing when we're on the ship.
...Being a "space traveler" doesn't mean I'm constantly in a raid suit, Cynthia. Why would I wear that on the ship, or when we've docked on a planet?
Well, I'm best known for being a high-ranking Dread pilot, Galatea. My sword is more of a personal sidearm for ground missions.
Oh, I wouldn't call myself a swordswoman, Galatea. It's really a side skill to my work as a fighter pilot on a Dread team.
My---anatomy? Unless you Earthlings have done a bad job stitching organs together, Miss Jessie, my body should be like yours. Except better.
Er...Mejare wasn't colonized that long ago, Miss Jessie. I have the same female body you do, except, you know, younger and more beautiful.
...Well, there's not a whole lot of room for that, is there, Miss Jessie? I couldn't stuff one of those men's rods into this thing.
What could I even be hiding, Miss Jessie? This thing is a few strips of fabric stretched against my hips. I know men have those bulges in their underwear.
Do you see anything extra peeking out, Miss Jessie? I don't suppose you subscribe to the Tarakkian theory that a tentacle will slither out of me.
My hobbies, Neptune? God, we have to fly out so often these days, it's hard to get lost in anything else. I mostly hang out with Barnette, brushing my hair while she cooks.
I hardly have time for hobbies these days, Neptune. We could be called to scramble at any moment! And the rest of my time is with my darling Barnette...
Countries? A small girl like you has to think a lot bigger than that, Megumin. Mejare is a beautiful little blue planet settled by Earth women.
Mejare isn't a country, Megumin. Don't tell me Earth is still carved up into little pieces like that---we've got whole planets as colonies now, just like my homeworld.
Oh, you flatter me. No, I'm not a princess. I'm just a lowly pirate, though one who has climbed through the ranks of the Magno Family outfit.
A princess. You're giving me too much credit just for looking nice, Megumin. I'm an outlaw--- a pilot for the Magno Family pirates, in fact.
Hmph. Pirates are girls just like you, Megumin--- we've just got nowhere else to go. I don't let that stop me from looking my best.
Girls don't become pirates for fun, you know. Anyone with no home to go back to can fall into it---that could be you one day, Pipsqueak, and you'd still want to brush your hair.
Well, I do fight on the front lines, Megumin, thank you very much. In fact, I've assumed command of our Dread team in several emergencies.
How surprised you would be, then, to see my brilliant red fighter leading the charge of our assault team. I answer only to our squadron leader, Explosion-Girl.
Oh, well, thank you, Jim. I always try to look my best---and that includes when I'm naked.
I don't think it's a shame at all, Mr. Raynor. You'll find that a dress is only as good as the body that fills it.
Oh, Jim, I wouldn't be very beautiful if it were all in the dress. As I like to say, you don't lose anything by being seen.
Strip poker is certainly not my usual thing, Mr. Raynor. I spend most of my time fighting in deep space these days.
I'm glad you think I'm too refined for a game like this, Jim, but I'm not some socialite. I'm a pirate defending her crew as we traverse the galaxy.
I suppose you think ballroom fundraisers are my usual "thing," Mr. Raynor? A young pirate in a strip bar makes sense---but I actually spend my time defending our ship.
Oh, I wear this all the time, Mr. Raynor---it's a combat dress. It's unfortunate, but I don't have too many others like it.
Well, try as I might to find better clothes on a raid, Jim, this dress just hasn't been topped in elegance or combat performance. Of course I'd wear it to strip poker.
Shouldn't I look my best for my grand debut on planet Earth, Mr. Raynor? Besides, I haven't found much else---I wear it to breakfast, and I wear it to battle.
Well, excuse me for being a pirate, Mr. Raynor. I don't have a wardrobe full of casual wear. Do you know how hard it is to steal clothes that fit me?
Clothes are just clothes, Miss Jessie. Imagine having to power the things just to wear them properly.
Not everything needs to be high-tech, Miss Jessie. People perfected clothes before space travel---now we just make it look good.
I've always been more concerned with the figure underneath a dress, Miss Jessie. Why would you wear something that could electrocute you?
Ehehe...are you sure about that, Miss Jessie? A pirate never reveals herself until she has the advantage.
Mhmhmhm. Do you know what a pirate's goal is in any conflict, Miss Jessie? To deceive.
Oh, I'm feeling quite comfortable, Old Lady. In fact, I only need to lighten my load a bit further.
My, Miss Jessie, aren't we projecting? I'm used to this dress, and to the spotlight. I think I'll just drop another little thing.
What do I have to be insecure about, Miss Jessie? I'm sure you remember being young and unwrinkled.
Maybe if I had sagging breasts like yours, Miss Jessie, I'd feel shy about revealing them. As it stands...
Having a daughter must make women read too deep into everything girls do. I'm just having fun, Miss Jessie! Don't you remember that, along with being young?

condition.saying: signed up for strip poker, Blondie

case.state: You're quite the seductress, aren't you, Biker-Girl? I've been getting "tits and ass" praise since puberty, so you'd better have more creative compliments.
Speeding along in your biker gang doesn't leave you much time to put my "big tits and ass" a little more romantically, does it, Saki?
I'm glad to have filled the quota for this table's beauty, Saki. We'll see if you're who I wanted to play with, since you're a little coarse with your words.
I'm an alien in the technical sense, Chazz. I wasn't born here, but I'm as human as you. Assuming, of course, that men and women really are the same species.
...Well, I can't strike big butt off that list, Chazz, but I'm not an alien. I'm just a simple, beautiful human girl, born on another world. Not that I really know if men are humans.

condition.saying: I only just learned of space travel.

case.state: It is easy, Galatea! How do you think I flew here? Humans colonized my homeworld by pioneering easy space travel.
Well, that's because it is easy, Galatea. I know you struggled to put satellites in the sky centuries ago, but Mejare only exists because reaching orbit is like waking up in the morning now.
Don't you like my dress, Yuri? I think it's quite sophisticated while remaining combat-practical.
Why, yes, Yuri, this is my favorite outfit. In what else can I look so elegant, yet still wield a sword and dash to the hangar?
Oh, yes, Yuri, I'm almost always dressed like this. It just screams elegance and dynamism, don't you think?
..."Nevada," Deimos? I can't say I've ever heard of the place. I do know a planet where there aren't any girls---it's right next to my home---but I thought it was the only one.
Ah, are you a foreigner, too, Deimos? Maybe Mejare's sister planet Tarak isn't the only colony with a no-females policy. I'm sure you're happy to be off planet "Nevada."
Unlike you, Perona, I need a ship to fly. So my dress is tailored for combat purposes, in addition to hugging my body quite nicely.
Even without the luxury of levitation, Perona, I don't need my dress weighing me down and restricting my legs in the middle of battle. Its elegance is a nice bonus.
Hm? No, I'm not a model, Amy, though I agree I have the credentials. I'm just the galaxy's most beautiful pirate.
Oh, modeling might have been my career path in another life, Amy. As it stands, I'm stuck making a life of piracy as elegant as I can.
...Yes, I like girls too, Amy. You might say I started that way, and that men are a curious new element.
...I'd say girls are nice to have around, Amy. Men have made my life quite a bit more complicated as of late.
I suppose if I say yes, then it won't be unsolicited. I just hope you can get the entire thought out before you see a spider crawl by.
I don't see how it could hurt. Now, try to concentrate, Amy, or I might just learn some spider facts.
What you said earlier about not being confident in my own appearance, Amy? I can hold a crowd's attention just fine fully dressed.
I'm sure that modest mentality gets a girl like you very far, Amy. I don't even need to strip to draw all eyes in a room, thank you.

condition.saying: up to the task or not

case.state:
Oh, I guess I finally have to put my body where my mouth is.
...Yeah, yeah, Amy, don't get too excited before the big reveal.
Oh, I'm glad I could finally get Miss Eight-Eyes's attention. I wasn't wearing an overcoat here, you know.
Ahem. I think you might be projecting a bit, Amy. This is hardly the sort of thing that'd make me...sweat.
I've kept my head straight in times far worse than standing nude at a poker table, Amy. You might be getting all worked up at the sight of me.
And just where do you think my ancestors came from, Hermione? Surely with your magical powers, you've been out to space yourself.
The beautiful blue planet of Mejare, Hermione. Settled, of course, by spacefarers from Earth! Shouldn't you know a spell for interstellar travel?
I am human, Hermione. A human descended from daring Earth women on frontier starships! All your magic spells, and you don't know about space travel?
You "look" like trouble. Men's fashion seems to hide so much of themselves already, and you won't even tell me your name, "Fate."
You want my opinion on men's fashion? You all seem to pile on as many layers as you can, even your own names. Who goes by "Twisted Fate"?
My whole crew is female, Nami. As is my whole planet. What's driving all the Earth men to piracy?
Nami, you can't expect a Mejarian pirate crew to be anything but all female. I figured Earth pirates would be 50/50---what's with all the men?
Oh, is the ghost girl suddenly looking for advice? Try planting your feet for once and letting your assets bounce around.
I've found walking to be an excellent start for a sexy look, Perona. You can actually sway your hips with gravity.
Mejare has a gorgeous night sky, Galatea. It's got twin asteroid belts surrounding it, and they catch the light and glitter...there's beauty in danger, I guess.
Nighttime here must look clear and peaceful, Galatea. On Mejare, you'd see all its asteroids shimmering...I guess we're all about risking our lives for looks.
...And what happened after that, Miss Cynthia? The men and women bonded over their love for "Pokuhmon"?
I don't suppose your story ends with the sexes training "Pokuhmon" together, Miss Cynthia. Hah...well, it might be a good bonding exercise.
Colt, right? Well, I happen to have been in the sector...and I was excited to see my ancestors' homeworld, where men and women lived together.
Have I caught a man's eye so quickly, Colt? That's why I'm here---Earth is where my people came from. Before they split off from men, that is.
...Well, Mejare's dangerous for an outlaw, Lux. And as far as that goes, there's value in bringing a sword on a raid---stray swings won't breach a ship's hull.
My rapier is part fashion, part intimidation, and part strategy, Lux. It's definitely dangerous being a pirate---and our laser rings might create holes where we don't want them.
Are you saying men ogle you in those pajamas, Turandot? Well, my motto is "You don't lose anything by being seen."
You're not talking about your outfit, are you, Turandot? My nightgown shows more skin than that. Besides, why shouldn't I attract hungry eyes?
Hmmm? I love it when my hair's treated, Rosa, but we already have a free salon on our ship. Piloting has its perks.
Wouldn't I have to pay for that, Rosa? Our ship's spa already treats me like a princess---that's pilots' privileges for you.
What kind of attitude is that, Miss Robin? If there were no men around, you wouldn't bathe? Elegance is its own goal!
Don't we all wanna be beautiful, Miss Robin? You can appreciate another girl's looks. Maybe men just get in the way!
What? Turandooooot, I hate playing stupid games like that! Why can't they just be straightforward?
That's---that's the most backwards thing I've ever heard, Turandot! When I want something, I say so! But now I'm not allowed to?
Hey, I don't know what you do here with men running around, Miss Robin. You mean couples? Two girls get married and have kids.
I hardly know a thing about Earth, Miss Robin. Do you have couples here? That's what we do---get married and start a family.
You mean, like, toys? Not everyone has those things lying around, Miss Robin. What are you bringing up men for...?
I mean, sure, some girls have toys, Miss Robin. Am I not thinking about this right? What do men have to do with toys?
M-Miss Robin, you're talking like I'm the captain or something! I'm just a...talented, well-respected pilot. With command experience!

Not bad, right, Miss Robin? I shot up the ranks! I've got a whole subteam of my own!
...But I'm not exactly running the ship.
...And why would I do that? Listen, Hayase, you and I aren't from the same place. We might not be the same species.
...Not really. Why shouldn't I flaunt what I've got, Hayase? Maybe to make the have-nots feel better?
...Yes? I like showing off, Hayase. So would you, if you had something to show.
As beautiful? Ahahaha...not quite! I'm like Mejare's golden icon, Mr. Dunban! The peak of feminine elegance!
Mejare has the most beautiful girls in the galaxy, Mr. Dunban. Buuut...I'm still the most beautiful of all! The heroine of a generation!
...Huh? I-I don't know, Mr. Dunban, I've never practiced with a man. You're too big---you might hurt me!
S-spar with you? It's not a good idea to fight men on even footing, Mr. Dunban. What's stopping you from just knocking me over?
What's that supposed to mean, Cheryl? And what're you all bundled up for? Hiding some scars under the surface?
T-trying too hard? You're not trying at all! Is there something you don't want to show us, underneath that heavy jacket?
I wanted to see my roots, Hayase. I'm not impressed. I mean, you keep asking dumb questions, and you seem just as clueless about men.
Wouldn't you visit the planet your ancestors came from, Hayase? And I hear they lived with men. You could've fooled me, the way you act.
...On a ship, Noire. How are you crossing star systems?
...I flew here, Noire. You know, on a ship? What're you riding?
You should try it, Cheryl! It's so comfortable! And it's got the full range of motion, you know, for fighting...
Aaaah, this is my favorite dress, Cheryl...and I have to wear it the most, because it's a combat dress!
Hey, you look fine, Cheryl. Maybe a little stringy. Have you not been eating or something?
Well, you look kind of pale and skinny and miserable, Cheryl. Like you're too anxious to eat right.
I told you, Hayase, I barely know what to ask. And I'm not going to kiss your butt just so you can keep making fun!
Why don't you start being nicer? Don't make me play stupid games, Hayase. I really am flying blind over here!
Ahhhn, that's a long story, Cheryl. The short version is, Barnette was a stubborn newbie, and I was a proud veteran...oh, I want to tell everything!
Ahahaha! Barnette and I have a great story, Cheryl. She was a huffy little recruit that tried to sass me when I was ordering shields. But that's just the beginning...
...Yeah, "Aqua Grunt," I'm being up front about things, and you won't even tell us your name. What's that about?
...Maybe I should call myself "Dread Pilot." I may have already shared too much if you're going by "Aqua Grunt"!
What about a man, Hayase? They have those seed cells or whatever they're called---oh, do you know that? How to get some, I mean.

What is it this time, Hayase?
...Well, all I need to do is figure out how to get that seed from him. I don't suppose you know that?
I like dressing up, Cheryl. There's not a ton of clothes lying around...oh, but I do have some nice, comfy pajamas.
Mostly I like pretty clothes, Cheryl. I guess there's some training gear for the gym... oh, wait, my pajamas! Those are so fuzzy and warm...

Who's talking?
...Oh, it's the shrimp. Well, you're right, it's not a toy---so don't treat it like one.

Who...?
You're---Hayase, right? It's not my fault if you run around and poke your eye out.
Oh, it's meeee again...wait, what are you trying to say, Cheryl? Does my thong look like it's keeping secrets?
Hmhm...uh, what was that, Cheryl? Like---you mean, am I different down here? You just said my thong just flashes everyone.
This is a combat dress, Kaz. It just happens to double as an elegant showpiece.
I love pretty clothes like this, Kaz. But I also needed an outfit that was fit for battle! So you get my favorite dress.
Hmph! I used to afford brand-names, Kaz. Now I have to forage for whatever decent outfits are my size...
Ugh, don't remind me, Kaz. I haven't been clothes-shopping in years. Now I'm just clothes-scrounging.

Our homeworld was pretty luxurious, Kaz.
...Until it wasn't. We just try to make do with jacuzzis, baked sweets, throwing parties...card games.
Haaahn...it'll never be like the old days, Kaz. But we make things comfortable as best we can. Hot tubs and spas, warm meals, holiday celebrations...poker.
...Nice to meet you, too, Aloy. You know, we're playing a game all about showing off and enjoying the stares. I don't have to hog myself.
Heeeey, aren't I allowed to enjoy myself, "Aloy"? You should, too---that's why we're all here.

I don't like when girls put up any kind of front, Erufuda.
...But sometimes there's room for real modesty.
False confidence can be pretty tiresome, too, Erufuda.
I wear this every day, Erufuda. It's my favorite dress---and the most functional.
Dressed up? I wish I had some prettier clothes, Erufuda. This is my combat dress!
Snrk! U-uuhhh...ahaha, Erufuda. Barnette's the jealous type, but---I think she'll be OK with you.
Pfft. I-I don't know, Erufuda. She's clingy and irritable---but maybe in this case she thinks I can control my temptations.
I---ugh. Sometimes girls need a little rude awakening, Erufuda.
"Rude." Honestly, Erufuda. Would you prefer I lied to your face and then watched you balloon up even more?

Jealousy won't make you any thinner, Erufuda.
...Or maybe it will. When I saw Meia's Vandread, I just had to have my own...
Envy's no healthier than fries, Erufuda. But I get jealous too sometimes...and that makes me want to reach new heights!
..."Plus---size"? Is that a nice way of saying chubby, Erufuda? I don't know---it's been so long since I went clothes-shopping.

What-size?
...If you mean big clothes, Erufuda, I don't know. I only got a few years' worth of shopping for myself in the first place!
Uhhhh...I've never really noticed my weight going up, Erufuda. It's been pretty steady...

Hmmm?
...I've stayed about this weight for a while, Erufuda. I don't have any advice.

Technique?
...It's not really something I think about, Erufuda. Being a pilot must just keep you fit.
Um, it's not like I train super hard or anything, Erufuda. There's combat drills, and flight practice...I guess it's just natural.
Ahhhn, Erufuda, you shouldn't follow my eating habits. Barnette always bakes these little cakes and cookies, and---I just can't help myself!
Ohhh, don't look at me for some rigid diet plan, Erufuda. Barnette is such a good cook...and if it's not sweets, it's a wine and steak dinner---!
W-who, me? We may be pirates, Mitama, but that's no excuse not to shower. The "foul-smelling brutes" are men.
We raid foul-smelling brutes, Mitama. They're called the men's army.
W-who, me, Leonie? Uhhm...wait, do you mean a man specifically? They don't pull out swords very much.

Leonie, right?
...W-what do you mean, a guy? I've never had an actual duel with one.

A---a boy, Nami? O-oh my God, is that what a man would give me?
...I don't know if that's worth it.
A---boy? W-wait, Nami, so if I got a man's seed, there'd---be a little man inside me instead? O-ohhhn, that's so weird...
Secrets? There's nothing secret about what you show off, Nami. Besides, I think you look pretty good as-is...unless there's some insecurity.
I don't know, Nami---besides the dress thing, we seem to come from the same school of thought. Is something nagging at you?
Sheesh...good question, Nami. A lot of the rich families on Mejare seem to bring in money without lifting a finger. That, or being a soldier, I guess...
Uhm...I never got the chance to think about careers too much, Nami. Apparently imperial soldiers are paid well enough.
Don't you think I'm attractive, Nami? But, personality-wise, I have to say...I love a girl who's strong and tenacious.
Well, physically shouldn't be a big mystery, Nami. I think you know already. Emotionally...ohhhn, there's nothing like a fierce look in her eyes!
Hahhhn...you're not holding back on the questions, Nami. It's not that bad, but...I'm a little top-heavy. See? My bust is bigger than my hips.
Way to stroke a girl's ego for her big moment, Nami. Uhhh...well, I guess it's my butt. I mean, compared to my breasts---it ought to be a little bigger.
Hmmmnn...that's a nice idea, Kumatora, but I'm actually stuck on a pirate crew. Talk about glamorous.
Sheesh, don't tease me, Kumatora---that's my dream job. Any job but pirate is a nice one, really...
Jeez, what's got you so grumpy, "Reimu"? Well, if you want a girlfriend, at least you'll get part of that experience soon---if you follow.
Ugh, don't ruin my ~background.time~ by whining about my looks, Reimu. You'll get the full view in a bit...that's kind of like a girlfriend.
Lucky for each other, sure. I feel so loooonely without her, Kaz...who else is there in deep space?
I know, Kaz...but sheesh, space is so lonely. The luckiest thing is having anyone at all.
Hey, who's the alien here, Bobobo? You're the one with the extending nosehair and whatever else.
Alien? W-what're you, Bobobo? Fully human? I have a hard time believing that...!
...What? Arle, I don't go around punching people. Unless you're talking about my sword...
...Does a sword count as hand-to-hand? I'm not some karate master, if that's what you're saying, Arle.
Ohhhn...I'd certainly like to be, Elphaba. Elegant dresses, gourmet dining...right here is the closest I've been in years.
Hmph. Only if that society is a pirate crew, Elphaba. This is the fanciest place I've been to in a while.
And who's that, Elphaba? Some girl you've got a crush on?
...Well, don't leave me with that, Elphaba. Who is she? A friend---or something closer?
Hmph. Yeah, Suzuya, all three of them. And they're all after other girls...

I just can't help it, Suzuya.
...But as far as "boys" go, I can't be helped. Our prisoners want nothing to do with me.
I wouldn't be down here on Earth if the "boys" in space paid me any attention, Suzuya. I hope it's just because there's only a handful.

Erufuda?
...I usually say the most important part of an outfit is the girl in it. While you're working on that, try a big nun's habit.
Your clothes aren't the problem, Erufuda. But if you really want advice...just admit defeat for now and wear a mumu.
...Buy bigger clothes, Erufuda? I don't know what you want me to say. I don't think stores on Mejare carry your size.
Suggestions? Erufuda...well, if your butt's not going to get smaller, then make your clothes bigger. Not that I've ever seen them that big for sale...
Don't you think it's elegant, Mitama? I took some fencing in school, and what comes up in weapons training but close-quarters positions...
Well, we needed at least one girl on the team who can handle close quarters, Mitama, and I already had experience. Besides, isn't it gorgeous?

A lot like they do at night, Mitama. You can't get that close!
Actually, we did once, and that was an adventure...
They're stars, Mitama. Thousands of times bigger than this planet, and we'd burn up if we got near. Although... there is a story about that.

Eek! S-she started talking...it's not just a reflection!
...I am gorgeous.

H-haaghhnn...s-she's real. A-another me!
...This is nothing like a mirror. Or even on camera! Nothing captures my beauty...
Hmph. Well, if I have to share with someone, I can't think of a better candidate.
...Just so you know, I wouldn't make that kind of compromise with anyone else.
...But there's just a sliver of doubt? That they'd take that away from you, too?
...But maybe the mirror's lying, and so are your crewmates?
You're right. It doesn't make sense! We're every bit as pretty as the other crew, and more buxom to boot.
No kidding! We go out there and practically give ourselves to them, just looking for a little seed. And not a scrap of praise. It's like we smell...
Is now really the time, uh---other me? My dress is coming off! Save family planning for later.
Hey, look---Jura, this is my big reveal! We need sex talk, not baby talk.
That'd start to get pretty confusing, Other-Jura...if they'd even go for it. What if there's little things different about them? Or their guns?

...So I take it that's frowned upon on Earth, Steve? Why can't a girl flaunt what she's got? Does the temperature change too much?
Did you see her go by earlier, Steve? She's the shortie in the leotard. As for your proposition, uh...maybe you should walk me through it?
You're talking about Barnette, Steve...and yourself. I-I think you have a better picture in your head than I do...!
Thank you, Mia! I admit, it's a team effort...I do my best to wash and brush, but the spa attendants do a great job setting it just right...
Ahhn, Miaaa...I wish I could say I do it all myself, but it wouldn't have the same sheen without our spa's full revitalization package!
...Falling off? Mia, what're you---w-wait, have you seen a planet from space?
...What? You can't fall off a planet, Mia. And landing is more about the atmosphere...wait, how far back is this?
Because, Shouko, it'll make me famous back home! Can you imagine returning with that news? The first Mejarian to ever do it! Hahh...
Shouuuko, no one on Mejare has had a man's baby for generations! I'd be a superstar! A modern heroine! Ahhn, you're getting me excited...!
Your outfit isn't all that unusual where I'm from, Yae. Maybe a little---kitschy, but just as revealing.
What do you mean by that, Yae? Stark and immodest? I'd stick yours in the same neighborhood.
Hmnn, wouldn't that be great, Yuri? Jura does have the proportions for it. Everyone tells her...!
Yuriiiii, don't tease Jura like that. It's been my dream ever since---well, puberty, I guess. A glimmering goddess gracing the skies...!
It's just a sidearm, Hilda. Beisdes, we can't only rely on guns. You never know what might jump out, or where!
Well, I'm mostly a pilot, Hilda. Command just wanted some specialists on our boarding parties.
Thank you, Hildaaa...you're really pretty, too. That's Mejare's highest ideal.

"Lysithea," right? It's just a sidearm. And it's definitely not meant for---armor!
Oh, that was my girlfriend Barnette, Lysithea. The short answer is she's a huge grump.
Ahh, Lysithea, that was Barnette! We've been dating for a while. She's just antsy and has a hard time making friends.
Well, it wouldn't be any fun if I just cast off the dress first thing, Lysithea! You should be excited for Jura's big reveal later!
Lysitheaaa, what good is a sexy dress if you can't accessorize? Besides, it builds up the an-tici-pation!
That's no involvement period, Yae. At least, for civilians. Why do you ask?

Ahhn, Barnette, Jura keeps on losing!
{barnette}That's your whole plan, isn't it? I've got the camera.{!reset}
Mohhn, but Jura could still use a hug...

Mohhn, this isn't easy, Barnette. Jura has to lose for her grand reveal...but losing so much is no fun!

Of course, Fluttershy! Beauty is in our DNA back on Mejare. It's our identity...our pride and joy!

Hmm, it's me...Yumeko? Oh, that was my girlfriend, Barnette. She doesn't like to socialize.
...Oh, you mean Barnette, Yumeko? We've been dating for a while. She's cute, right? But she's always grumpy.
Huh? Well...definitely this Earth, Nonon. But that's because we think it's from centuries ago.
Actually, we've had a lot of trouble with Earth, Nonon. Our Earth. This one is...well, it's like you're rubbing sticks together.
Uhh...bad experience, Nonon? Oh, is this right before the frontier era? Maybe we split up from them pretty soon.
Umm...I thought Earth girls liked men, Nonon. Wait, are the colonial ships being built? If you hate each other, we can't be far off...

Hm? Nonon, there's all sorts of things to do here. This planet has weather!

And make a baby with his seed, Nonon! It doesn't have to be a man from here, though. Earth has plenty to see as-is!

OK, here we go.
...Is that really the biggest influence I left on you, Lysithea? Well, allow me to fix that...
Huh? Oh, uh, Zeke...well, if I get pregnant with a man's seed, I'll be Mejare's new heroine!
T-that's hard to say, Zeke...you're so different from us! But I know I can become famous planetwide if I can have one's baby!
I tried, Zeke! She's always got to be in combat mode, watching for any "hostiles." It's either that or she's in the kitchen...
She's patrolling, Zeke. Leaving her poor Jura all alone. The only time she's not armed and on edge is when she's cooking.
Ahhn, thank you, Rouge...you're very pretty, too. We all try to make our ship a place where a girl's beauty can shine its brightest!
Muhuhu...do you do it all yourself, Rouge? I admit, Jura has help from the spa crew...it's everyone's job to make sure we all look our best!
You saw her, Rouge. Barnette's dead-serious all the time...dead-serious on being committed to her Jura! So steadfast and passionate...!
Ahhn, I love Barnette, Rouge! Most people think she's scary. But Jura sees the truth...she's totally devoted! A killer instinct that'll jealously defend you!
Hmm...well, it's not easy to pick one place to land on a whole planet, Yumeko. Somehow we all felt drawn here.
Where you you go if you had one chance to visit Earth, Yumeko? The whole crew agreed...there's some strange presence here.
Uh, what do you mean, exactly, Miss Yae Miko? Like...you just toss men out when you're done with them?

Miss Yae Miko, are men just another plaything around here?

Is sucking blood part of the deal here, too, Moskii? Maybe I should grow two extra little spindly arms...
...I see, Moskii. And that's not all. Why don't I attach some leathery wings, maybe inject ink into my eyes...

You'd have to take us both.
Are you proud of being lonely, Reimu? Sounds more like social anxiety.
Your pride, in being too shy to state the truth? You're really overthinking this, Reimu.
Oh, you've made your little crush perfectly clear, Monika. You're into girl, singular. She might even be among us.
Why don't you just talk it over with ~player~, Monika?
Hmm...I don't know, Monika, they're still kind of weird. Not pretty enough for my tastes...
...Well, I'd like it if they were a bit more elegant, Monika. And cleaner, and more refined...
My secret is that I take good care of it, Monika! I don't even feel like fighting unless my hair is set just right.
I get asked that all the time, Monika. But it's not a secret, it's vigilance! Hour after hour, day after day, brushing and fluffing and rinsing...
...What? Uh...whoever wants to, Monika?
That's a...weird question, Monika. It's like asking who pays for dinner.
Oh, you know, Monika, they're covered in germs, they'll make you sick...how true is that, by the way?
Men were always these weird lumbering things the Border Guard just had to deal with, Monika. Apparently they were full of gross diseases...that's not true, is it?
Ahhn, I'd love to, Monika! Right after we get home for good...but don't tell her! Look, she's got the camera ready for me...!
Monikaaaa, don't tease me with the thought! She always knows when I need her...see, here she comes now, for my big moment!
What are you talking about, Monika? I don't know what goes on here. But anyway, you don't want to wait to get physical. It's important!
I don't really know what I'm comparing to, Monika. But it's always good to fool around, make sure you like each other.
Hey, you settled us, Rouge. Or you will, sooner or later. But---are you saying there are real aliens out there? That's news to us.
What'd you call them, Rouge? I mean, thanks for the compliment, but we haven't run into any foreign species. They came to Earth?
They're for my exposure, Rouge! The whole galaxy needs to witness my grace in its purest form!
Personal enjoyment? Barnette's got the real thing for herself, Rouge! She's filming my elegance for the entire cosmos to see!
Lysitheaaa, I love it when girls participate. If there's some way I can make this extra special for you...
It all comes naturally to me, Lysithea...but what do you mean, exactly? Just speak up, and you can have plenty of influence...
Oh, I'm a pilot, Yae. Dread team subleader!

I'm our second-in-command Dread pilot, Yae. We have a whole team of fighters to defend the ship!
...But I do also look very pretty.
Because, Nonon, Barnette knows she's Jura's favorite. That means if she takes good care of Jura, she gets lots of hugs and kisses...
Nonoooon, why wouldn't Barnette be loyal when Jura loves her so much? Every cake and camera is repaid in equal---pleasure.
W-what do you mean? Miss Yae Miko, I'm not just some pea-brained pinup girl! Mejare's at war, and it needs a heroine!
Well, that's why I've made myself useful, Miss Yae Miko! Beauty isn't hard to come by, but that's just the tip of a heroic, peace-brokering pilot!

My hair is my pride and joy, Rose!
...But care-wise, it's really whatever the spa crew can get their hands on.
Oh, I wish, Rose. We try to find good products, but there's no guarantees for a pirate.
Why, thank you, Miss Li. As for all the skin I'm showing...well, my girlfriend Barnette is even worse with that.
Oh, thank you, Chun-Li! You're in great shape yourself. And if you think this is revealing, you should see my girlfriend.
You call this revealing? It's draped over me and hides some of my curves! You want revealing, you should meet my girlfriend.
Oh, please, Miss Martial Artist. My girlfriend Barnette walks around in a leotard and stockings---don't call me scantily-clad.
It's called flirting, you big lug. I know men lack all subtlety, but having a man's baby will make me famous on Mejare!
Oh, do I have to spell it out, Mister Muscles? Having a man's baby on Mejare will make me a superstar!
I'm a smarter girl than I look, Mister Jojo. It's not just the tubes I want to play with---I want the seed, so I'll be famous back on Mejare!
Well, Mister Mountain-Man, I'm tired of being only known as a criminal back home. Once Mejare warms up to men, I'll be the first to have a man's baby---I'll be famous.
You're just jealous mine comes first alphabetically, copycat. Earth girls think they're the center of the universe.
Hey, who's copying who? I didn't know Earth girls were so presumptuous.
Oh, give me a break. I'm already well aware of you xenophobic Earth girls believe you've done everything first.
Who says I'm the copycat? Yet another example of Earthlings thinking they're the only ones who matter.

Why, yes, I am...and a Mejarian one, at that. But don't worry. Mejarians don't eat the livers of every man they meet.
I am a space pirate, but there's nothing to be afraid of. I'm just here to learn about your lovely little blue planet, and maybe the men on it.
I'm not just any space pirate. I'm a Mejarian...and we're not afraid of little men like you.
Plasma, huh? Well, I'd say my beauty is just as warm...
My, my, yes, I do, Miss Rarity. Thanks for noticing---would your newer self agree, too?

Pretty and...not pretty? That's the two types of women we all fall into...

I certainly hope I can handle a silly card game, Miss Rarity. I'm still online, you know.
Hey, Pearly-White, you think I lollygag in front of mirrors all day? I'm a fighter pilot---this little card game is easy, and so is staying online.
You're right, Miss Fashionette---I should stick to darting around supernovas and leave card-playing to the smart girls. Smart offline girls.
Well, Sei, since your first one really got my heart beating faster...
I'm listening. Earth is being such a generous, exciting host planet, after all.
Ooh, I'm always up for expanding my vocabulary. Besides, knowing you, it'll be devilish...

Good question, Miss Rarity...hm, I think I've got it. But why don't you put your fashion skills to the test and guess? We've got plenty of time offline.

Oh, don't gaze at me with those big worried puppy-dog eyes. I love the way I look!

Oh, I'm not done teasing quite yet, Fashion Girl. Do you see anything left? Look closely, Oldie.
Well, Rarity, I'd say I'm hiding one last accessory from you...but it's not really hidden, is it? You have a lot of time to search these days.

Use your sharp medic's eye and predict it for yourself, Policegirl.

If it means I can show off my glorious Mejarian body in full---and I get my dress back at some point---then I can manage. We all have to make do...

Hey, who's to say I don't have another trinket? Or is your sharp medic's eye finally over the double vision?

Don't be so sure! I know you've got police detective skills, but...oh, damn it, I think I am out...

Oh, and I'd be throwing such a fit if I were losing any other game! Still, as Rarity points out, I'm forced to show my body...
Oh, it's not so bad, Miss Rarity. Barnette will tell you how huffy I get when things don't go my way---but losing is fine here.

It's OK, Sei...you don't come from the planet of beautiful women like I do. Just stand back and let me wow you...

Finally. Sei here understands she doesn't need to compete...Mejare is home to the galaxy's finest women.
Oh, Sei, it's OK you're not as beautiful---you're not Mejarian! It's hard being the gold standard, so just enjoy being the audience.

Oh, really? What strikes you in particular---my fabulous black dress? My studded boots? My jewelry?

You're looking rather spiffy yourself, even if you take fair skin a little far. What's the fanciest thing about my outfit, hm?
I've won many a dogfight in the harsh magnetic storms and asteroid fields of space, so yes, this should be a cinch.
I certainly hope I can handle a silly card game, Miss Rarity. After all, I wouldn't call it as hard as navigating an asteroid field.
Hey, Pearly-White, you think I lollygag in front of mirrors all day? I'm a fighter pilot---this little card game is easy.
You're right, Miss Fashionette---I should stick to darting around supernovas and leave card-playing to the smart girls.
Come on, you don't want me to spoil the surprise, do you? Surely a fashionista can figure it out.
Haven't you taken my outfit apart with your eyes yet, Miss Fashion Designer? Come on, guess.
Good question, Miss Rarity...hm, I think I've got it. But why don't you put your fashion skills to the test and guess?
Oh, I don't know, Miss Fashionette, maybe you should tell me! Could my whole dress be coming off already?
Come on, Pale-white, don't make me say it. I think there's a big glittering accessory you're overlooking.
Oh, I'm not done teasing quite yet, Fashion Girl. Do you see anything left? You should.
Well, Rarity, I'd say I'm hiding one last accessory from you...but it's not really hidden, is it?
Now, now, Miss Fashion, there's something you get taught when you become a fighter pilot---hiding in plain sight.
Oh, I agree. But I live a life of crime, don't I? As long as I get it back afterwards, I'll manage...
Well, normally I'd be complaining, but losing here just means I get to show off! Besides, I get my dress back after, right?
If it means I can show off my glorious Mejarian body in full---and I get my dress back at some point---then I can manage.
Well, I do live a life of crime, so occasionally the criminal becomes the victim. Just don't steal it, OK?
Hmmnn. I was hoping my festive look would stay intact all season!
So you're really gonna make Jura disassemble her adorable Christmas costume? Fiiiine...

My turn again? Don't worry---I've prepared a party trick for you!

Hm? Oh, Jura's turn...well, I've been practicing! I just need to---loosen these heels.
...Oh, good. I mean---I don't really like these heels, either. They're too tight...
Decisions, decisions...charity or drama? Festive or fun?
Me again? I'd know exactly what to do if I were in my regular outfit...
I'll keep things even on top and bottom. Ohhn, why don't I share a story?
Maybe it's just the Christmas cheer, but this is the only kind of game I don't mind losing. I'll go two-for-one again.

Ahhn, it's finally time. But---don't you think tight clothes can maybe look sexier than bare naked?
...Me neither!
...Well, well, well. Time for your present.
...You know how sometimes you can tell what you got for Christmas, even when it's still wrapped?
All my holiday fun is over. I know how to have plenty on any day, though.
Hmph. Well, there goes the last of it...like the waning hours of a holiday.
...Two pair lost the hand? You'd better not all be pulling something...
I lost with two pair? You're a tough crowd...but you'll see, Jura is a tough opponent.
Oh, come on---that lost? Ugh...
...Agh! Jura is not allowed to lose with hands this good!
You Earth people really are tough, beating me with two pair...better get creative.
Jeez, two pair lost? I better be a little more seductive...
Wow. If two pair is losing, you might be the types I need my sword for.

Wow, and I even had two pair. I wonder what set of two I could take to match it?
I really thought that hand was going to take me somewhere, too...I'll have to even things out by not taking this anywhere.
Ouch. Meia always tells me not to be overconfident...there's the proof.
Ugh, really? If two pair isn't going to win a round, I don't even know what to believe anymore.
Oh, come on! I had two pair...this is ridiculous.
Two pair! I had two pair, and I lost...well, you've earned this, that's for sure.
Even two pair couldn't save my dress...it would seem fate has smiled upon all of you.
There's only one thing I was prouder of than that hand---good thing it happens to be my body.

Jeez...I had two pair. My teasing really made you mad, didn't it?
You're beating two pair now? I'm on a table full of Gascognes.
My clothes should be as beautiful as I am!
Oh, I don't envy you, even now.

I'll wear whatever I please...
So sorry, Meia, but I have a terrible confession to make...
Sorry to tell you this as you masturbate, Meia, but I can't wait any longer...

So which cutie was running through your thoughts back there? Valore? Misty? You can tell me.
Don't tell me you masturbated back there to Barnette or Dita or anyone else that could cause some issues.
I know the thought of someone on the ship had to get you to cum like that. Which one was it? I'm just going to keep guessing.
If you're wondering why I lost, it's because I'm so distracted by the idea of Meia thinking of someone as she masturbates. Who was it?
Jeez, Meia. You've already lost and you're still more into this than I am.

It never ends with you and games. A girlfriend would really put you at ease with yourself, believe me.
Ouch. Sorry to say it, Meia, but things aren't looking good for me...I might have to put on a show like you did.
Down to nothing at all. At this rate, they're going to get two Mejarian masturbation shows.

Oh. I'm not sure I can make it through the evening without masturbating like you did.
Barnette's too serious for a place like this. Well, so is Meia, but Meia's not liable to shoot you for staring at me.
Oh, Barnette could never come here and stomach the sight of nasty Earth people ogling me. I didn't tell her I was leaving.
No, I'm afraid Barnette isn't the type to make any public stripping experiences. She's too responsible---and too jealous.
Oh, please---if you think I dress skimpy, Barnette hardly wears anything to strip. And she'd get very huffy if anyone flirted with me.
Hm? I doubt it---my Barnette is a jealous lover, and very distrustful of strangers. Meia here can at least keep a cool head.
Bringing my girlfriend out here would be a little awkward, don't you think? Meia and I are just friends, so her attitude isn't an issue.

Well, sheesh. Right away?
...Actually, yeah, maybe you all needed that.
...Have I really got the most on to start with? It kind of looks that way. Maybe eating one round at the start is OK...
Oh, sure, tag me first round...although if I carry out my plan, you might all be behind, anyway.
Damn, right away. This wouldn't have happened with Barnette around...and I think she would've fit in with all you skimpies!

Ohhn, what a lame debut.
...Sheesh, and somehow you're all outdoing me in the risqué department.
I've built up a sizable lead for myself already. This is just too easy...
I'm not some poker wizard or anything. I think you're all treating your guest a little too nicely.
That's my first loss! And the rest of you are half-naked. I'll have to work extra hard to dazzle you...
Hitting hard, fast, and relentless is the pirate way.
This is where the fun begins.
Sheesh, you know I'm happy to participate! Don't throw rounds in my honor.
Again? You Earth girls must be annoyed at all the little trinkets you see on me.
Tagged me again, but let's remember who's winning.
Do I smell a comeback? Can't be...that would mean I'd lose.
That's the spirit, ladies. Claw your way back, so I can claw at myself later.
Guess counting my rapier didn't miff you, because you haven't been putting up much of a fight.
Quite the streak I had there. Maybe I'm better when that sword isn't weighing me down.
Lucky streak and I'm still winning? Tonight's my night...or wait, every night is my night.
Here I am, still so clothed, and so skilled. Surrounded by Earthlings struggling to tread water...or keep their clothes on.
I was starting to think I could win with anything.
Right after my boots? Well, since I'm winning...
Guess the cold ground jolted me into a stupor.
Damn. Really blowing this lead of mine in a hurry.
Proud of yourself? Maybe you should re-check the clothes tally.
Congratulations. You managed to break my long streak...when I was all flustered from losing my cute boots.
I had a streak and I'm still winning. Losing my boots has made me lighter than ever!
...Oh, did I lose? I kinda forgot I was in this game, just casually beating you all.
Still a comfortable lead...and I'm still comfortable in this dress, don't you worry.
You really are catching up to me. Good thing I have more accessories!
Still winning! And my dress is still safe.
You're really making me sweat here. But I've still got more Mejarian fashion to show you!
The heat of this thrilling game is just melting my lead away...what a shame.
Nice job, everyone. You might get me out of my dress yet!
So did you all conspire to finally beat me there?
I hope you're proud of yourselves, conspiring to finally put another dent in me. Earthlings are nothing without their skullduggery.
I hope there's no foul play going on to break my streak. As a pirate, I'm an expert on the subject.
My lead has dissolved in a hurry...and now, so will my outfit.
It's all just coming undone...my outfit, that is.
You know when the enemy's in your sights, and then they just vanish? Probably not, but...yeah.
So much for my lead. Did I get too complacent with all those accessories?
I'm still winning after that, too. I've really made you earn this!
The time has come at last. Just remember---I'm still winning!
Well, I've still got a lead. But after this next strip, I really couldn't care less about it.
