Nudity is so final. What else can I do to stay all exotic?
I'll just have to use some of my other assets to keep things engaging for our audience...
I guess that is kind of cute. Speaking of hair...
Hey, there's no way a bright yellow thong would look any good. You're pretty lucky.
Yeah, it's a shame my hair doesn't quite have the same exotic color yours does. How else can I make this interesting?
If only I had that rich blue hair instead of boring old blonde. Luckily, I've styled it to be interesting in other ways...
You would be the egghead type to actually count the layers. Too bad you forget to be sexy about yours.
At least I made all that clothing interesting to look at. You came in here with armor on.
Hey, clothing isn't the only trick I have. Watch this.
Why am I not surprised you've been counting? I'd say wearing more clothing was just a matter of being prepared.
Hey, it's not my fault you didn't properly prepare yourself for the battle ahead.
How so? It's fashionable, it's valuable---it's crucial to my image as a pirate! I feel naked already.
Maybe you have your status as a princess holding you up, but I'm a lowly pirate. My sword completes my image as a noble savage!
What's a pirate without her weapon, Amalia dearest? Naked, of course. Don't underestimate its impact on my image.
Oh, but my rapier is so fashionable! It completes my image, my whole persona! A rough-and-tumble warrior cursed with beauty!
And who says fashion and function are mutually exclusive, Miss Shoulderpads? I'll have you know my boots came from a Mejarian soldier we captured!
Maybe in the age of metal armor and broadswords, fashion and function are separate entities. I got these boots from a soldier!
Mejarian soldiers must be slaves to fashion, then, because that's where I got these boots. Good for planting your feet in a cockpit...or on a prisoner's face.
Hey, these boots are made of sturdy stuff, Catria! I stole them off an unfortunate soldier---Mejarians are the masters of combining fashion and function.
Shipwrecked? Ooh, sounds exciting. I'm listening...
Any story that starts with a shipwreck ought to be thrilling. I hope I don't faint from the excitement.
Ooh, I've been shipwrecked myself. That's how Barnette and I fell in love! Go on, I'm listening...
If Earth has parallels to Mejare somewhere, and it involves a shipwreck, then you have this pirate's attention.
What is this, some kind of test? You're an Earth girl...well, I'm assuming, anyway.
Are you not from Earth either? I assumed as much, what with your talk of verdant forests and all.
Oh, I'm so sorry, Amalia! Are you a fellow alien girl? I was under the impression I was the lone outsider.
Oh, my, how rude of me! I assumed you're from planet Earth, but maybe I'm not the only cute alien drawn to this place.
Because my dress itself is supportive! See the way it wraps around my figure, giving just enough freedom? Oh, I love it so much...
My dress is more comfortable and more supportive than a bra, Catria! That's what makes Mejarian fashion so wonderful.
A bra? Bras are dark-ages nonsense in this age of space travel---why wear such a silly thing when you can have a tight, supportive, free-flowing dress?
Ohoho. Let me tell you about this dress of mine, Miss Pauldrons---lovingly supportive, with just enough space to shake them around! I don't need a bra!
...Sheesh. Who would've thought Meia Gisborn would get totally lost in herself?
...Sheesh. Good thing I'm staying alert, right?
OK, Barnette, try not to get a shot of her cumming all over herself! There's plenty to see...right...here!
She's lucky we're not interested in blackmail, right, Barnette? Keep the camera on me, nice and tight---tah-daaah!
Since when am I taking charge, being responsible, getting all the recon? She's having all the fun...
Sure, cum all over yourself, God knows you don't do it enough. I'll just finish the mission...
Well, they're a little plain, but it's cute how they go up so far. You're a modest one...especially to be playing this game.
Why, thank you! Yours are cute, too. Who knew you organ-harvesting Earth girls could be raised so polite?
You are just the cutest little thing, with how shy you are. How in God's name did you end up playing this?
Awww, I can't criticize your boots when they're below that adorable little face of yours! You're such a sweet girl.
Hey, I may be the pinnacle of Mejarian fashion, but that doesn't make me the authority on Earth's. Have some confidence in your own style...you sweet little thing, you.
Buy? I hate to break it to you, Elizabeth, but...pirates aren't known to pay for things.
I got a lovely five-finger discount on these boots from a Mejarian soldier who thought she was being clever...until she wasn't.
You'll have to ask the Mejarian soldier I stole them from, Lizzie. Except you can't, because she's dead now.
Buy, Elizabeth? These are standard-issue boots for...whatever class of Mejarian soldier it was that I stole these from.
I'm a pirate. My rapier knows where I got these boots better than I do, if you follow.
You mean, like---a dildo? O-oh, I guess that do look alike...and they're not for "respectable" girls.
...Oh, everything's coming together now. No wonder we all think dildos are for weirdos.
Hey, what's this all about, Natsuki? Competing for ~player~'s attention? I already have a girlfriend.
You're not very good at disguising your intentions, are you? I'll leave ~player~ to you if you want her so bad.
Hey, I'm the judge of who gets to be with me. ~player~ is kind of cute, but I guess you'd get all incensed if I made a move.
Forgotten I'm taken, Fun-size? ~player~ is cute and all, but we can tell you like her.
What's this all about, Natsuki? Competing for ~player~'s attention? I'd hope an Earth girl would be better at seducing men.
You're not very good at disguising your intentions, are you? I'll leave ~player~ to you if you want him so bad.
Hey, I'm the judge of who gets to be with me. ~player~ is pretty handsome, but I guess you'd get all incensed if I made a move.
Forgotten I'm taken, Fun-size? ~player~ is cute and all, but we can tell you like him.
What's that supposed to mean? Shame on you for thinking I don't love women as well! I have a girlfriend, Daria!
...Haven't I been mentioning my girlfriend Barnette every other sentence, Daria? The female body is definitely worth teasing out.
Do you think Mejarians just stand around in sexual frustration, Daria? I have a girlfriend...we love other women.
It doesn't take a man to appreciate the female form, Daria. I'm in a steady relationship with a girl named Barnette, after all...
What's that supposed to mean, Daria? Don't men like being teased? Women always seem to respond well...
I don't think I follow. The women I flirt with love being teased---why wouldn't men?
So men just like to get to the good stuff, do they? What unrefined beasts...women love it when I tease them like this.
Are men really such impatient monsters that they can't appreciate a little striptease, Daria? It always makes the women around me melt.
Men don't like being teased? Women love it when I tease them...you should see the state it puts my Barnette in!

state.text: We're not married yet---but she is the cutest thing! Short green hair, gorgeous fiery eyes, a tiny frame!
Ohhh, if only I had a picture! She's a bit shorter than me, and so adorable---we're not married, but now I want to be!
Well, I'd consider myself the more beautiful of us two---but she's still a catch! A tan little ball of gunpowder! And we're still dating.
Wife? Let's not get ahead of ourselves---although at this point, I can't imagine a cuter little Oma for my daughters.
Oh, but they're perfectly fine with strip poker? Have sex with her on camera---that'll draw a crowd.
I think if you can find a girl who'll put up with her sexual romps being filmed, that'll draw enough views to buoy the tender moments...
You underestimate the power of a heartwarming moment. Even I'd want to keep sex private, though...
My, you need to teach your audience some patience. Don't they have beating hearts? Is filming sex the only draw you have?
It's so sad how Earth girls can hardly picture sex without a man involved. Maybe I should just keep quiet and let you experiment.
Oh, is my form of lovemaking really that foreign to you? I'm not sure I can betray Barnette's trust like that...
Hey, I know this is strip poker, but maybe I should keep certain things private to me and Barnette...like techniques.
Should I really share something like that? The romance between two women is a sacred thing where I'm from!
Hey, just because I'm a pirate does not mean I'm without my dignity! How many thongs do you think I own?
As if I'd ever sell my precious clothing---I only have what I've managed to steal, you know!
And fly all the home with no underwear? That's just scandalous...besides, my wardrobe isn't exactly stuffed.
Hey, I know I look like I can part with a measly thong, but I just steal the very best clothes I can find! It's staying with me.
I think my dress might be a little too breezy down below if I didn't have my thong. I don't have many pairs anyway.
Someone's really done her homework! I've piloted a Dread, a Vanguard, and, well...my Vandread.
Oh, I'd have to say the most recent addition---my Vandread, a male-female fusion and a defensive marvel!
I've been a Dread pilot for most of my illustrious career. But my favorite is my Vandread, even if does look like a crab.
Well. If you need your entire planet shielded from Harvest cubes, call up Jura Basil Elden and her marvelous Vandread.
...I'm a pirate, Streaming-chan, not a whore. Future fashion models don't bend over and spread.
...You seem to think I'll do anything for money. I might kill soldiers, but I'm too beautiful for prostitution.
Excuse me? Listen, my beauty is that of a fashion model, not a poledancer. And what would Barnette think?
I think that sort of blatant pornography is best reserved for women of your stature. I am celebrity material.
Bend over and spread? Hmph. I'm beautiful enough to afford to tease a little---sorry if you're not.
Oh, don't start! Me flirting around is precisely why Barnette's so afraid I'll run off with another girl! She's so possessive.
Oho. You're lucky she's not here---Barnette's a jealous lover, and an avid gun collector.
Tsk, tsk. Trying to steal away a taken woman, are you? For shame...you should know Barnette is very protective of me.
Heehee. I love when girls try to win me over---Barnette is so tough, and she chases them all away!
...I'll just pretend I didn't hear that. And I thought Mejare was in a sorry state.
...OK, I'll just gloss over that so I don't puke. Mejare's not nearly that bad...and I'm part of its underbelly, so I know.
...Mm-hm. Right. Well, now that Earth is confirmed to be worse than I ever imagined, let's get back to our friendly game.
...Alright then! Men have really drilled the notion of penetration into you Earth girls. I'll go vomit and be right back.
Oh, gosh, you mean my body! Of course I'm all-natural...Mejarians don't need surgery to be beautiful.
Ohhhh, those kinds of upgrades. You're not suggesting the planet known for its beautiful women uses surgery?
Oh, now I see what you mean. Are you really so skeptical of an hourglass figure? Beautiful women are Mejare's trademark.
Ah. What, you've never seen a woman with natural breasts and hips? As in, most Mejarians?

case.state: Well, the answer's no. Actually, I shouldn't have to dignify that. I'll let my body do the talking.
...That doesn't deserve a response. At least...not with words.
Hmph. I think you'll find that I'm not just a woman, but the woman.
I'd be optimistic, too. The sight of me ought to make anyone's ~background.time~.
Hmph. At least I've got good odds. And you know, I think I'm the perfect example of a human.
"Optimistic." Maybe there's more to me than just a normal girl. But if we're going that way, you might be in the same boat.
Oh, well, of course. I need to be able to run in this thing, or I wouldn't get to the hangar before a battle ended.
Well, that's only natural. I don't attend galas in this thing---a daring space pirate like me needs freedom of movement.
Well, how else am I supposed to break into a run or assume a combat stance? It's sad to say, but pirates aren't in the business of fancy get-togethers.
What's wrong a long photo shoot, Myriam? Cameras love me---I have my girlfriend film my most beautiful moments!
Oh, you'll definitely have the material for a long photo shoot in a moment, Myriam...I can't help it if even cameras fall in love at the sight of me.
I'm glad you agree, Myriam. All the universe is a stage for displaying my brilliant beauty.
Of course I'm the centerpiece, Myriam. This whole game revolves around shining an ever-brighter spotlight on the most beautiful body of all.
Well, I wouldn't want to find myself unarmed on a ground operation, would I? Not everyone plays nice when we salvage assets.
My duties as a fighter don't end with piloting. Sometimes we go in on ground raids or do some scavenging, and a girl needs something to defend herself.
...That's it? I could have told you that---it's just flirting, the same thing you'd do with a girl. And it hasn't worked, so men must be different beasts.
...That just sounds like entry-level flirting advice, which I guess is the kind of thing a girl like you needs. It's more to get a woman to like you, in my experience.
...I guess that was too good to be true. If you asked me how to flirt with girls, I would have said the same things---I want to know why men always avoid me.
...No, none of that works on men. I know because it's my usual playbook for flirting with a girl, and I can hardly get a man to look my way with it.
Oh, Barnette and I fell in love after death-defying drama! We didn't get along at first, but then she was placed on my subteam. And we crashed after Tarak laid a trap for us...
Oh. Barnette has a temper, and she didn't make any friends when she joined our crew. But one day, Tarak sent a decoy ship to self-destruct on a raid, and we both got caught in the blast...
I'm so glad you asked! Barnette and I realized we loved each other in the most dire of moments. We were still at each other's throats when a trap nearly crippled our Dread fleet...
Oh, we have the most romantic story of how we fell in love! Barnette is so fierce, and I hated her like everyone else at first. But then our Dreads were caught in an explosion...
Hahaha! It takes a lot to capture my heart. I hated Barnette when she sulked her way onto our crew. Then I was put in command of her, and a fireball engulfed both of us...
Yes, that's all very interesting. Please keep your marvelous power to yourself---I don't like putting my beauty at risk just to satisfy a bloodlust.
I don't care if you could split a star in two---I have my own health and beauty to think about. So keep your pride and pipe down.
Well, in the past, we usually planned out raids in advance. Recently, though, we've been fending off random attacks, so it isn't worth the time to put them on as we scramble.
It's always good to wear them in case your cockpit's blown open, but we've had to scramble more and more lately. If we took the time to put our suits on, the ship would be in pieces.
...Well, a blade's got some old-world class to it. And its gleam strikes terror into the hearts of captured enemies! Everything high-tech is in my Dread fighter.
Oh, I pilot a Dread for all my high-tech weaponry. On the ground, you can't go wrong with a shimmering silver blade---it's pure intimidation.
What do I need to climb walls for? You're really overthinking my outfit here, all because I'm from "space."
Boots are just boots, even on Mejare. What walls would I be climbing, anyway?
Is this an old-lady thing? Overthinking what it's like on other planets? I'm happy to walk on the ground, thank you.
It's just a fun feature of the dress. Open, flowing sleeves without restricting my shoulders.
Oh, it's nothing that significant. It just gives this dress some extra style, on top of letting my shoulders breathe.
I just want to keep my shoulders free. I need a full range of motion---this is a combat dress, you know.
Next up, of course...my jewelry! ...Oh, don't look so down. You get to appreciate the complexity of my outfit.
It's not my fault for dressing so craftily. Besides, isn't this game all about the anticipation? My outfit is tailor-made for that.
Ohhhh. It's OK to be curious. Every girl is a bit different, you know... Barnette is so tenacious, but if you start kissing her neck, she just melts.
Hahaha...men must be such a hassle. But how can I tell you how to touch a girl if I don't know who the girl is? Barnette, for instance...I just throw myself on top of her!
Oh. Mejarian romance has caught your interest...but you see, there are as many ways to love a girl as there are girls. And I'm such a big girl, I can just wrap Barnette up in my arms...
A "pretty boy," hm? I think I'll start using that term myself. We have a doctor onboard for whom it might apply.
..."Pretty boy"? I bet you Earth girls have all sorts of terms for the flavors men come in, don't you? I think our doctor Duero might be a "pretty boy" himself.
Just what is your romantic situation, anyway? Barnette is actually quite protective of me! It's very flattering, but then, I am a prize to be defended.
"Sharing," huh? I guess when you can't communicate, your love life is bound to get complicated. Barnette gets so jealous when I flirt, and, well...who could blame her?
Ah. I guess the quiet types really are the dirtiest. You ask Barnette about sharing me, and you might get a jealous bullet your way! Maybe she thinks I'm too good for her.
What does sex have to do with pregnancy? Not that I'm any stranger to sex appeal, as you can...see.
...Maybe I didn't understand the whole "egg" and "sperm" business from the baby book I read. You have sex with men to become pregnant? Well, speaking of sex...
I don't follow. Having sex is an expression of your love for each other! What's that got to do with babies, or seed? Well, as long we're talking sex appeal...
What, are you trying to tease me about her? We've been voted the Magno Family's Cutest Couple for a long time now.
How typically childish. You can't tease me about spending time with my girlfriend. Maybe if this were still grade school.
Oh, do I get a schoolyard tease for that? Yes, we're dating. Should I bring her here, kiss her on the cheek, have her feed me?
No, no, not planes. Spacecrafts! You know, like a planet's border guard---or the daring pirates who raid them.
Planes. How old-fashioned---a Dread is a space fighter, the kind the military uses to patrol orbit. And, of course, pirates use them too.
...No, a space pilot. Why would your mind go to planes? Well, regardless, pirates typically have to fight to get what we want.
Well, you finally got me this time, on your third attempt. I'm afraid I'm all out of tricks...but I do have some underwear.
...Regardless, it seems your third guess finally got it right. All I have left is a little black thong.
...You know, most of my opponents don't get three attempts to guess what I'm planning. Did I guess that I go bottomless? Because, well...
I never thought I'd be letting someone down by stripping naked! But as you can see, I'm just human.
Unless shaving my pubic hair is distinctly alien, you might find your study underwhelming. I hate to describe myself that way.
I really was just joking about my alien talk. Does this convince you I'm a human girl? My body's never disappointed someone before!
We still have pregnancy. It takes some machinery and tricks of genetics, but women can have children with each other. Very beautiful children, as you can tell.
Women still get pregnant on Mejare! Granted, it takes some artificial methods to make the baby at first, but you can't argue with the end result.
Two eggs and the right machine is all you need to make a beautiful baby girl. And once I was made, my Fama carried me in her womb, like any other pregnancy.
Why, yes, I am! Maybe you're more perceptive than I thought. The glimmer of light against a blade inspires fear across space and time, from Earth to Mejare.
Indeed I am. You're smarter than you sound---or maybe the blade is just a symbol of the pirate's rogue elegance, here or on Mejare.
Well, an alien in the technical sense. Mejare is known as the planet of feminine beauty---men don't even live there.
Well, alien might be misleading---I'm just as human as you, even if we're different shapes and sizes. My shapes are common on Mejare, a world of exclusively women.
Much of our crew used to have some money to their names. We didn't get much choice in leaving it behind, unfortunately---but hey, true beauty survives a change in circumstance.
She's lucky to have gotten the choice. A lot of our members came from formerly rich districts. We might have to be pirates, but we don't have to let ourselves be dirty.
Well, we're in deep space at the moment, so there really isn't anywhere else to go. Besides, I've got a bounty on my head back on Mejare.
I'm an outlaw back home, and we're all fugitives in nowhere space at present. I'd consider my options limited.
Oh, we're safely stuck in the far reaches of the galaxy. Even the friendly colonies we meet are enemy targets, and my homeworld obviously isn't very friendly to pirates.
..."Water"? We've been to some aquatic planets, but we do most of our fighting in deep space. Oh, there's so many stories I could tell...
Why would I be blowing up water in space? Oh, that reminds me---we were fighting on an aquatic world when my powerful Vandread made its debut!
What is power without the beauty to match? Inelegant, that's what. I simply won't accept that from myself, no matter how much fighting we do.
Beauty is power, so we have a certain obligation to project an image of elegance. My teammates can zip themselves into suits like little drones, but not me.
My whole planet is "all-girls." It happens to be Mejare's claim to fame, and strictly enforced by the state.
"Duel Academy." Planet Mejare was settled to be "all-girls," and it does all it can to maintain that.
By combining DNA, like anyone else. Don't you have those sperm cells for the same purpose? We just use women's eggs.
What's that supposed to mean? We have DNA, just like you do. Fuse the parents' cells together and make a beautiful baby girl.
I don't see any trophy, Chazz. Besides, I'm more interested in what people can accomplish on their own, not according to some committee.
I won trophies in school, too, Chazz. It's just not as exciting when you're out to impress some authority figure, don't you think?

condition.saying: sleeves don't seem to have a Duel Disk

case.state: ...Do you mean that axe blade you're so fond of, Chazz? It'd ruin my slender figure to lug a big mechanical gauntlet around.
"Duel Disk"? I'm really not looking for fashion advice from an Earth man, Chazz, especially if it involves card games.
"No shortage"? Way to make a girl feel special, Chazz. Well, there's only one sexy woman like me.
Oh, I wouldn't know the first thing about a card game more complicated than poker. And it's a little rude to say I'm just another "sexy woman archetype."

Are you ready, then?
...You men don't have a subtle bone in your bodies, do you, Chazz?

OK, then...here it comes.
...I guess it will, Chazz, but I haven't been impressed with your flirting so far. "Blunt and obvious" isn't the way to a girl's heart.
Oh, a likely story, Chazz. Let me guess, you'll lead me into the "changing room" and head upstairs to the cameras?
Well, isn't that convenient, Chazz? I happen to know of a nudist Dread squadron myself. You just need to strip down in the waiting room and pay no mind to the cameras.
Well, I never have been as embarrassed about my body as other girls. If someone happens to see me naked, well, what do I have to be ashamed of?
What's the big deal? I've been quite proud of myself ever since puberty. When the whole room falls in love with you, you might as well enjoy it.
Now, I'm not some exhibitionist, but what's so shameful about being caught naked? Like there's something I'm subjecting you to.
Well, most of the Magno Family pirates are accustomed to a certain standard of living. If that means we have to build beauty parlors ourselves, then we'll do it.
Perhaps filth is all your pirates are used to. Much of the Magno Family actually comes from money the state decided wasn't so valuable anymore---so we still want to look good.
Well, maybe I could stuff myself into one of our standard-issue suits, but I wanted a stronger image as second-in-command.
I'm very picky about these things. Sure, we find extra bodysuits, but then I'd just blend in---a subteam leader like me deserves a stunning outfit!
Well, I'm not just some rank-and-file pilot, so why should I settle for cramming my figure into a flightsuit? This leaves a bit to the imagination.
Oh, I've always wanted to stand out from the other pilots in their zipped-up suits. When we captured the imperial wearing this, I was thrilled she was my size.
...Are you even listening? I use this sword to fend off hardened male soldiers from our sister planet. And in fact, I'd like to learn more about them instead of doing so.
I said I'm not a model. As for boys, I hardly know a thing about them other than shooting at me.
...Your mind just goes wherever it pleases, doesn't it? I have a hard time dealing with airhead recruits who talk like you.
Hoo boy. Can't you focus on one topic? I have so many things I'd love to go on about.
Is that so? I'm starting to see why they tease you---you'd forget about it seconds later.
Is this tactical advice? Because if you mean what I think you do...well, my bait is as good as it gets.
Like a pirate lures in her enemies to strike? Unless you mean bait of a different sort---either way, I have what it takes.
Is that so? I happen to have a lot of experience confronting angry men. I don't suppose you do in between your spider collecting?
And what experience do you have with teasing men? I've confronted quite a few, and I'm no worse for wear.
I wouldn't be so proud if I had an average figure. That's not to say my crewmates are all washboards, of course---and being a pirate doesn't preclude you from that.
Not quite as endowed as me, no, but our crew does have many flavors of beauty. What's so un-piratical about looking good?
Isn't it the new and unknown that excites you the most? It's the reason humans colonized the galaxy, after all.
Don't you have any drive to explore the unknown? My homeworld would never have been founded if space weren't so exotic.
That's why I carry a sword at my hip, right? To get in the way while I'm giving soldiers a taste of Mejarian kung-fu? Please.
Oh, don't you think my feminine frame is too delicate for hand-to-hand combat? This sword isn't just for show.
I think I learned in school that the first space travel was to the Moon. It's suffered some horrible accidents by my time, though---something about spinning out of orbit.
I hear your gorgeous moon was the site of the first space landing, actually. It's enormous---such a shame that it apparently loses its orbit by my time.
Well, then, I guess I've found myself in quite the primitive time period. You'd best starting reading up on spaceflight instead of waving sticks around.
It really couldn't be more simple to explore the galaxy---at least, in my more advanced era. You should quit with the parlor tricks and study space engineering.
Well, the Earth of this time seems more preoccupied with magic tricks than escaping orbit. A starship can make some dazzling light shows itself, you know.
As warm as room-temperature starships can be, plus our hideout stations. It takes more power to keep the gravity stable.
Well, I've lived in ships and orbital stations all my life. Those tend to be pretty climate-controlled.
...Well, it does look well-tailored. I can respect not just throwing on whatever uniform your squad leader gave you.
If you really want a compliment, it certainly looks like a complete outfit. The men I know just wear their cadets' uniforms.
Who are you calling "little"? But the men of Tarak do know me as quite the devil woman, I'll agree with that.
If another man wants to call me a "devil woman," fine---I think I've earned the reputation in battle. I don't know where you're getting "little," though.
Our prisoners hardly even look my way. Maybe it's the mystery they're drawn to.
We've got some prisoners aboard, and I can hardly get their attention. Maybe men want what they can't already see.
I'm plenty strong, too, you know. But, ahh...our crew just learned there's a more sinister reason that we're all so feminine.

I've got strength to match, thank you!
...I never really thought about it, but yeah, Mejare does have a dark side to all our beauty.
Who're you calling desperate? I'm just trying to get some of their seed so I can be famous. If only I knew how to get it myself.
"Desperation"? It's not even the men I want, it's that seed of theirs! I can't figure out how to get it from them.
Don't you know what it's like? It's not easy for pirates to have ambitions! And it definitely wasn't my ambition growing up.
Your "pirate" crew must be pretty well-off. Who wants to have ended up a pirate in the first place? We're just trying to avoid getting killed most of the time!
W-what? They're raised by their own parents---what are you people doing? I think I heard about Tarak and factory schools or something...

What are you talking about?
...You know what, I think the men got that treatment back on Tarak. Is Earth where they got the idea?
That's what a---a dildo is supposed to be? Oh, that's so weird! They were already weird. But it makes sense, I guess...
A-are you saying---those rods are meant to be---well, rods? Or whatever men call them. I always thought they were for perverts...
How many Dreads do you pilot, exactly? Sure, keep up your little doggy paddle.
What do you have if you're trying to drag me down? I have a beautiful fighter craft.
Well, what's stopping you, then? Tell me all the things I don't know that I don't know.
OK, then spill it. What's something I wouldn't even think to ask about?
This is what I have! Pretty clothes are hard to come by on Border Guard ships. And so are clothes in general...
Where am I supposed to get street clothes? All we'll find on the average raid is those fatigues the men wear.
What makes you think I can "afford" it now? I don't pay the usual price...
Yeah, afford...that's a nice thought. I could stroll down the capital unit affording things...
Who's counting that? I don't know how much I think about it. Any night you and your girlfriend get handsy---that'd be a whole bunch, right?
...That sounds weird. What counts as "thinking about sex"? I mean, you'd have to to rack up a ton if you've got someone special...
...What do you mean, lasts? Do they die after having sex? That would explain why they're so scared of us.
...What happens after five minutes? You just stop when you stop. What, does it hurt them?
I'm beautiful. And you're overthinking things.
I'm just being honest. Worry less about me and more about taking care of yourself.
...Then she got assigned to the Dread team, and broke formation by riding my tail. We got caught in an explosion, and marooned in Mejare's asteroid field...
She was such a paaaain! They stuck her on my team. And she was so pushy, she caused an accident on her first mission, and we both ended up stranded...
Ugh, don't start freaking out. You're ruining my moooment! Give your explanation right after...
...I thought I did. Well, shut up and get your thoughts together, OK? Don't make a scene during my big reveal!
But that's just the fur coat over top of it. The main piece is this lovely pink nightgown that shows off my chest--- o-oh, but not like this...
The coat is warm. Plus the cute pink slippers...but the nightgown, it's just as flattering as this---dress. Ahahaha...
Something's pushing my buttons, alright. But I'll be the bigger girl and lay it down, like I was going to.
I was going to drop it first anyway. It's a gesture of peace, despite the---aggravations.
Isn't it wonderful? I couldn't go without sex appeal---just look at me. It all works out so perfectly...
Well, of course it's sensual, too. It'd be such a waste to hide my beautiful body away...
You can see why I'm so attached to it, right? If I'm lucky, we can capture a Border Guard ship and then rife through the CO's quarters.
It's a blessing whenever we raid female ships. Or old abandoned stations. Mostly it's the men, and there's never any dresses there!

I'll just drop this, then...
H-huh? Ugh. You'd know a lot about marshmallows, wouldn't you, Tubby?

I come in peace, so weapons first.
...H-hey, where do you the get the nerve, Elf-girl? You could learn the value of staying thin.

state.text: Let's definitely not do that, yes.
I'm glad we're finally agreeing on things.
Not to mention I'm popular on the ship, so you'd just be one friend out of many...
And it's not like I'm short on friends. You'll fit right in... well, not literally.

She doesn't have to make salad! That's for the cooking staff.
...And when I get some, I can eat it off her fork.

I can go get salads myself at the trapeza.
...But I love it when she feeds them to me!
I guess? I don't just sit around all day, you know. Piloting is hard work!
It's not like I don't get any exercise. Maybe I just get---enough!
I think it's pretty much been the same every weigh-in...I don't know, I don't think about this sort of thing!
Maybe? I'm not always watching my weight, OK? I worry about stuff like my hair.
She gets annoyed if she thinks I'm being wasteful with her food. So maybe manage your appetite for once.
To satisfy you? She doesn't like when I ask her to cook too much.
You can't teach what you didn't have to learn. I'm a big girl---I guess I just need a lot of food.
Uhhhn---this kind of thing just comes naturally to me. Staying thin, I mean. Maybe I just need a lot of calories to stay tall and buxom.
What "bigger girls" are there going to be on the Border Guard? They need hands who won't run out of breath mid-battle.
We don't rob civilians! Unless you're saying there'd be chunky types on the Border Guard. We might run circles around them, but not thanks to that.
You'd have to slim down first before "being a pilot" meant anything besides mopping the platform.
You'd have a hard time filling pilots' orders in reg the way you are right now. Forget being one.
Now we're talking. I wish I had some to give you...oh, do you have a camera? We'll do a whole shoot, free of charge!
Ohhhn! I thought you'd never ask! Grab a camera and we'll get started, OK? And be sure to share with friends!

case.state: S-sure...in a stellar sort of way. Have you seen those? Twin stars---where one ends up eating the other.
Uhhh...have you ever seen those systems with twin stars? You know, how one is usually bigger than the other?
Maybe you could just offer ~player.ifMale(him|her)~ food.
If ~player.ifMale(he's|she's)~ hungry, you might have the edge.
...Well, there's certainly more of you.
I'd say there's no space in my bed, but---same for you.
You're one to talk---you haven't been satisfied with a whole carton of blondes.
I don't know how many blondes it'd take to satisfy you. You just keep shoveling them in...

It's my turn, you know.
...Hey, ~player~. What she's really asking is, did you bring any food?
Would you quit talking during my turn? Hmph...well, if you wanna satisfy her, ~player~, maybe go order something.
Barnette could take care of both of us. She's one of our ship's best cooks, after all.
I'm already taken care of. And I bet you'd be happy with her, too...once she serves dinner.

state.text: It supports my breasts, and the slit helps me take stances. It's really pretty simple.
It's tight around my chest and loose around my legs. Shouldn't an elf warrior understand that?
Probably a costume or something. It's just going to be the crew, anyway.
A party with who? The crewmates I see every day. It's better to try on something that fits the theme.
It's even better to earn some praise.
I am not offering any flattery. I'm happy to give praise where it's deserved.
You could've fooled me.
Would you ever have acknowledged it?
We certainly can...
And they say it's only skin-deep.
No, I think I've looked long enough already...
Speaking of awakening, I could use a nap right about now...for this headache.
I mean, modesty before you decided to come here.
Well, you're right---it's too late now.

case.state: ...Oh, we have a big hot spring, too, where we all climbed in together. Apparently something in the water is making our breasts bigger...
...But just recently a hot spring popped up, and we all jumped in first thing. Rumor is, it's got female-enhancing effects...
Neither were we. It's not something we all chose, you know. Our living districts got shut down.
You make it sound like it was a career choice. For most of us, it was that or the streets.
Well, you need to be honest. And you've got to bond in the toughest moments...so bring a girl along for your next monster extermination.
Don't you spend your time fighting monsters? Find a girl who's willing to help, and then work your way through some hardships together.
Ugh, stop yelling at me. Are you even listening? Hey!
S-stop making fun of me! Or is there hair plugging up your ears?
"Victims? I'm the victim! How'd a girl as pretty as me end up a pirate, huh? It's their fault!
Oh, sure, they're victims. Not the people they forced into piracy. They should be happy to see someone so beautiful.
As if I care what the enemy thinks. They're the reason I'm stuck having to raid them to survive. Me! A generational beauty!
Is there really no one here for a man who dresses so well, and who can talk about them, too? I love pretty clothes.
Are you really having that hard of a time? No girls blushing as you praise their fashion sense? You saw me...
Who said you're the original? If I'm so much weaker, maybe we should duel for it.
I am not some mangled clone that Earth's Paksis spat out! Maybe you are, huh? We could find out who's stronger...
Don't boss me around...!
You're not giving orders, either. We're equals in this arrangement!
...Leading the Dread team, or if we'll ever have a home again.
I can certainly think of some...like if I'll die as a pirate. And the only photo of me will be in the captain's shrine...
But we can't accept that! We're proud to be Jura! And a man should be lucky to have us! He should be serving us...
Men stand there with their muscles and their attitudes. Why should we have to change for them? We should be sitting in one's big lap like a throne.
...Asra!
...Asra! I can picture her gorgeous little eyes already...

You're so naughty!
...I'm so naughty! It's pretty---interesting. Maybe we'll just leave Barnette out altogether...
Sheesh, is my mind really so dirty? To be honest...I've always wondered what it's like to experience me. One-on-one...
...H-hey, are you making fun of me? Jura works hard to be as pretty as she is!
W-what's with that face? Am I not ravishing enough for you?
D-don't make fun! Let's see you in a cockpit, huh? Hmph...!
O-oh, very funny---you've got more strength in one arm than I have in my whole body! Why don't I just bomb you from orbit?
Sheesh, can't you take a joke? You must be worried about something...it can't be easy down here, with all the heat and wind.
I was just teasing. I guess you have to deal with the Sun, and salt, and whatever else on a planet's surface? So it's not funny...
Oh, they'll take everyone. And it shows, from how we run circles around them! A lot of our early recruits were deserters.
It's more like the glory of the empire wants everyone participating. Our crew even got its start from some troops who couldn't stand it any longer...
So it's...50-50? We've certainly gambled on worse odds, but...ugh, what will the press think? A man's seed and a male baby?
Does your body roll dice or something? Mohhn...I'm trying to become famous, but the news back on Mejare might think having a boy is going too far.
Oh, oh, here she comes! See how dependable? OK, Barnette, give me a nice wide shot...!
Speaking of which...a strong girl always knows when you need her most! Barnette, use those steady hands...!
All that hasn't stopped a certain someone, with certain tastes, from having her fill. Personally, I find the whole thing kind of dirty...
It's not really my thing---but let's just say I, uh, know someone for whom it is. And she doesn't mind a bit...
It feels like heaven! All those hands, all over you, working out all your kinks and worries! Not to mention their excellent grooming.
Like you've drifted off into paradise! They massage your shoulders and legs, and your pores all open up, and they shave you nice and clean!
Uhhh...planets are round, Mia. They have gravity! What would even pull you down if you walked off the "edge"?
There are no edges! Sheesh, don't you have telescopes, at least? We all get pulled towards the center, not the---bottom.
Haahh...I'm not exactly in Mejare's good graces now. But maybe I can make peace with our enemy...
...Hmmn. I used to think the same things about men, you know...now Mejare thinks the same things about us both. We have to show them the truth.

...Well. They're only slightly more monstrous than pirate...
Showing we're both human might get some attention.

...Hmph. You say that like Jura's not an undesirable...
But what if she heralded peace with their fellow humans?
I'm saying you've got to start working it a little sexier. Try it right now! This isn't my big reveal anyway.
I think that's your insecurities talking. Your figure's fine---it's your movement that's stiff! I mean, what's even your idea of sexy?
Ohhh, well, thank you. But the point stands...you look pretty snug yourself.
I do consider myself pretty savory. Anyway, yeah, you'd fit in back home---because everything fits.
H-hey, what the hell do you know? What gaps? If the enemy had armor, I would just shoot them.
Wha--w-where do the get the nerve, making fun of Jura? Protection is what firepower is for! You don't try to solve everything with a sword!
...To meet my ancestors, for one thing. And to display my beautiful body to the Earth people of the past! What are you here for, to get married?
Wouldn't you take the chance to make yourself famous in your family's homeland--- before you were even born? It's a strip game, not a date.
Why not? If you look good, you feel good. Maybe you'd even stop being such a brat.
You should start, for all of our sakes. A confident Lysithea might just try making others feel better for once.
As does a spectacular flourish! Of course, nothing's more spectacular than the grace of flight, but my Dread wouldn't fit here...
You should see my Dread! A powerful force of destruction---but so sleek and refined!
We once defeated an enemy by igniting a giant gas planet. It was the moment a star is born! And Jura's shields were what pushed its pressure over the edge.
The enemy had cornered us---we were hiding in a proto-star. But instead of being crushed, we decided to trigger it! My Vandread even held the whole thing together.
Ahaha, Mitama...I wouldn't mind that. But these days, Barnette's sorting shells over in Reg half the time!
Barnette's been doing her own thing more and more, Mitama...that's why I keep calling her over, because I never want to let her go! Riiight?
OK, you don't have to yell. But how I am supposed to tell you how to be yourself? You know that better than I do. What are you holding back from?

Calm down...!
If it's all about you, then just do whatever you want! How would you dress if you knew everyone would like it?
Well, there's also the other thing...she doesn't know how to play.
Besides...she can tell you the ins and outs of any Steyr, but a straight? Clueless.
They're on the desert planet nearby. A really ugly-looking place...oh, but there's other systems where we're all still together.
Oh, they're around. Holed up on a dry red rock of a planet called Tarak...always pestering us. That's just our system, though.
Ohh, do you have pictures? Are they really clean and pretty? Jura has so much to learn...
Don't talk about attractive men like I know what that means! Let me see some!
...What? Don't you make babies with it? Oh, it's because it's slimy, right?
Oh, I did hear it's sort of...gooey. Is that why you look so disgusted? I don't like that kind of stuff, either...
What, do you fancy yourself as the lucky loaner? I just met you.
Is that really so scandalous? I mean, here? Or have you maybe been waiting for this opportunity?
Ahhn, she makes everything! Always filling Jura up so she can be at her best! Honestly, if she weren't so trigger-happy, she could be on the cooking staff.
She's great, of course! Meats and sweets and all sorts of in-between! She could never touch a Dread again and still have a place in the mess hall.
Don't you own a nightclub? Hire some hairdressers. I could talk about pilots' privileges, but just imagine the proprietor's pampering!
Even better, the pilots get special treatment! That shouldn't be hard for you---just trade some of your jewelry for employees.
See, here she comes now! OK, Barnette, get a nice glamor shot for our new acquaintance! We finally agreed on something...!
You get it! Our types must match. Oh, Barnette, we were just talking about you! Are you rolling? OK, here--we--go!
Well, yeah! Doesn't everyone? I want my own family to be just as dazzling as I am...!
What? Having a family is one of the most wonderful things a girl can do! I can't wait to start my own...!
Not where I'm from.
Well, I did think Earth would be more progressive there. On Mejare, they're not people to begin with.
Very funny. Barnette doesn't like when you joke around, OK? You made her mad...
Hey, I called her over for that, and now she's all huffy again. I hope you're proud of yourself!
Ta-daaaaaa! Barnette, are you rolling? This whole world needs to see my beautiful bust---!
...Barnette, you're heeeeere, just in time! Like the sun on the horizon, two golden globes blind the landscape---!
But you don't get donations, right? People will line up around the land to see the half-naked shrine maiden!
Then think of the impression you'll make! I'd donate to the shrine maiden who's not some huffy prude!
Hey, Police Chief, don't rush me along with dropping this thing. A wanted woman needs her rapier!
You'd better appreciate how courageous dropping my sword really is, Chun-Li. I'm a wanted pirate back home!
Hey, it's not often a wanted pirate drops her only defense so quickly. I don't appreciate your tone, Miss Li.
I'm a sweet sort of pirate, so the rapier goes first. It's my only defense---though I wonder if it could puncture your abs.
I'm a wanted pirate on Mejare---this weapon is important to me. I hope our thick-thighed police friend doesn't decide to arrest me.
Perhaps in your Dark-Age space stations, yes, I'd just float around. But on the Nirvana, we have something called artificial gravity.
You don't seriously think we still have zero-gravity spaceships, right, Daria? That's so barbaric---we use artificial gravity.
If this were the Dark Ages, Daria, then maybe your little run-on sentence would hold water. But artificial gravity is quite standard in modern times.
What are you rambling about now, Four-eyes? Gravity? The Nirvana has artificial gravity, silly---it's standard on every ship!
Are you overwhelmed at the sight of it, Elizabeth? I understand. It's one of the most fashionable things I own, next to my dress.
What do you think, Elizabeth? Didn't expect a woman as beautiful as me to be a skilled swordswoman, as well?
I have to carry around a weapon, Elizabeth. I'm a wanted woman, you know!
My rapier is both a fashion statement and the way I protect myself. It's crucial to my image, Elizabeth!
Oh, Ini, I'd make fun, but my more refined ways of phrasing things might sail past you...I'm armed because I'm a pirate!
There's a lot of nasty Mejarian imperials out there, Miss Ini. My rapier is indispensable...can you follow that?
Don't you realize my situation, Ini? ...Actually, no, I better spell it out. I'm a pirate!
What's a pirate without her weapon, Ini? To not bring this to a foreign world would make me...well, as smart as you.
I'm afraid I'm not as sharp as you, Miss Ini, so I needed to bring my rapier to compensate. I'm a criminal, after all.
They sound like a pretty rowdy bunch. You should know that I'm quite a bit more elegant than my piracy would suggest.
Do they, now? I admit this rapier of mine is primarily for style. I need to keep up my classy image in the world of piracy!
Seems your guests are as similarly image-conscious as I am. This rapier is just so fashionable---it makes a pirate look much more refined.
Really? Little rapiers like this? Outside of intimidating prisoners, I mostly keep it around to look classier than your average pirate.
...Is he as handsome and muscular as you are? I might consider, then...a mutual love of swords might not be enough.
I'm a picky woman, so a little rapier-sharing isn't enough to grab my attention. But if he's got your build...then I'm curious.
Tell your little friend I'm more of a pilot than a swordswoman, so his rapier skills don't interest me much. But any muscles he has just might.
...OK, I'm listening. Well, rapier or not, I couldn't care less...but the idea of an equally handsome, muscular friend of yours has my attention.
Yeah, whatever, Firecracker. Remember who's holding it.
Well, I am pretty tall. Listen, Blinky, you're not the first woman who's threatened me.
Maybe I should shove it in your eye so it stops blinding us all. I don't see a gun on you.
Jeez, what's your problem, Powderkeg? You shouldn't be threatening armed women, you know.
What a surprise. A man immediately disregards any notion of wearing something for fashion's sake.
Hey, there's nothing more classically elegant than a blade. Perfect for intimidating captured soldiers, up close and intimate.
That's true. Good thing I have laser rings and a glorious Dread fighter ship to handle that.
I was about to say the same thing about those ridiculous little wings of yours.
Forgive me for doubting a man's understanding of technology. I'm a fighter pilot, I'll have you know.
What can I say? I'm a fan of classic looks...and the intimacy of a blade.
Well, I do try my best. Being an outlaw is no excuse to not take care of yourself---but I guess being replaced does.
Well, I'm quite lucky to have a devoted girlfriend who keeps me well-pampered. Does your newer self come to visit you?
I am a highly-ranked pilot on our crew, you know. I have to look good---so should you, even if you're old.
Our crew is called the Magno Family for a reason. Would you consider EG Rarity your family?
Hmph! You sound like Meia, always harping on about how I should practice. Why don't I drop it, scaredy-cat?
Sounds like a certain blue-haired midget is scared of blades. Sure, I'll play along...watch it go.
Well, a sassy little drunken bluenette is certainly a sign of trouble. I'll drop it.
Is this your way of manipulating me into dropping my big, scary rapier? Well...excellent pirate negotiation, Policegirl.
My, you make a lot of assumptions, don't you? If you want to see my beauty, you should earn it...
I don't recall wanting to throw my dress off, Miss Sheena---I just said I wouldn't mind. If you can manage, of course.
Just because I'm proud of my beauty doesn't mean I'm in a rush to show it off. Haven't you heard of teasing?
Maybe you don't have as much to show off as I do, but it's called a striptease. I can't skip to the end!
Why, yes, I am! It's called Mejare---just a remote little rock across the galaxy. It's a beautiful place, but a little corrupt.
Right you are, Miss Magic-Hat! Mejare is the planet of women---and I'm its crown jewel. Or I would be, except I'm a pirate.
Oh yes. Mejare is a beautiful planet populated only by women---but it's not run very well, so I'm a pirate.
I am! Mejare is the planet of women, known for the beauty of its populace. And the corruption of its government, but that's why I'm a pirate.
And who are you to judge me, Little Miss Goddess? A wanted woman disarming herself is the bravest move she can make!
You think I'm some fanciful civilian? I need this rapier in case soldiers come after me! It's brave to let it go!
Coward? Maybe stripping naked is real exciting to you, but I live a life of crime. I'm far more naked without my weapon!
Some of us are just normal human women without magical powers. An unarmed pirate is a naked one!
You say that like it's a bad thing. What's wrong with wanting to be famous? Everyone can appreciate my beauty my that way...
Hey, Miss Bookworm---the more famous I become, the more everyone gets to see my beauty. It's a win-win.
What's wrong with me wanting to be famous? That would mean everyone would get to enjoy my beauty more often...
Every way you look at it, Four-eyes, me being famous is wonderful. I get to be ogled, and you get to ogle me.
...No, no, I'm not. Is that some kind of faux pas on Earth?
...Is there some kind of Earth sock requirement no one told me about?
Hey, my beautiful feet need room to breathe! And socks wouldn't look good with these. Are Earth women required to wear socks?
Judging by your shock, that was apparently a big misstep. Do Earth girls value their socks more than I realized?
Are you mumbling to yourself over there, Pit? Oh, do share if it's about my lovely boots.
Hey, aren't you paying attention, Mr. Angel? I'm not stripping if there's not going to be an audience.
Hey, Mr. Angel, look at me when I'm stripping for you. I'm trying to be nice here.
I understand, Pit. You're simply overcome by my impeccable choice in shoes. You can stare, it's OK.
Aren't you listening? They weren't anywhere on Earth...and I didn't pay for them. Offliners...
Oh, you won't find these on Earth, and they weren't for sale. It's quiet offline...so listen better!
Earth? I see they don't teach listening skills here in offline---these boots were stolen from Mejarian imperials!
Oh, they're not from Earth, honey...and you can't put a price on them. Oh, to be back online again...
I think I know what that means...and you're right, I take care of my boots. There's a reason I'm a pilot.
It doesn't take a genius to realize a pilot is concerned about her boots getting dirty. I like to deal with my enemies from afar.
Of course---I'm a pilot, and I keep my Dread clean to the utmost. Close-quarters combat is so inelegant.
You're absolutely right, Policegirl. I'm a delicate girl---why should I ruin my only good pair of boots when I can just pilot a Dread?
What's this all about now, Miss Assassin? Your wholesome little self wants me to go bigger?
Mm-hm. Not a pervert, yet disappointed I'm going for my boots. Yes, yes, Sheena...
I think we might be seeing your true pervertedness come out in these snide requests for more, Miss Sheena.
Mm-hm. Oh, sure thing, Miss Not-a-Pervert. You're not the least bit disappointed with how slow I'm going...
Well, aren't you forward? But of course I did---I've got a beating heart, you know!
I never made it very far in school, but I certainly hit puberty---so of course I did!
Oh, naturally. There's scores of beautiful women on Mejare, and every one of them deserves to be loved.
I think more of them had naughty thoughts about me, but yes, I did. I'm only human, after all.
Oho! Just on the prowl for a little one-night stand with a mortal, are we? I'm afraid my girlfriend Barnette wouldn't like that.
My relationship with a certain cute pirate named Barnette might sour if we started dating, Zizou.
Far from it, Miss Goddess! I'm in a happy relationship with my darling Barnette, a fellow pirate! We're going steady.
Unfortunately for you, Miss Homewrecker, I have a girlfriend named Barnette. And I think she's Oma material!
So does everyone. That's what makes them so great for this game!
Why do you think I wear them? Well, mostly for fashion, but also to rip right off if some hulking soldier thinks she's clever and tries to grab me by them.
So do I, sometimes. That's how good they are at fooling people!
What, are you concerned about my modesty? Because I'm not...but I do enjoy teasing people with these.
One of my favorite tricks, Missy! Now if you can guess how my sleeves stay on, I might be impressed.
Hey, what's this all about, Natsuki? Competing for ~player~'s attention?
You're not very good at disguising your intentions, are you? I'll leave ~player~ to you if you want them so bad.
Hey, I'm the judge of who gets to be with me. ~player~ is kind of cute, but I guess you'd get all incensed if I made a move.
Forgotten I'm taken, Fun-size? ~player~ is cute and all, but we can tell you like them.
The secrets of Mejarian fashion, Pit! It's not for the male mind to comprehend!
Let's just say it's a little tight around my elbows. But the look is so worth it!
Come now, Mr. Angel. I can't give away all my secrets, can I?
Good question. Maybe I'll tell you if you can manage to get them off me.
That's for me to know and you to never find out, unless this table decides to get its act together.
Who knows, Pit? Maybe you'll find out next hand! Could my dress be next?
Isn't it? It lets me flourish and move my arms without any restrictions! I almost like it as much as being online.
Heehee! You do have good taste---the only thing better about my dress is my main-roster spot.
I can't bind my arms to this dress when I'm in the heat of battle, you know! Would EG Rarity spot these?
Hah! I personally prefer the belly-button neckline this dress offers, but you're right---it's so liberating! Like being online.
What, don't you think my sleeves count as part of the dress? You're not going to arrest me for fooling you, right?
Not yet, Policegirl! I can't just skip to the finale...not unless you arrest me.
I do hope you're not a dirty cop, Sei. You sound annoyed...I'd hate for you to get mad and accost me.
Oh---all my teasing has Miss Policegirl miffed. What'll I do if she takes me down for it?
So many questions! It's nice to win another fan. I think I get my confidence from women always complimenting me!
It's really a feedback loop. I exude confidence, and girls love me for it! Which makes me confident.
I feel like I'm being interviewed! I always wanted to be a model...I guess I'm so confident because people love me already!
Well, when women foam at the mouth over your hips, it tends to improve your opinion of yourself. And then you become more confident!
Enough with the flattery, Zizou. I may be a flirt, but I have my fidelity to think about!
Still trying to pry me away from Barnette, are you, Miss Magic? Give it up already.
What kind of lover would I be if I let a shrimpy little goddess steal my heart away? Your flattery won't work.
I get compliments all the time, Miss Goddess, so don't think a little lip service is going to make a cheater out of me.
It's called a striptease, honey. I wouldn't expect you to understand, since you came here in a swimsuit.
What fun is a striptease that skips right to the end? You walked in with your vagina poking out, Miss Leotard.
Jeez, Miss Fistfight, you really are about as smart as a man. I'm teasing you, silly!
Too many blows to the head, Cammy? It's all in the anticipation! You know, a striptease.
You wouldn't appreciate my breasts as much if I got them out right away. Try wearing some jewelry over that skimpy leotard and you'll see what I mean.
Maybe Earth is different, Daria, but poker matches tend to be social affairs...on Mejare, anyway.
Not everyone likes to clam up and cross her arms during a poker game. Mejarian poker is certainly a time to talk.
Isn't poker the perfect time to socialize, Miss Library? I think you're not talking enough.
Would you rather we all stripped in dead silence, Short Stuff? I don't know about you, but cards are a good way to get to know people.
Aren't you here to ditch the books and socialize a little, Daria? You should talk more---our quartermaster always breaks rookies in over poker.
Juri, have some patience! Didn't your Fama teach you good manners as a girl?
It's not so bad, Firecracker! Look, this holds part of my dress up! Good things come to those who wait.
Awwww, am I stripping too slowly for you, Same-Name? Your parents should've taught you to be more considerate of others.
Well, I'd get naked, Juri, but you're just so scary! Besides, this'll teach you how to be patient for your guests.
I'm opening up a whole new world of fashion for you, aren't I?
Let's just say I'm the exotic alien woman who's come down to Earth to show you the fashion of the universe.
Am I blowing you away with my accessories, Natsuki? I know I must seem so exotic and foreign on this little rock.
Is Mejarian fashion really so strange to you? I'm glad I could serve as the ambassador.
Simple---everyone expects it to be the first removal. Like you were the first removal when new Rarity came out.
