That's a huge gun, Miss Moxie...men's mechanical weapons are so noisy and inefficient. Don't tell Barnette I said that.
So, uh, besides being blue, what's your deal? You're all sweet and polite now.
Can't say I prefer blue hair, but you're certainly a lot sweeter now. What happened?
Normally I like blondes, but at least you're not waving a gun around and cursing anymore. Nice tradeoff.
Blue hair is more exotic, but blonde is far more beautiful. Still, I'll take this polite version of you over the alternative.
This is so freaky to me, and I've dealt with the Paksis's weird energy. Do you just switch all the time?
Are you really bouncing back and forth like this all the time? Like, do you have any friends?
Must be hard getting to know anyone when you keep losing your memory. How do you deal with always switching?
I can't believe you have split personalities. Where does the other one go? How do you make friends?
Bless you---oh no.
Who sneezed---eep! N-not Launch!
Ack! Why'd you have to sneeze again?
Eek! N-not again! My heart can't take this!
...You're not from Earth either, are you? ...Or human. Or cute.
Say, Miss, I couldn't help but notice your...eye. What planet are you from, exactly?
And here I thought I'd be seeing some Earth women in this place...or that I'd be the most exotic one.
Always nice to look a woman in the eye. Singular.
I guess they don't value depth perception on whatever planet you're from. You must be a real steal.
Magno Vivan's pirates accept all women...but with depth perception like yours, you wouldn't make it as a pilot.
Planet Pandora, was it? What a lovely name! I might have to retire there with my darling Barnette when we're older.
Pandora sounds like such a gorgeous name. I think I'll call my first daughter that---surely Barnette won't mind.
Barnette and I are always discussing baby names. Pandora sounds positively wonderful!
A hunter, eh? And what do hunters hunt on lovely little Pandora---a cute name, by the way.
Hey there, Little Miss Witchy-watch. What's a nervous bookworm like you doing here in your Halloween costume?
Don't ask me how a nerdy schoolgirl ended up in this seedy place, but I bet those glasses are going to fog up even more. What's with the witch costume?
Hey, Four-eyes, why'd you wear your witch costume to a game where you have to take your clothes off anyway?
Can you even see the cards behind those thick lenses of yours, Miss Magic? Why are you all dressed up in a witch costume, anyway?
Ohhh, what a cute little egghead! You look like our ship's engineer---except she doesn't dress up as a witch.
Do you really yield "light magic"? That has so many applications---I already have shimmering golden hair and a stunning presence, but to literally shine a light...!
So from what I understand, you have the power to make your own spotlight when you enter a room? Girls already tell me I'm like a shining presence.
"Light magic" is just the X-factor I need to take my elegant stardom to the next level. My Dread's already started glowing---with that, I could illuminate a room as well as the battlefield!
After seeing my Dread glow with magical light, I can believe you can shoot out beams of it. And I'd like to learn how myself---imagine the hearts I'd capture!
Ooh, an Earth woman with green hair! My girlfriend Barnette has green hair...and she is the cutest thing!
Ooh, I didn't know Earth women could have green hair! I've always considered it the most cutely exotic thing about Barnette.
A sword and lovely green hair? You must be a sign that Barnette and I are ready for children.
Ooh, green hair on a woman never fails to get me going. But don't worry, my verdantly-colored girlfriend can handle the rest.
Hel-looo, camera! Over here---get whatever angle you like best.
Omigosh, you brought a camera? A sign from the heavens! Now all of Earth will get to see my beautiful naked body!
Looking to get some photographs of the exotic alien woman, were you? But now you've got a whole different reason to capture me.
Go right ahead with that camera. It's always been shameful how I've been in the media for piracy instead of beauty.
Judging by that sword, you're not from Earth either, Miss Crystal. Where can I get one of those?
Don't ask me why that thing is drawn, but damn if it isn't more impressive than my silly little rapier. Got any extras?
Ooh, I like the look of that glowing sword! Even Mejare hasn't though to put its lasers in blades yet.
I could do for an upgrade on this rapier---would you please refer me to the planet where they make those glowing swords?
...Is someone playing a Halloween prank on me? Where are your eyes? How are you floating? Earth...
Don't get me wrong, Mejare has Halloween just like Earth...but we just dress up. That doesn't look like a costume.
...OK, it's hard to comment on what's weird about you when there's so much to choose from. Do I start with your floating or your eyes?
...Is this Earth? Did I get the right planet? Because you like even more alien that I do, with that skin...and no eyes.
Hey, what were those noises you made before? Didn't sound like the common language...
...What's the name of that language you keep slipping into, anyway? Some sort of Earth code-talk? I only speak the common one...
Bilingualism is so impressive, Marinette! I only speak the common language...I don't even know Mejarians' codespeak.
So you speak the common language, but also this other one? What's it called? Because it sounds so cute!
Forget the common language, Marinette, your "French" sounds like the most romantic thing! You've got to say some more.
Oooh, Marinette! Can you say some more "French"? My heart beats faster every time your tongue slips!
You should say some more French, Marinette! It's got the silkiest sound to it---it makes my heart go wild!
Oooh, Marinette, since it's your turn, can you throw out some more of this "French"? It sounds like a lover's language.
Don't stop now! I hope I'm not imposing...but I'd love to hear some more French!
Your language is the absolute coolest, darling! Say some more for me, if you don't mind...I hope I'm not being a burden.
I'm not demanding too much of you, am I, Marinette? I just love your language...and this should take your mind off stripping.
Normally I'm interested in women's tongues for other reasons...but with you, I can't get over how cool your language is!
I think I'm jealous, Marinette! Not only are you the cutest little blueberry muffin of a girl, but your language is to die for!
Oh, I dressed as a vampire once for Halloween! Barnette even says I have fangs when I get sneaky.
Red and black is such a daring combination! My dress is the same way. "Sexy Vampire" is my favorite Halloween outfit!
Oh, does Earth celebrate Halloween on a different date? I like going as a vampire, too---with Barnette as my servant.
Oh my gosh, Mavis, those fake fangs are adorable! I dressed up as a vampire one Halloween---women call me a vamp.
What'd you say you did? Train in poker? Well, it didn't save you that hand...unless they're animals or something.
So, you're all about poker-mon, was it? Well, seems you've been training all your life for this game...
These pokuhmon things just sound like more trouble than they're worth. Animals in Mejarian zoos are so dirty!
You're an animal trainer, isn't that right? Or was it poker...mons? Not following the Earth slang here.
What's with the hat? Take it off and let your hair run wild, like any woman's should!
Matting your lovely hair under a hat like that...even if you do run all the time, I just can't understand.
A killer, you said? The only killer here is what that hat's doing to your hair.
Check out Miss Exercise over here. There's no running from this game...so drop the hat and let your hair breathe a while.
...Yeah, we're gonna be here a while. This girl's dressed for the vacuum of space.
Does it really get that cold on Earth? Or anywhere, for that matter?
You're from Planet China, is that right? Must be one big snowball if that's in vogue over there.
I understand why you must be so cold. Your name is pretty close to Meia, after all.
I didn't think you'd be the first to lose between us, Meia. Maybe I'll win this whole thing!
Oh, wow. If you're taking the first shot, I might actually beat you.
Would you look at that, Meia? First blood between us. You getting sloppy?
Overconfident, Meia? Or just some bad luck?
Again? Meia, are you OK? You didn't have to take off your headpiece, seriously.
Another? Meia...you're all flushed. Just calm down...
Meia, you're blushing. You're a wreck...
Meia, this is getting embarrassing. You're a better poker player than this!
Gascogne would be so ashamed of you, Meia. Where's all that poker skill?
Still haven't lost. What would Gascogne say?
Again? Come on, Meia, you're better than this.
Really? I shouldn't be beating you at all, Meia.
Hate to throw this back at you, but where's your focus?
Yeesh. Did I pick the worst day of your life to drag you here or what?
What's got you so distracted, Meia, honestly? The tantalizing thought of male nudity?
It's a good thing you're a better officer than strip poker player, because this is just sad.
Talk about off days. You should be beating me senseless as usual.
...Honestly, I don't know what to say. You always beat me!
The stripping must really have been getting to you. I've never beaten you before!
Never in a million years would I have predicted this kind of gap between us. Sorry.
You'd be running out of excuses right about now...if you ever made excuses.
Ooh, a lady doctor! The Nirvana's only doctor is a man---I wonder if he'd lose his cool with you gunning for his spot.
Honestly, I'm torn! You're a cute woman doctor---and blonde! But our ship's doctor is a man with rather nice hair himself.
Ooh, a doctor from Earth! I bet that makes you an expert on male sexuality, doesn't it?
Ooh, a woman doctor is just what I've been looking for! Think you could help me and Barnette get pregnant?
Female and blonde...if only Duero were blond, then he'd be the perfect doctor for me. So handsome...
Hey, Miss Medicine. Since you're from Earth, I might have a few questions about men's tubes tonight.
Well, aren't you a snobby little girl? I guess they don't raise women to have manners on planet Britain.
What planet did you say you were from? Britain? Well, I like your accent, but your personality is just nasty.
Witch this, muggle that. Don't they teach you any manners on planet Britain? Honestly.
My, my. You're an arrogant little squirt, aren't you? Remind me to tell the crew to never visit planet Britain.
My, my! You work in the law? This old pirate better be careful around you.
So you do something with the law, huh? Think you could defend my murderous pirate self in a courtroom?
So what's a "lawyer" do all day? Pushing papers around sounds dreadfully boring when you're a daredevil star pilot.
I see you're quite well-endowed there, Miss Magistrate. Is that how you win people over in your legal arguments?
My, what a decorated young woman! The things politics can buy for you...and a pirate can take.
Well, well, well. A political woman? This pirate doesn't like that...don't let my similarly fancy dress deceive you.
Well, aren't you an adorably ornate little specimen! I guess with no height, you need trinkets to stand out in politics...don't mind the big, buxom pirate.
A politician? Women don't get much more boring than that. Why not turn to piracy...where the girls are tall and curvy.
Omigosh, omigosh, wait! You and Tojiko are married? It's so cool to see women in love besides Mejarians!
Wait, you're a couple? You're married? Oh, I have a girlfriend, too! I thought Mejarians were alone in the universe with this sort of thing!
Ohh, it's so nice to see married women outside Mejare! I was thinking about proposing to my girlfriend soon!
Wherever planet Japan is, I'm glad women get married there! Mejare seems so alone in recognizing womanly love...
You seem pretty harmless for a girl claiming to be a warlord, dearie. Have you ever seen space combat?
On and on you go about how you're some kind of fearsome warlord. I'd like to see how all four feet of you do in the modern era---with spaceships.
Forgive me for not being terrified by your stature, Miss Warlord. You seem more like an airhead---one who doesn't know the deadly space pilot she's dealing with.
How many wars have you fought, Pint-size? Not enough to be scary---but then, I've braved so many space battles with my glorious Vandread.
...OK, no one here has any right to call me skimpily-dressed with Bandages here running around.
What kind of sex-crazed planet considers that street clothes? And here I thought Earth was conservative.
...Seems I've walked into a game that is well in progress. Poor thing has been losing so badly!
Jeez. I'm a pirate, and I can afford more clothing than you. Too bad there's no money involved here.
Hey, cutie! You look like you've got some kind of rank to your name, with that beret---care to share any details?
Ooh, you're not a bad looker, Earth-girl! I like that exotic purple hair. What is it you do, exactly?
Tell me more about your exciting "NERV" job, Miss Military. I want to know all about Earth!
Ohoho---a military woman. Well, indulge this filthy pirate scum and share what it is you do all day.
Gorgeous purple hair---and a slender figure! Misato, I think I'm falling for you a little...want to come aboard the Nirvana and meet Barnette?
That purple hair is almost Mejarian in vibrance---and you're in good shape! Come aboard the Nirvana, Misato---tell me about men, and meet my girlfriend!
You know, Miss Misato...the Nirvana always has room for another beautiful woman. Why don't you digest that beer with me and Barnette?
Miss Misatoooo...are you curious about a woman's touch? The Nirvana has room, and Barnette is waiting for us...
Ooh, I know a girl named Misty! She's this cute little thing from Pluto---barely has any breasts at all! Must be cold there.
Why, the Nirvana has a young girl named Misty aboard! Being from Pluto, she knew her way around men better than any of us.
You're not the first Misty I've come to know, actually. A teenie-weenie Plutonian girl we have is called the same thing!
I don't think they have your poker-mon things on Pluto...but they do have girls named Misty.
Star student, huh? What do they teach you on Earth?
Check out the uniform. I was never good in school---but what is it they teach you on Earth, huh?
Mejare's schools are nothing but men this, violence that, with a little math. How does your fancy Earth education compare?
A student, huh? Do they teach you anything interesting on Earth? I was never a brainiac...
An Earth girl still in school! Have they taught you anything about men? What do they teach you in general?
Hey, Monika am I not attractive enough for you? You seem awfully dead-set on ~player~.
So, Monika, do you have a crush on ~player~? You're always addressing them.
I wasn't aware I was intruding upon a budding romance. You're really gunning for ~player~'s heart, aren't you?
Hey, Monika, I'm a little offended by your lack of interest. I doubt ~player~ likes being chased, anyway.
What's up, Ocean Girl? You seem awfully eager. Does being around men tend to hypersexualize a woman?
Jeez, it didn't take a loss for you to start piping up about stripping. You don't need a game to do that, you know.
And here we have Miss Eager-Beaver. You don't look like you have the assets to be all excited about stripping.
At least you're confident about nudity. But are you seriously just losing on purpose? Earth girls...
What's next, Ocean Girl? Your shir---I was kidding!
I imagine the shirt is ne---wait, no, I was just joking!
...You're not serious? I'm telling you, you have to tease a little!
...Ocean Girl's a total idiot. Just stripping nude right off the bat...way to miss the point.
Honey, you'd be better off putting some meat on your bones than trying desperately to show them off.
Sweetie, you're a twig. This is just unhealthy...as unhealthy as you look.
Are you suffering from this "anorexia" I keep reading about? Eating disorders? Do men do this to you?
Talk about needing a girlfriend. See what happens when you're never validated?
Is there a doctor in the building? One specializing in mental health?
...This isn't funny anymore. Now I'm just worried about you.
...This is getting old. I'm getting old listening to this.
What a surprise. Intentionally throwing the game tends to make you lose.
...Maybe I should stop hitting on men. Look what it does to you...
Is this really what Earth women are like? She's an outlier, right?
Seems running the Harvest has a tendency to scramble Earth women's brains...and make them want to play poker.
...At least she's losing quickly. Easy to do when you barely check the cards.
Oh God, she's finally doing it. Be very afraid...unless you Earth people are used to this sort of thing.
Please don't. I've learned my lesson. I'll stay on Mejare.
I'm really appreciating Mejare right now. Maybe I'll straighten up and get a normal job.
This is the last time I come to Earth. Even among Mejarian pirate scum, none of us act like this.
The storm is almost over...or maybe this is just the calm before it.
I think I'd prefer the Harvest's company at this point.
Oh, you're still here. Why not just strip more than one thing at a time? Well, too late.
I still don't know who made you wait this long to show what you wanted.
And I thought I was trying to be seductive! Here comes Miss Succubus, decked out in her Halloween costume.
Don't think you're slipping that past me. We have Halloween on Mejare...and I've dressed as a succubus before, yes.
Nice costume, Miss Seductress. Looks like I have competition for all my man-hunting tonight.
Mejare has stories of succubi, too...they really know how to tire a woman out. I guess you must have a lot of fun with men here.
...OK, Mr. Ping, do you think you're fooling the woman from a planet of women? What's it like having a tube between your legs?
Oh, you're a man, are you, Mr. China? Well, then, please explain to this Mejarian how men's tubes work...in excruciating detail.
That's not a very convincing baritone, "Ping." Men have a guttural growl...hey, why don't you explain to me how their tube-things work?
Ping of Planet China, yes? I wasn't aware women imitated men there...if you're the real deal, give me a rundown of this "penis" business.
So, Natsuki, what's with your little crush on ~player~? Trying to strip your teeny-weeny little body for them?
You realize you're not fooling anyone with your affections, least of all ~player~, right? It's clear you invited them here to strip for them.
You know, Pint-size, if you wanted to strip your eensy-weensy little body for ~player~, you didn't need to play poker to do it.
Does ~player~ appreciate you dragging them out to this seedy place just to strip for them? Clearly you have a crush...
...Yeah, I can see why you'd be comfortable here. We'd need a computer scan to find your vagina.
You know, I tease Earth girls about growing up all small, but wow. Now I just feel bad.
At least you've got those wings to buzz around to our height. Inferiority complex?
Well, there goes any chance of getting a good look at what Earth girls have got. You are from Earth, right?
Well, hi there, Miss Lullaby! That flowing blue hair is to die for! Got any romantic songs on that harp?
There's a few ways to get on my good side. Gorgeous long blue hair is one of them---and playing sweet melodies is another!
Nayru, was it? What a delicate, refined name for a sleepy girl wrapped in flowing blue hair! Play a love song on that harp, why don't you?
Oh, Nayru, look at all that magnificent blue hair! It's so exotic---so's that harp! Play a song!
Just when I get smug about my gorgeous blonde hair, Miss Bluenette one-ups me with a much less boring color. And she plays an instrument, too!
Omigosh, Nayru! You're an Oracle? Ooh, I was thinking of proposing to my girlfriend---can you see our future together?
Flowing blue hair, a harp, and you can predict things? Nayru, you're a steal! Tell me about me and my girlfriend's future together!
Could you maybe predict if I should get married, Miss Oracle? Barnette and I have been going steady for a long time now...
Wait, you can see the future? Nayru, you keep getting cuter! Can you predict if Barnette and I should get married?
My, you Earth girls have so much on your minds! And it's apparently content to stay there.
So, Miss Motormouth, how's life? Or the weather? Or your family? Or anything?
I guess you're too tiny to fit a voice box in the model. Don't feel bad---you're quite expressive.
I guess I'm doing enough talking for the both of us. And hey---that adorable two-toned hair is a statement unto itself!
Way to come in a full outfit, Miss Maid. And you're still speaking just as politely as when you're on the job!
Whoever is your house's owner must really crack the whip, Miss Maid. Even now you're using those silly honorifics.
"Jura-chan" sounds like the most adorable nickname! I've got to get Barnette to start calling me that...Barnette-chan.
You don't have to keep speaking all polite, Miss Maid. You're in the company of a brutal pirate now---feel free to join the crew.
...Are you OK there, Miss Fireball? Are you on the same planet as the rest of us?
I may be an alien...but you're certainly acting like one. Ugh...
Four arms looks useful, but I really can't get over the constant shouting. Can't you pipe down?
Hey, Earth-girl. Or wherever you're from. There's this thing called an indoor voice.
Well, well, well. We've got a goddess here, ladies...besides me, of course.
A goddess, eh? I guess that makes two at this table, then.
Just look at that shimmering green hair---and that ornamentation! But I think I'm every bit the goddess you are, hot stuff.
Just look at that---two goddesses, near-opposite color schemes. I guess I'm the evil, nasty one.
Omigosh, Palutena, that gorgeous green hair is even longer than mine! My girlfriend has green hair, you know.
How do you maintain all that hair? I have the best time washing mine...and wrapping my green-haired girlfriend in it.
You know who else has beautiful green hair, Miss Goddess? My girlfriend, Barnette. That sweet little thing is back on the ship!
So is that lovely green hair just the goddess's right? My girlfriend got hers from standard Mejarian genetic trickery.
An engineer, huh? Sounds like you and Parfet might get along---and good thing, too, because she's getting close to a man.
Is there room for another egghead woman in your life, Miss Engineer? Our current one is fooling around with our male doctor at present.
Are you really an engineer? Our ship's main mechanic is Parfet, and she looks the part a lot more. Oh, and she's dating a man, I think...
Is it true engineers will go for almost anyone? Nerdy types are like that, right? Our engineer Parfet might be dating a man...
Nice sensible little outfit you've got there. The glasses sell the sexy-and-smart look!
Working for an old woman, eh? I know the feeling. Those glasses must have convinced her you knew what you were doing.
A woman with glasses, eh? I certainly couldn't pull off the look...I guess I don't look very smart.
I know an engineering egghead with glasses---Parfet's her name. And she seems to attract what few smart men I know.
My sympathies about the premature white hair. You look a lot older than you should.
You might want to rethink those facial markings. With that white hair, they look an awful lot like wrinkles.
Couples can choose their babies' hair color on Mejare thanks to genetic engineering...there's a reason white isn't very popular.
You poor thing. Our captain's ancient, but even she still has color in her hair.
I've never been a fan of royalty, but a blonde woman in charge? Suddenly it doesn't seem so bad.
At least you've got the hair color to match your presumptuous title, Miss Princess. This pirate still might rob you later.
You damn princesses and your unearned jewelry and dresses. I stole everything I have, you know! But at least you're blonde.
So from one blonde to another, Miss Princess, how much is that crown worth? ...Just a pirate's curiosity.
Shame you're not an actual pearl. I could go for one of those...Mejare hardly has any.
No animals on Mejare means no pearls. If only you were one of those beauties...
All stretched-out like that...you're not shaped like a pearl at all! Shame, because I love those things.
Oh, to hold a real pearl in my hands! I've only seen pictures in Earth history books.
It looks like we've found an Earth girl who's just decided to embrace the whole "boring conservatism" stereotype. At least your hair is a fiery red.
That fiery red hair contrasts your rather plain outfit. But it's not a bad look overall!
Finally, a normal-looking Earth girl. I need a measuring stick to compare all these superpowered weirdos to...all you've got is that red hair.
Good, a civilian girl. So many people at this bar are such colorful characters---oh, but your hair is pretty vibrant, I guess.
Here's an interesting specimen! Most women are only pink on the inside...and you seem eager to show your insides anyway.
Hey there, Miss Ponygirl, what's with the very rosy complexion? I mean, you seem pretty excited to show us more and more of it.
...Well, let's address the elephant in the room...or horse. What's up with the pink skin? On top of being some weird exhibitionist.
Are you some kind of test subject? Whatever they injected you with to make your skin pink is making you bounce off the walls and out of your clothes.
Hey there, Miss Meterstick. Thanks for not letting my ego get too big when it came to height.
Every woman I know says I'm tall. Do you turn heads when you enter a room, too?
Oh, good, a woman who understands what it's like towering over people. The intimidation can be kind of fun, no?
Men seem to be taller than women. I guess I wouldn't turn as many heads on Earth, then...but you'd do it no matter what.
Hey there, Miss Mind-Your-Manners. You talk the talk, but that cleavage tells me you've got a wild side.
You're awfully polite for a woman perverted enough to come here in the first place. Just trying to throw us off, cutie?
Yeah, yeah, I don't buy the whole polite-and-formal act from a girl willing to strip nude in public. Just waiting for the good stuff?
You talk pretty prim-and-proper...and yet here you are, stripping nude for us. Do you have a dirty side, or did you lose a bet?
Blonde, scantily-clad, loves attention? Honey, you're a woman after my own heart.
I like the energy you're bringing, Miss Wrestler! The scant layering doesn't hurt, either.
See, you're my kind of woman! These other Earth girls are so dreadfully boring, always covering up the good stuff.
Barely wearing anything? You should know my girlfriend is the same way, cutie...only she's not blonde.
You're looking a little pale. Well, actually, a lot pale. I guess there's not much sun in the basement of offline!
Ouch. Does this Equestria planet not have any sun? Or rather...the offline depths.
Er...Mejare sings the praises of pale skin, but you're taking it a little far. Don't they let you offliners see the sun?
If your planet has a sun, Miss Rarity, you really ought to go and say hi to it for once. Or are there no windows at the offline Inventory?
Omigosh, Rarity! Are you really a fashion designer? I mean, you're pale-white, which is weird, but---oh. The old Rarity.
Talk about a big ball of misery. Even your skin has turned all blue in despair.
Show your face! Or are you trying to hide that weird blue skin? Don't worry, it suits your miserable demeanor.
I guess I'd be miserable, too, if I had the complexion of a grapefruit.
I should bring Meia over here for some counseling. Even she's not as miserable as Miss Blueberry here.
I don't think your complexion quite matches anymore. You've really lightened up!
So much for Miss Blueberry. I mean, you're bluer than ever, but showing all that skin's really warmed you up!
I knew stripping always makes a girl feel sexy and confident! There's a reason I invited my mopey squadron leader here, you know.
Hey, Miss Doom-and-Gloom, you're starting to look like you're having fun. That's perfect---I bet Meia will lighten up once she's naked, too!
Hey there, kiddo. Maybe you didn't notice, but this is strip poker---not a place for little girls in their Halloween costumes.
I like the wings, Remilia! And your friend's dressed as a maid. Still, don't you think you're a little young for strip poker?
Run along now, dearies! Halloween costumes are fun and all, but this is a game for adults...where we take clothes off.
Ohhh, Remilia, those vampire and maid costumes are so adorable! But really, strip poker's not a game for little girls.
Hey, now, girlies, this game is adults only. Someone give them candy for their costumes and a headpat for the road.
Hey there, Miss Gunslinger! You're not gonna fire those things, are you? My girlfriend collects those sorts of guns.
Omigosh, are those antique men's kinetic weapons? My girlfriend collects them! You should meet her.
Always good to see an armed woman! My girlfriend, Barnette, is totally obsessed with men's mechanical guns like yours.
Hey, Miss Gunslinger! You should lighten up a little and show those men's kinetic guns to my girlfriend. She's a total connoisseur.
I like the grace of Mejarian laser rings myself, but you want some serious interest on those men's guns of yours? Talk to my girlfriend.
Hmph. Normally I'd do a little flirting with the loser, but I'd rather just ignore Miss Powderkeg over here.
You know, I would flirt with you, Revy---except you're liable to start shooting at me.
I guess I should've brought my laser ring like Meia said. Gunslinger over here might get offended I don't want to flirt with her.
You might've noticed I'm trying to flirt with the others, Revy. If you promise to be nice, I can do it with you, too.
I've never met such a ferocious woman, even among Mejarian imperials. Is this the result of dating a man?
Sleeping with men isn't what made you so aggressive, is it? I might have to rethink this whole seed-collection thing...
Even the woman soldiers I've fought aren't so brutish and intimidating. Did men make you this way, Revy? Are you seeing one?

it's a good thing you're a medic, because that cute face is making my heart beat ever faster.

...Well, whatever you are, I'll admit your creators had a good sense of beauty. That's a gorgeous dress, and I love the way your hair is done up.
I'm still not sure what you're supposed to be, but at least you know how to look good. I credit your creators for designing a statue-robot with such a lovely figure.
Whatever twisted experiments gave rise to you, at least they had the decency to place a nice face over top of it. Feminine beauty smooths over everything.
Seriously, honey, why the ridiculous outfit? A cape, an oversized hat---surely you could practice magic in something more suited for combat.
Not that I buy into this magic business just yet, but is there a reason you dress up in such a silly costume for it? You've got to think about combat practicality here.
Is it true there's a man in this adventure party of yours, Megumin? I don't suppose you've managed to make advances on him.
I didn't think I'd have much to learn from such a shrimpy girl, but apparently there's a male member of your little party. Do you happen to have any experience with him?
My, my, another blonde in a black dress. You could do with a hairbrush, though---and why are your teeth so sharp?
I was going to comment on royalty from this planet stealing my blonde-hair, black-dress look, but why are you all disheveled? And---are your teeth all jagged?
Is it true this Planeptune of yours doesn't have any men, either? I was starting to think little blue Mejare was the only female-only culture of its kind.
It's actually pretty encouraging to hear Mejare isn't the only planet that's done away with men. Your homeworld is the same way, right?
I keep hearing---well, seeing you bring up all these different crushes of yours. A man named Tadano, a girl named Manbagi? Just how did a mute get so popular?
Would you mind sorting out all these lovers of yours for us? Tadano, Manbagi---I wonder if I'd be as popular myself if I couldn't speak.
You've got a lot of lovers from what I can tell, Shouko. A boy and a girl? That's impressive when you only have your looks---and your handwriting, I suppose.
Oh, Miss Jessie, tell me about this little family of yours. How long have you been married? I don't know a lot of women who've settled down.
Our crew is so full of young girls---only our communications officer comes to mind as being married with children. What's it like for you?
You know, I'm actually pretty old myself compared to most girls on our crew, just for being out of my teens. But I feel young next to a woman in her married life! How is it?
Did you really have to be eating while we're playing? At least have some dignity---I can see crumbs on your cheek.
Ugh, are you just wearing a white shirt so we can't see the salt sprinkle onto it? How about you get food after the game?
Oh, good, we'll get to see even more fat on display. The least you could do is not shovel more fries in your face while it happens.
...Say, you wouldn't happen to know a girl called M1911, would you? Barnette's always dreamed of having one, from what I can pick up when she starts gushing.
So, does this little gun-cult of yours have an M1911, perhaps a girl giving them away? I know it's some antique my girlfriend wants---it'd make a nice birthday present.
As far as I'm concerned, you can ditch guns once they've served their duty. But my girlfriend has always gone on about some M1911 she wants. Is there a girl named after that?
You know, you're going to need to get over this little speech problem of yours eventually. It's cute in a schoolgirl, but I can't see you doing many jobs on our ship, for instance.
...You're really a lovely girl, Shouko, and so smart. But romance isn't the only thing a speech issue will hold you back from. What could you even do on our ship, lift crates in reg?
Shouldn't your school have gotten you talking by your age? Imagine being a pirate---no one's going to wait for you to scrawl something down while an alarm's blaring.
...I don't mean to be rude, Shouko, but your muteness is starting to lose its charm. Maybe your school wants you to work a desk job, but I didn't think I'd end up as a pirate, either.
On and on about these computer games of yours. Is this something the tech-girls got exposed to in school? My family signed me up for fencing.
I should ask Parfet in engineering if she played all these computer games you mention when she was a girl. I got pushed into fencing and other athletic things since I was tall.
I took a lot of fencing classes in school. Wealthy family and all that. I'm guessing you spent that time playing computer games?
I hear you're really very accomplished in your career, Cynthia. I'm a high-ranked pilot myself, but I still make time for romance. Isn't there a woman in your life?
You still look very beautiful, Miss, but I can tell you're getting older. You'd best find a girl to settle down with before you become one of these relics you study.
You can cover half your face, Miss Cynthia, but even your hair will gray soon enough. This champion business needs to take a backseat to finding a girlfriend.
All these abandoned caves you go exploring in, and you're forgetting the one between your legs. You should find a girl to go with you, like Barnette flies out with me.
So, Earth schools have their share of bookworms, too, do they? I never really hung out with those types. I was the big girl in the gym, for the most part.
You spend your schooltime in the library, I take it. I was usually pushed into sports on account of my size.
I was in school just a few years ago, and it feels like such distant memories. All the bookwork was just so dull---I don't know how you read so much.
...Well, if you're not hostile, then I'd hate to keep arguing with you. Did your creator include every piece of the female form?
I don't enjoy sniping at a beautiful woman, you know, even if she's a bit mechanical. Were you made to be beautiful...down to the last detail?
I've really never heard of these Pokémon things you raise, Miss Cynthia. They're little animals, right? Can you show me a cute one?
I'm glad even the animal trainers of this world know how to dress well. Do you have any cute "Pokémon" creatures I can come pet?
...Just so we're clear, you work in adult films? That's maybe more experience with men than I bargained for.
...You're a pornographic actress, right, Miss Jessie? Just one of those men's rods must be enough on its own, but they're---what, passing you around?
Oh, no. Is Earth nothing but you crazy floating types? Don't you float over this way until you start acting friendly!
Oh, I'd hoped to meet some normal Earthlings, not another psychic one! So full of herself that she floats off the ground. What is with this planet?
I see blonde beauty is alive and well on this planet. That said, you could really stand to brush all that hair into something resembling a style.
Yang, right? You're very pretty, but you're doing your beautiful blonde hair a disservice---it looks like you've never even seen a brush.
How can you walk around with your hair in such a mess? Normally I wouldn't care, but when I see tussled-up blonde hair---well, I feel mine fraying from exposure.
Are you---made of slime? Ugh! That, or you're some flickering ghost of a girls' night gone wrong. What's the matter with you?
Ew, what are you supposed to be? Some kind of ghost girl? You look like you're all gooey, and who knows what's in there all these drugs you're pushing!
We Mejarians need Dreads to shoot and fly around. I suppose Earth has a whole fleet of fighting robots, but nothing so human-looking. Are you really a machine?
If you're not just some girl playing robot, Penny, I'd love to see you in action. We don't have anything that advanced on Mejare.
Well, I didn't know we'd have an older woman joining us, and a very wealthy one, I hear. And if you're married to a man, that makes things doubly interesting.
I see this place welcomes women that are on the mature side, as well. You've got to tell me what it's like having a man in your home---quite the expensive home, I hear.
Well, aren't you stunning? We seem to have similar tastes for the elegance of ancient weapons, as well.
Windranger, hm? I could go by The Red Claw if I were feeling proud. But there's no denying you're elegant, and your weapon of choice is even older than mine.
What's this "magic" all about? I've already met some creepy Earth boy who could move things with his mind. Don't try anything funny.
Muggles this, magic that. I haven't good experiences with superpowered Earthlings, you know, so don't point that thing at me!
"Mordred," right? You could stop gnashing your teeth about this Grail business and play nice, you know. Or head over to the bar, where they probably have a few.
Are you sure you're at the right table? If you want a "Grail," they probably serve drinks in the lobby. You know, if you don't shout at them.
Just when I thought I'd heard every name for a woman, along comes Mordred. It might not sound very beautiful, but that doesn't mean your personality should match.
If you ask me, "Mordred" sounds harsh enough to be a man's name. I guess you decided to act the part.
I suppose you spend all day floating from bar to bar, giggling and teasing the patrons? Life must be so easy when you don't even have to walk.
So what exactly does a magical floating princess do to fill her time? When even gravity is no issue, you must just drift through life.
You seem pretty bright with all your talk about statistics and calculations. You could join our engineering team, maybe teach them all your Puyo game.
We could use a girl like you in engineering, you know. All those statistical calculations help out on a starship as much as in this Puyo business.
Is this some kind of Halloween costume? You're going to trip and stab yourself. Some civilian girl shouldn't be waving a knife around, anyway.
You're making a lot of conversation for a girl who's got her face behind some voodoo mask. And why have you got a knife? Quit creeping me out!
Are you...feeling OK? Is the prank that you're acting like you're not dressed like a psycho killer? Well, don't hurt yourself and start bleeding on me.
Oh, seeing tiny little girls always melts my heart. You work with computers, right? I'd probably try to "model" myself a little taller, too.
How's the weather down there? No wonder you sit at a computer making "character models." There isn't much of you to work with!
...You have a hard time being alone, don't you? I mean---functioning alone. I'd always like someone around to protect me...
...Hey, you kind of need others to help you with things, right? Like if you were in trouble and couldn't write. Jura feels that way, too, sometimes...
Mohhn...when Jura is alone too long, I just feel helpless. Like I can't think straight...and what if we were attacked then? Do you have those thoughts?
You're awfully proud of training under this "Jeralt" person. I got some swordplay instruction in school, and I hardly remember the woman's name.
I think we heard you the first time you boasted about your mentor. I can't say I fell in love with the nasty old fencing instructor in school.
You're the axe-wielder, right? Some of the rookies can hardly believe I'm a high-ranking pilot. That's the price you pay for beauty and strength.
Just a few years ago, I was the talk of the school halls myself. "How can such a beautiful girl be so good with a sword?" It's the same way on our ship now.
You must get a kick out of dropping jaws, right? First with your looks, and then with your strength. I know the feeling.
What made you choose an axe of all things, anyway? It's just---well, there's nothing elegant about it. It's a big blade cavemen would use to chop heads off.
Don't you think an axe is a little barbaric? It's the kind of thing I imagine men hacking into rocks with back before space travel. A sword has elegance.
Oh, I was worried I'd see Earth girls in all sorts of strange colors. Who knows what planet's up to? They've turned you into a stammering wreck, as well.
...So this is what Earth's been making, huh? I'd be shy if they stuck me with something that turned me all yellow. At least they left your hair alone.
Sonic, Sonic, Sonic. You're pretty lovesick, aren't you? In my experience, men don't respond well to women chasing them.
It might be rich for a Mejarian to tell an Earth girl about men, but they don't seem to like assertiveness. That may be why your "Sonic" keeps running.
From what I hear about this "Sonic," Earth men don't like attention, either. But if you don't assert yourself, how are you supposed to get what you want?
"Free information" doesn't sound like the motto of my homeworld's encyclopedias. I had to go raid the men's planet just to see what they really looked like.
I remember leafing through a Mejarian encyclopedia one homeroom. Its picture of a "man" looked more like a big, hulking cockroach. And I don't think they'd want me editing that.
Who is this? You sure are eager to please. I absolutely love being pampered at our spa, lying back and letting them wash my hair, massage me, file my nails...
Are you really offering "pamperings" to strangers free of charge? Well, I'd be happy to accept. I never even feel like flying unless my hair is set just right.
Do I have to pay any Earth credits for one of these "pamperings"? I feel much more energetic at full beauty. Barnette doesn't do everything...
Being a high-ranked Dread pilot has its perks on our ship. Our attendants always know just where I'm aching after a battle...and you're just giving away these "pamperings"?
I think I hardly ever touched a computer growing up. I was the more active type...even when puberty weighed me down a bit. Do you really spend all your time in simulations?
I've always been bigger and taller than other girls. My talents would've been wasted at a computer---as would my beauty. But a flight simulator wasn't enough for you, I guess?
You do not look like the kind of girl I'd expect to be obsessed with computer games. After all, you look kind of like me.
This little robot friend of yours sure likes to run his mouth. I know the feeling---our ship's navi robot is the same kind of irritating "helper."
How did I fly all the way to Earth just to run into another annoying robot? Even Pyoro occasionally says something intelligent.
Ugh. Just when I thought I'd escaped Pyoro buzzing around my head, here comes "Wheatley." At least he can't fly.
Can't these helper robots ever have a female voice? Pyoro at least used to belong to the men. Why are you letting a male robot speak for you?
...Chell, couldn't you at least have picked out a female-sounding robot if you're not going to pipe up all game?
...I don't suppose you're good with kids, Wheatley? Babysitting has kept our helper robot busy lately.
If I'd had a baby by now, maybe I could've let her play pattycake with Wheatley. Call it robo-sitting, since it sure keeps Pyoro busy.
You're not going to turn this nice, relaxing game into a rock concert, are you? I hate the kind of music that nearly shakes my makeup off.
I signed up for strip poker. Unless this planet combines that with karaoke, you'd better not start screaming into a mic. You'll ruin my hair!
Ugh, I remember you punk-rock types hitting it big when I was in school a few years ago. Even then, I thought all that screeching noise was going to give me wrinkles!
These "Pokuh-mon" things you train sound so beastly. Breathing fire, shooting thunderbolts...you didn't bring any, did you?
Is this Unova region really just crawling with dangerous wildlife? Well, I hope you kept them all in their cages back home.
You should see all the idol types filling Mejare's airwaves. We learned it from somewhere...maybe I should sing alongside my future modeling career!
You know, I sing some solo parts on the Magno's Family crew choir. Maybe I'll become an idol myself once I get my modeling afloat.
What are the odds we'd stumble across a girl from a band of Earth pirates? Were your airships some middle step before you figured out space travel?
I guess you could say I'm an Air Pirate myself, just from after the Frontier Era. You know, spaceships and fusion cores instead of flying boats.
You know, you should appreciate how I've been vocal about your weight problem. The other girls on our crew would snicker behind your back.
I hope you realize that other girls are laughing at you as you pass them on the street. Be grateful I actually make my feelings clear!
Whenever I meet someone, I tell them how I feel. It's a courtesy---I could have just gossiped about your gut like everyone else.
The black dress is a fashion choice that spans the cosmos, I see. How lucky---we can't exactly chat about our tails.
I'm not sure how much I have in common with a short little "aetherologist" sniffing around. At least our color coordination matches.
So, have you found any time for love between all these book rentals? I remember my first girlfriend in school like it was yesterday.
I don't suppose you've gotten any attention at school, always curled up in the corner? Me and my first girlfriend were the talk of the halls!
You must be a daring fighter among your crew, dazzling your enemies with surprising strength. That's the position I hold as a Dread pilot.
It's not easy to represent both beauty and power on the battlefield, is it? It's our curse to turn piracy into elegance.
I swear, you remind me of our little eleven-year-old nurse Paiway. She's even got a stuffed frog she's always talking to, like your teddy bear.
God, it's like someone ballooned up our little nurse. You're just as immature, giggling about the grown-ups to your stuffed animals.
Are you telling us you run with a crowd of eco-terrorists? I wouldn't join "Team Magma" just based on the uniform. That hoodie would ruin my hair!
I'm glad I've ranked up out of having to wear the Magno's Family uniforms. I definitely wouldn't put up with some frumpy sweater-hoodie.
"Princess of Hell" is quite the title. And it's meant to be some underworld? Maybe I could rule it, draped in flowing scarlet and shining black...
So you're the "Princess" of this underworld called Hell, is that right? I'm the heroic type, but there is a certain elegance to an evil-empress look, in red and black...
You know, our engineer doesn't have trouble socializing. She's even gotten close to our doctor. Do you ever bathe with anyone?
I guess you've been cooped up in the lab too long? Our chief engineer is pretty social. Maybe you should try a hot spring.

state.text: Hey, are we going to get an explanation on those friends of yours are fading near the legs? It's like they're---ghosts, or something!
A-are those girls---dead? And haunting you? Oh, why did I think this planet wouldn't have all sorts of horrors on it?

case.state: So, as someone new to being human altogether, do you find yourself more interested in men or women? I hear Earth would have you think I'm unusual...
Sometimes I think of myself as beautifully sculpted. Since you were made, not born...do you even see girls in that way? Or only men, like the rest of Earth?
From what I hear, you're pretty high-status as far as Pokuh-mon training goes. Have you crafted that into a media presence? Started some fashion trends?
You must get plenty of media attention, being such a hotshot trainer. If I were you, I'd take the chance to model swimsuits, do photoshoots...
So, uh, Miss Maye---you've been raising your daughter for all this time, and you haven't tried to remarry? I'd just hate to be alone like that.
I heard about girls' mothers dying sometimes, but even then, the other usually remarried. Have you not been looking for---I guess another man?
You know, a lot of girls on our crew would call me the life of the party. But I approach that with a certain elegance. Not just guzzling booze.
So you're just spending your---afterlife doing shots and partying? That's not really my idea of socializing, other than in the trashiest sense.
You know, I had a crash a couple years back where both my arms were broken. What annoyed me the most was that I couldn't brush my hair.
Your situation reminds me a crash I had where I broke both my arms. It was some stupid exploding decoy ship...I couldn't stand not being able to fix my hair.
Is "Wasp" really what you went with? I mean, the name, the costume---it's not a sexy idea. I'd personally stick with "Jan," the costumed beauty.
Did you really pick out the whole "Wasp" image for yourself? I mean, they're just gross---I hated it when girls thought my Vandread looked like a crab.
You know, my home planet would classify men as dangerous beasts to be captured and trained. You'd probably be wearing an antiseptic suit, too.
These really are beasts you capture, right? Not long ago, I would've put men in that category. Seal them in little balls to keep their germs away.
Playing around you is starting to feel like home. You sound just like Parfet, our chief engineer--- fast-talking and bubbly.
Hagh...the girl who runs our engineering sure can talk our ears off sometimes. Just ask her about machines... she's got a voice like yours, Dawn.
I just realized---you sound like Parfet, our engineer. She's so in love with machines--- you'd sound even more like her if we got you gushing about these "Pokémon" things.
Why exactly can't you touch other people? I can't tell if you're joking about that. It's like the rumors we used to believe about men's germs.
You know, we used to think touching men would make you deathly ill. And now you're saying you have some kind of deadly skin condition?
Deadly to the touch, huh? We used to wear full spacesuits around men for fear of the same thing. Is this just a story to keep hands off you tonight?
The Princesses of Power...what an elegant title! I think you should make me an honorary member.
So, what does it take to be named a Princess of Power? I've clearly got the looks, and I can show you my Vandread if you doubt the power.
Are those some kind of...cultural tattoos? I'd never want to mark up my skin like that...
Oh, I never understood the girls who get tattoos. Maybe they've got cultural significance on Earth? Even still, they'd never wash off...
Would it surprise you to learn I had a maid growing up? A lot of girls did in my living district. I guess there's a reason I love Barnette cooking for me...
You know, my family used to have a maid. Even now, I still love it when Barnette waits on me hand and foot. I think she had one, too, to clean all those antique guns...
Is there any weapons training to this Knights program? A few years ago, I even surprised myself with how well I first handled a blade.
Back in school, I got pushed into some fencing lessons. It turned out to be pretty good weapons training for a pirate. Do they make "Maid Knights" do anything like that?

state.text: ...Ugh. Ugh! What's this slimy, gooey blob slithering around for, pretending it's a girl? If you come near me, I'll slice those tentacles right off!
Ew! I hate gooey things---why are we playing with some big pulsating tentacle monster? Don't make me have to pick which eyeball I'll skewer first!

case.state: You know, I once saw some new recruit begging us to let her bring her piano aboard. My girlfriend got a pass because she brought her gun collection.
I remember seeing a lot of "star musician" girls at my school cry how they couldn't bring any luggage when they joined our crew. Barnette brought her guns.
What---gave you those? Oh, God, I can't imagine being so scarred and disfigured like that. Not that it's hurt your attitude.
Ugh---ugggghh! I---well, let's just say I wouldn't be so cheerful with big gashes all over my body. What happened to you?
Is it normal for Earth girls to scout partners in a strip bar? I know I'm here, but my heart is already claimed.
Hmph. Sorry about your Spousal Search, but I'm happily taken. Strip bars can't be the best place to look on this planet, anyway.
I hear you know how to don a more elegant fashion sense when the time calls for it. Wouldn't this have been a good night to show it off?
Hahaha! I'd say you look like me in my pajamas, but even those are better. But you have a classier look, right?
Hmhm. It's like peering into a few years ago, seeing a such a competitive schoolgirl. Are you the sporty type like I was?
Too bad my schooltime came to such an abrupt end. I'd have graduated not too long ago otherwise...you remind me of how I always took what's mine. Athletics?
I don't know what Earth's problem is with showing skin, but that outfit is right at home on my native Mejare. It's too cute for a girl my size, though---you know, a goddess.
Noire, right? Lastation and Mejare might have more in common fashion-wise than with Earth---but we tend to reserve "goddess" for girls with my measurements.
I hear you've got a taste for the rapier, too. Is Earth not dangerous enough for you to bring yours?
You know, if you'd brought that rapier I've heard about, we could've done some comparisons. You must not consider this planet much of a threat.
I hear you've got a reputation as a chef. That's one of my favorite things about my girlfriend, Barnette! She's pretty proud like you, too.
You wouldn't think my girlfriend could crack an egg with anything but the butt of her pistol, but her cooking is to die for. You know your way around a kitchen, too, right?
I admit I've got a bit of a sweet tooth myself. Cakes, yule logs at Christmas...mm, especially powdered sugar! What am I supposed to do, tell Barnette I don't want her cooking?

So, you've got a thing for sweets?
...I do, too. Everything my girlfriend bakes is so delicious...oh, she even drizzles icing on them!
Stealing treasure...all we ever steal are ships and supplies. It must be nice to have the government on your side.
We're so preoccupied with getting our hands on food and fuel. Too bad treasure would weigh us down, hiding from imperials instead of working for them.
Hmph. The government elites hoarding the riches for themselves? Tell this pirate something she doesn't know.
Burying bodies isn't your idea of pleasant conversation, is it? Maybe this planet was always obsessed with death.
...Are Earth girls all this morbid? It'd fit my experience, but I'd rather not chat about corpses for our strip game.
Robes and staffs just remind me of Mejare's imperial guard---shifty and overzealous. What kind of work do you do for this big temple, anyway?
I hope you're not as snooty as the Imperial Temple types we have back home. Always telling the commoners to mind their own business, and their place.

state.text: Ngggh! Did we get followed here? Or is this---the power armor every Earth guard gets? It's like a walking Harvest cube...!
I-is this---the standard armor for an Earth soldier? All that pulsing energy---it's just like the Harvest drones! Get away from me!

case.state: And I think of our trainee as a ditz. You can barely string a sentence together and keep eye contact.
Ugh. I should apologize for getting testy with Dita sometimes. At least she can speak Japanese properly.
You know, Barnette would look so cute in a cat-ear headband! I could even pin a tail on her.
You make me think I should dress up my girlfriend in some cute cat costume. She can be feisty in a bad mood, after all.
Haghhh...it's tempting to dwell on the past, but we've got to look to the future. Do you understand what I'm saying?
You're a little outdated, right? It's hard for me to let go of how I used to live, too. But we can't just give up on tomorrow.
"Girlfriend"? No thanks, I've got one. Now I understand why she's so clingy.
I leave for one night without Barnette attached to my hip, and everyone starts calling me their girlfriend. I'm taken!
Hey, shorty, you're not cool because you jot down snotty comments. It's just an awkward way of running your mouth.
I like to speak my mind, too, but I know that means I can't be the cool, quiet type. Using some chalkboard is just...inelegant.
I usually take the red meat over the fish. Barnette says it's loaded with calories, and I remind her I'm a lot bigger than her.
I know fish is healthier, but someone on our ship's got to take the steak, right? It's so savory, and melts in my mouth...if anyone can use all those calories, it's me.
Call you "Mom," huh? I want to have a baby soon, but to be honest, I'm worried it might put some chub on me. Any firsthand experience?
Hey, does an older woman have any success stories with baby fat? It's the big thing I'm worried about, pregnancy-wise.
Do you have any of those Vulpix pups? I've seen one---it'd make the cutest pet! So elegant with those little tails...
A full-grown Ninetales is too much, but I'd love to put a little collar on a Vulpix and feed it! I bet it'd keep me warm in space.
You've got a nasty mouth, you little runt. What planet did you say you're from, again?
You're not from Earth, either, right? Maybe their idea of manners is a lot looser where you grew up.
What are you always apologizing for? I don't think I'd want such a nervous wreck treating my wounds.
Are you really an "Ultimate Nurse"? We could use one, but I'd bleed out waiting for you to stop trembling.
Don't you think you're taking this game a little too seriously? It's like you're speaking in code. I mean, "min-maxing"?
What's min-maxing, or any of the other things you're saying? It's like when our nurse thinks it's cute to talk in frog-speak.
Do you think I could become a holy woman, too? I mean, being worshipped. Gods get a lot of attention for never being seen.
I could never get into the whole worshipping thing. I'd rather be worshipped. An elegant golden ship and towering statues...
Hey, are you OK? Y-your hand---I guess it happened a long time ago? I never know what to say with this kind of thing.
U-um...I guess you're over your injury? Whenever girls have gotten hurt, and it still shows later...oh, it's so awkward.
Do any of the girls in your church wear those nun's habits? They're not as revealing as I like, but I love the look of flowing black.
If I did have to join your church, I kind of like those cloaks the nuns wear, like our captain. It might hide my hair, but a long black dress still has style.
Your church has nun's habits, right? Our old captain wears something like that. Covering my hair and legs would be a shame, but...imagine me poking out of another black dress.
Can't you talk normally? This must be a shorty thing. Save the elegant speeches for a girl whose presence deserves it.
Shrimps always feel the need to shout to make the presence known, don't they? Be quiet and leave the spotlight for the stars.
Are you really a goblin? You look more like someone stuffed a two-meter girl into one. My parents read me some unflattering stories.
Aren't goblins supposed to be all pimply and gross? You might have a cute face if I didn't have to crane my neck to see it.
Maybe I should check my feet more often. You're lucky I didn't poke your eye out---your surprisingly pretty eye. Aren't "goblins" just dirty monsters?
Are you trying to be more outgoing? Most of the girls in engineering just keep to themselves. The only one I ever talk to is our chief, who herds them around.
It's rare to see a scientist type who's brave enough to play a game like this. Sometimes I wonder if Parfet's our chief engineer just because she socializes.
So your sister's a firefighter? I think a lot of sisters end up as opposites, just so they stand out.
Sisters grow to be pretty different, don't you think? I mean, you're holed up in the lab, and she's fighting fires?
Don't you think this planet's blue enough? Anpathos is all water except for their little island. It just looked boring.
You know, I've been down on a planet that was almost entirely ocean. It may have looked pretty, but everyone was stuck on one dull little island.
Where do you shorties get the nerve to be so full of yourselves? And you're always so obsessed with cute things instead of something elegant.
Ugh. Listen to this gremlin shout about us like we're her doll collection. Why don't you save the spotlight for those who cast a longer shadow?
I can't imagine our engineering team stuffed with mostly men. Everything they build is bulky and jagged. It gets on your nerves, right?
Are you so annoyed because you do your research with a lot of men? Their machines just don't have that same elegant touch.
Have other girls told you you shouldn't be so obvious with your feelings? I just love marching right up to someone and saying how much they mean to me!
Good for you, being so open about what you want. I never liked playing little flirting games, especially with recent events.
Are you dozing off? I can't stand not getting all my beauty sleep. How am I supposed to pilot a Dread with ruined hair?
Even a pirate crew won't work us so hard we can't get any sleep, you know. I certainly wouldn't put up with it.
I can't tell where your clothes end and your body begins. That might be a sexy look, actually...but I'm not lining myself with wires.
Are you all strung up with electrical wires? If I wanted to make myself shine, I'd just get a spotlight.
Y-you're as tall as some of the men. Did you keep growing in your twenties or something? Maybe if I'm lucky!
O-oh, wow. I wonder if I've still got some growing to do before I hit your age. I already tower over most girls.
How do you stand wearing all that plate armor? Not to mention the sword itself. I build up enough muscle as-is.
Ugh, I'd never train with a sword that big, or such heavy armor. My arms would start to bulge too much!
I could never do the work you do. Trudging through dirt and grime and---infections, in some polluted dump? Dreads are clean.
Pilots do some pretty sterile fighting. How do you tolerate putting down infected animals in some contamination zone---what about your hair?
Would you believe someone called me a witch? An imperial judge, the heartless bitch!
You're the exact kind of hag the Taraks all fear. What's worse is getting it from Mejarian spears.
I have to admit, Barnette starts to sound like this when she gets worked up over guns. I just figure weapons exist to serve their duty.
"Blah, blah, rare collectible, restored twentieth century, weeble wobble"...I love Barnette, but I swear she talks like you if her sidearm gets scratched.
I wouldn't mind if you ate a few of my bad dreams. Our whole squadron getting blown to bits...I'm left with a headache the whole day.
I've been having a lot more bad dreams lately. Could you eat those and replace them with something about golden luxury ships?
What kind of introduction is announcing you're evil? You should learn some social skills at this school of yours.
Natasha Cerebellum almost sounds like Jura Basil Elden. Don't you think that'll turn more heads than "I'm in school for evil"?
Oh, don't remind me of Barnette's name the one night I leave her alone. What if something happens? I'm going to squeeze her so tight when I get back!
"Derpette"...oh, Barnette. I wish she could be here...but she'd get too jealous. And I'd never let her go!
I don't know how an astronaut ends up on the seafloor. Bikini bottoms are something I understand, though!
Wouldn't you like it if I showed up in just a bikini bottom? Maybe I'd wear that fish tank on my head for modesty.
Why does it feel like B.C.'s around here somewhere? I don't even know what she does in her free time.
...I didn't shirk some order from Buzam, did I? I mean, they'd usually come through the Dread team, anyway... why am I thinking about her?
Was the girl in the sweater too good for us? Hmph. I hope I'm not reduced to a talking skeleton one day. No skin, no breasts, no hair...
Is there a worse fate than eternity as a skeleton? All my beautiful features, wasted away...I'd rather be blown to pieces in a dogfight.
Hey, did you fall asleep in the powdered sugar? Ohhh, Barnette'd be so cute if she did that! I'd just lick it off while she baked.
Another baker? I just let my girlfriend handle that---not in facepaint, though. Seriously, what's with your fashion sense?
You're going to prattle on about your noble status all game, aren't you? If your best asset is that crown, you'd better hope it stays right where it is.
Hmph. I suppose that crown gives you the right to talk down to us? Maybe I'll just take it.
No one said you had to be dour just because you're in black. Did something not work out on your team's last "hunt"?
Hey, I'm in black and heels, just like you, and you don't see me moping. It must be the hair. Or are you busy "hunting" something?
What's your beauty routine? I spend so much time brushing my hair---I can't imagine adding a few tails on top of that.
Aah, those tails look so immaculate. Do you spend all day brushing them? I have to set aside time for my hair.
You know I've been called vamp sometimes? And in red and black, I've got succubus colors. And I even fly in red.
I wanna dress elegantly, and I love saying how I feel. And I get called stuff like succubus sometimes! Well, I guess I even have red wings.
...You know, you've got a pretty face. All that chub hasn't reached it yet. And you're wasting it!
...Haaaahn. It's not like you're ugly, you know. There's a cute face on top of that chubby body.
Your accent is so---weird. Are you OK? I've heard maybe one person who sounded anything like you---some old woman, when I was a kid.
I...I cannae---I mean, cannot understand you. No one really has an accent on Mejare, except for some ancient first-generations.
Where'd you say you were from again? I think one of our bridge crew might have family from there, too. Does "Slaintheav" sound right?
...You know, we've got a "Slaintheav" on our crew, and she's said bits and pieces that sound like the family names you throw out.
You know I had plans to be Student Council President? It's only fair that the spotlight should be on me, even back then.
High school feels like so long ago. It was just a few years! I could've been Student Council President, and sat on some elegant throne...
Ugh, when's the last time I was outdone like this? Taller, bustier...and so serene! It's refined beauty!
...Haaahn. Is this how I make other girls feel all the time? Some enormous chest towering over me with a confident smile. It's---elegant!
You're not really content just being an archeologist, are you? I want my beauty to be seen---to shine out on the battlefield!
Archeologist...don't you think it'd be a waste to hide away in the galley or something when you're so beautiful? That's why I'm a Dread pilot!
Aaah, I love the idea of suitors professing their undying love! And then they compete for my affection. But---not to the death!
What's your problem again? People flock to proclaim how lovely you are, and then entertain you? I'd love that, and I wouldn't kill them, either!
Ugh, she even has superpowers! This isn't fair. I deserve something just as spectacular!
Wasn't your one body impressive enough already? Now you can make as much of it as you want, whenever! Where's myyyyy superpower?
I don't know about filling the oceans, but my Vandread is powerful enough to drain them. It can even use the water as a weapon!
If you want to talk about an entire planet's oceans, you should see my Vandread. We defeated an enemy once by pumping seawater into it---from orbit!
If you're so dead-set on draining the oceans, my Vandread can do the job. We once used its shields to make a massive pump above a water planet!
You'd be a lot better off using a machine to drain the ocean than some animal. A powerful, elegant machine---like my Vandread mech!
Can't you abdicate the throne or something if all these suitors bother you so much? I guess it's not worth trading your castle's luxury.
I'm just not sure I buy how tired you are of all this attention. Can't you live as a peasant if you really wanted? You won't have quite as many servants.
Everyone's heard a story like this, right? A beautiful face, and a wicked heart. I'm doing what I can to break the stereotype.
I swear, your type gives beautiful a bad name. We're not all evil just beneath the surface.
Hey, even if you can lift rocks or something, it can't be easy playing this blind. Do you---need help? Um...
Hey, are you gonna be OK? I mean---I wouldn't want to walk around this place blind.
Is this some bold masquerade night on the town or something? I mean, polka-dots and a mask? And striking poses!
Even our pilot suits aren't bold enough to go polka-dotted! Is the mask the only thing keeping you that way?
You're just so cutesy for a "goddess." Don't you think I have the perfect figure for sculpture? A giant golden statue in a flowing dress?
Does your planet just love the cutesy look? When I picture goddesses, they're slender, and tall, with long legs and flowing hair...and dresses.
Does all your work leave any time for love? You know, a girlfriend. Someone to bury yourself into after a long day running Lastation.
Barnette helps me with everything around the ship. She's absolutely not allowed to run off on her own! You could use a girlfriend, too.
You're not the only one who loves steaks. When Barnette cooks me one, I know it's a special occasion!
Red meat is so vibrant and juicy. I love the way it melts in my mouth, especially when Barnette feeds me some...
What's this thing? I've never seen a robot make passes at me. Even with girls, I'm usually the one coming on to them.
Your programming's not too subtle, is it? I like being the one to approach. I mean, approach humans.
What is your bust size, anyway? Ninety-eight? Ninety-nine, even?
...Maybe I'm a little jealous, but I know some good measurements when I see them. So---how do you measure?
Ew, and people call me a brat. Jealous runts used to try and bully me back in school because puberty wasn't as kind to them.
Ugh, I knew bratty little shrimps like you back in school. They tried to make the rest of us feel bad for filling out our dresses.
You're so serious! Always on the lookout for machines attacking, right? That sounds awfully familiar.

You should try to talk more! Open up and relax while you're here.
...But I kind of get it, when there's hoards of machines after you.
Is it your psychic powers that make you so sleepy? I never get up early in the first place...
Looking at you just makes me want to go back to bed. And I usually sleep in to begin with...so this is all to keep your powers under wraps?
...You're not looking for a duel, right? Sure, I'm tall, and I do some training, but---I'm not throwing my own body at the enemy.
Just so you know, I'm not a crusader myself. I'm sure it takes more than being tall, blonde, and bladed. Don't fling yourself at me.
T-this is just some fantasy you have, right? Like, asking your girlfriend to get rough? I mean, what if it leaves a scar?
Y-you shouldn't joke being abused, you know. Someone might take you too seriously, and you'll end up with lumps, or burns---or worse.
After rocking that tight suit, I'd expect you to have kept more confidence. What're you stammering about for all of a sudden?
You're a wreck without that suit on. I guess it's that old saying about the dress making the girl, right?
Isn't there a "Pokémon" called Ruujura? I want to see that one. It must be just as elegant as I am!
Ohhh, I think I've heard about one of these "Pokémon"---Ruujura! Have you raised one of those? Is it beautiful?
Ahhhn, when's the last time I went for a swim? The jacuzzi doesn't count. I have a bathing suit, too!
Our jacuzzi feels so good, but we don't have a pool on our ship. My bathing suit is just rotting in the closet...
Hey, are you nervous about something? You've got a tense look to you, like a monster's going to jump out of the shadows.
Are you OK? You seem really anxious. It's making me anxious! Like there's dark corners of this place I should be checking!
...We get it, you have a crush on ~player~. The least you could do is not shout so much. It's giving me a headache...
I know you're madly in love with ~player~ or whatever, but can't you say so a little quieter? You're making my ears ring.
Hey, do girls ever look down on you? You know what I mean, right? Like we've got to choose between a brain and a bustline.
...Girls underestimate you a lot, I bet. Am I right? You know, not taking us seriously, thanks to our measurements?
It's your boobs this time, right? They're bigger than mine...and you've been showing more skin, too. But you seem all shy about it!
About time that bikini came off. I'm not gonna pretend your boobs aren't bigger, but you've been. I mean, why aren't you more confident?
Wouldn't I make a stunning idol? I can sing really well! Oh, but I'd want to up onstage, not just sampling for some hologram...
This whole virtual-idol thing seems like stealing the spotlight from your sampler. I mean, I have a nice voice, don't you think? So I want to be up there!
I'm more a girl of action than of words. It's no fun just describing something beautiful, right?
Poetry, huh? I never had the patience for that sort of thing. I mean, if something's beautiful, I want to go out and see it!
You are hiding things. Your hair's even dyed! Don't go around acting like you're a natural blonde, OK?
If you want to be more honest, you could start with your hair. Blondes don't need bad PR, you know! We're the image of golden beauty.
Maybe you don't feel like sharing, but you're not the only one with monsters after them, you know. Don't act like no one understands.
Are you really so hard to relate to? Creepy faceless things chasing you, trying to tear you to pieces? Let your guard down a little.
...You're so tiny! Not just short, but skinny, too. Don't girls just toss you around in all these sports you play?
I haven't been your size since grade school. Do you really try to wrestle like that? No reach, and you can't weigh anything, either...
You really should go for swims naked sometimes. Your tan will even out, and you'll be more comfortable in your skin!
Those tanlines...I'm serious about skinny-dipping! Or even just lying naked for a while. You'll look better---and feel better!
Ew, what a creep. Just go back to your books if you're going to treat us all like playthings.
What's your problem? You're being all creepy, like we're not even really here. Does this feel like just another book you're reading?
You're so serious! My squad leader is the same way. She hardly speaks unless she's giving orders. Do you have any kind of leadership?
You're just like the girl who leads our Dread team. Ice cold, and so shrewd. Are you in command of anything?
Uuum, what have all these monsters looked like, exactly? I don't wanna get the wrong idea...
When you say monsters, have you really meant---well, monsters? Like, not just men, or robots...?
Saaay, you're looking for love here, aren't you? Life is short---I bet you know that by now.
Heeey, I know things have been rough for you, but that's really why you're here, isn't it? To meet someone special. Love can blossom out of danger.
You're so hyperactive. I can't keep up with girls like you who're always rambling about their hobbies.
...Ew. Look, if you want us to follow along with your comics or whatever you're obsessed about, you need to cool it first.
Your "Amusement Club" means that I guess we have a little in common. I always help corral everyone for our Christmas party.
You make sure everyone's doing their job in your "Amusement Club," right? That I understand. Half our Christmas parties is thanks to my event planning!
Hey, before things get too heavy, you've handled a lot of guns, right? Barnette loves collecting antiques from around this time. Do you have any on you?
This is around the "twentieth century," right? Barnette says a lot of her gun collection was made then. Did you bring any, maybe in that vest you dropped?

...Sorry, you said were a "Keyblade" Master? I don't see anything.
...Oh, but that's not a challenge, just so we're clear.
Did you bring this "Keyblade" with you? I don't see a sheath anywhere. A-and I don't want a duel, for the record...
You look much better like this. The way you were acting, I was expecting scars, or maybe a flat chest.
There's nothing horrifying past your underwear, right? And you were alllll worried. You even fill that bra out.
Hey, uh...I know it takes guts to have to fight all the time. Even more to come out looking good. That's what I mean by saying not to be shy.
I know I was making fun earlier, but I think a lot of girls would just curl up and die in your shoes. So you should be proud, OK?
Our engineer could use a friend on her team. Most of the others just follow her lead, but her? She loves it---like you.
You're so bubbly. I can tell you dork out whenever you see some new gadget. Parfet, our head engineer--- she's the same way.
So you've been with someone before, right? Girls must blush and turn away when you march up to them---I love that moment.
I just love capturing a room's attention. Oh, and when I peer down at a girl and look her in the eye, and she melts...you'd know. I bet you've had someone.
Ahahaa...heeey. Two beautiful bombshells---we should join forces. That would stun this whole place solid.
Maybe it's from working on a crew, but I like cooperating more than competing. Saaay, if we put our looks together, it'd drive everyone wild.
Everyone's watching, Nami. If you're still a little anxious, I've learned how powerful combining can be. Why don't we don't we give them a sight to remember?
Hey, uh...from one pirate to another, I hope you won't be an outlaw forever. We both deserve a lot better.

..."Pirate" can't have been your dream job growing up. So---I hope you find something better soon.
...Me too.
